review_description: I enjoy this coffee. It's an excellent taste while still being mild. This is the first time it was delivered in a mailer envelope versus a box. It should be packed in a box. Luckily none of the k-cups open but the box is the unusable to store the coffee in my house. I realize these are first world problems but the whole thing smells of coffee and I'm sure one of them was on the verge of bursting.

title: Not bad, could be better
review_description:
I've come to really love this brand, but of course there's always gonna be a flaw. I think they missed the mark just a little with this one. It's not terrible and I will probably continue to drink them til they're gone. However, the flavor was just a little too weak for me.

I may try to brew it on the Strong setting and see if that makes a difference, but I think they have better flavors. To me it didn't really taste like vanilla or pumpkin spice, just sort of a weaker chai. But again, maybe I just need it a bit stronger because it is a medium roast. I don't think there's anything specifically wrong with this product, just more a matter of flavor preference.

title: Great cup of coffee
review_description:
I purchased the Caramel Vanilla flavor to make iced coffee with and it is great. It is just as good as the Keurig brand of the same flavor.
The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the packaging is too tough. When I put it into my machine I have to push the k-cup by hand into the bottom needle. If I try and do it normally I feel like I am going to break my machine. Even doing it by hand I have to try several spots as the bottom will give away without actually being pierced.
My machine is only three months old and this is the only brand I have this issue with.
That aside the coffee on the inside is great.

title: Bad cup material
review_description: Great flavor! I really liked the chocolate raspberry flavor but the k-cups are made of a thicker plastic. The thicker plastic causes the coffee maker to not work correctly. I tried it in both my Hamilton Beach flex brew and my keurig and both had troubles. The pins that puncture the k-cups aren't able to puncture it properly so it either breaks the seal on the top and spews coffee everywhere or can't make a big enough hole and then you end up with less coffee that is super strong.

user_name: Real Person from the Real World
title: Ain't Starbucks, but everyone is out of the overpriced Starbucks Peppermint Mocha K Cups
review_description:
Yeah, I got the 80 pod pack ...Gotta hit that $25 level, since i am already over paying by staying inside and ordering online where all I can see is that .44 vs .75 ...if I go to eBay, I'll just end up over paying some enterprising individual who bought up the real Starbucks out of date 3 years old pods some store sold at discount, from earning a buck... but 80 pods is a rather abstract amount until you open the box.
Quite palatable, but interestingly, nothing anywhere on any of the "buy me" pages says whether they use natural or artificial flavoring (not that "natural" is necessarily what you think it is). As for clogging your pod brewer, that's usually the bits of chocolate in the pod if you get good stuff instead of "flavored." The bits clog up the teeny tubes in the brewer. Anyway, just run a water cycle, no pod! AFTER brewing a cup and you will be less likely to clog. Personally, i suggest we all band together and buy Starbucks stock when the market crashes, and then demand management increase manufacture of the more desirable flavor pods, at least for stockholders!

title: They Might taste good ... I may never know
review_description:
Got these in because other brand was discontinued. Everything was in order until I tried to make a cup.

First try, machine cut off after 5 seconds of brew cycle.

Hmm, maybe ran out of water...!? No.
Tried rotating cup .... Still shut off.

Cleaned out the brew chamber, insert new cup.. Tried again, still shut off.

Hmm, getting worried... Machine crap out..!?
No.

Tried another brand of coffee, not this flavor, but brewed fine.

Determined that if I shake the pod, then tap the pod on the counter.... I get about 30% succes rate.

Otherwise, they dont work.... Oh yeah, did I mention...two different brew machines, same issues.

title: Delicious and eco-friendly as well!
review_description: I received a sampler of these months ago for my birthday from my housemate. I loved them! I just found them on Amazon and decided to 'experiment' with flavors. I ordered the chocolate variety pack and the chocolate raspberry truffle pack (my favorite and was my gift previously mentioned!) They are amazing! The description on the lid of each pod label is 100% correct; whatever it says that is the flavor, by golly it is -- some other brands' flavors listed is nowhere near the a actual flavor. I like the fact that the pods themselves are biodegradable and compost friendly which is very eco-friendly. I use them in my Keurig and my housemate opens them up and makes the coffee in his French press. The flavor isn't bitter or artificial tasting like other I have tried, they have a nice smooth flavor and you really don't need to add any creamer or sugar to enhance the flavor. I like the chocolate raspberry truffle with a little squirt of Redi-Whip cream on top and some chocolate sprinkles or powder as well. I served this to company and they thought I brewed this in a cappuccino machine. I showed them the pods and now they will order some as well. They are great to brew in my travel mug and out the door I go. Thank you for an excellent product.

title: 100mg CAFFEINE!!!
review_description: I bought these intending to drink them in the evening like hot cocoa. They are basically hot cocoa without the chocolate. I absolutely adore the taste. They are VERY sweet, so if you don't like super sweet things you may not like them. However, I was surprised to see when they arrived that they contain 100mg CAFFEINE! It's fine, I'll just drink them in the mornings. However it's in pretty small print so I could have missed it, which would have been bad! I checked the listing again and the text about the caffeine is indeed there on one of the images, however if I missed it others may too. So I just wanted to leave a warning about the CAFFEINE.

title: Works perfectly in Keurig 2.0
review_description:
I read the reviews before buying and was concerned I would have “exploding cups” or not be able to brew as the 2.0 is notorious for not accepting off brand k-cups.

I rec’d the correct flavor and immediately opened the box. I assume the company has listened to the customer’s feedback as the cups are no longer a thick plastic, at least my box wasn’t. The k-cups were the same as any other.

I popped it in my Keurig and it brewed a perfect cup. My home smelled like a Reese’s cup and the coffee was delicious. I will say the coffee was a little strong compared to other medium roasts because they put more coffee in their pods than other brands, but it’s nothing crazy.

Overall, don’t be afraid to buy, seems like the prior issues have been fixed.

title: Yum
review_description:
have ordered crazy cups about 8 separate times and several different flavors. I have never had any issue with a “blow out” or grounds in my coffee. I have only drank it hot but they have all been amazing. My daughter is a caramel and Carmel macchiato nut. She loves these!
To give a balanced review: the tops are a little tougher than some other k-cups I have used but this has never caused an issue. The boxes have come damaged several times. The sides are crushed in because whoever packs them (Amazon?) sometimes puts them in a bag mailer. So of course they are going to get smashed. Never bothered the actual product but if you were thinking about a gift I would take that into consideration.
I had to share the love because when I looked at the reviews there were quite a few negative reviews. Bottom line- I have never had a bad experience with these and would recommend to anyone.

title: As Far As Flavored Coffee Goes...
review_description: This is my husband's favorite flavored coffee, and brand. I don't particularly like raspberry, but even I like it. In our quest to find a chocolate-flavored coffee, I guess the biggest reality is none of the coffee bean growers can grow chocolate coffee beans, or any other flavor. The "flavors" are added in later, by all the coffee suppliers. We find Crazy Cups is the closest to the taste and aroma we are looking for. I love that that they have such a wide variety of flavors. However, since they do have a large variety, it's easy to misread them. Make sure you read the exact flavor you want to order and don't blame the company because you didn't read correctly, and make sure you give an honest review for the right products.

title: So delicious!
review_description: Last winter my boyfriend bought us a Keurig. Neither of us had ever had one and collectively both of us and our kids are too lazy to make a pot of coffee and often the coffee went to waste because it wouldn't be finished, or the coffee bags would be left open for air to get into causing it to go stale. One of the first purchases we made was for a variety pack of K Cups from Crazy Cups. Chocolate Raspberry Truffle was one of the cups in the variety pack we got. I immediately fell in love with the flavor and told everyone in our family they could have all the other ones from the variety box, that I was buying my own box of just the Chocolate Raspberry Truffle and I did and I still am. You definitely taste raspberry, it's not overpowering its quite nice and not bitter in any way. The chocolate adds a depth to it and overall the coffee itself is light and delicious with just a touch of creamer and sugar. It is definitely my favorite of all the varieties we've been trying over the months now.

title: My Morning Coffee Daily!
review_description: I drink black coffee, and wanted a coffee with wonderful flavor, so I chose Crazy Cups Chocolate Coconut. Before purchasing my Keurig I used a Cuisinart brewer, and loved it, but always had leftover coffee to pour out. Even though the pods are more expensive, it is nice to be able to save time preparing a pot of coffee. Getting back the the Crazy Cups, I simply pop a pod in, push a button, and a couple minutes later I have this wonderful cup of coffee with the essence of chocolate and coconut. Of course, if you use cream, and/or sugar, you’re going to enjoy a very flavorful cup of coffee. When I got my a Keurig, I purchased several different brands of coffee pods. In my opinion, none compare to the flavors of Crazy Cups! Definitely 5 ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Love the peanut butter flavor
review_description: I really enjoy the peanut butter flavor. The only thing that appears to be a problem the Keurig not reading the cup or allowing it to complete a cycle. I have to remove the black part that has the puncture device at the bottom, push the cup into the unit and place that black piece in it. Then when I close the it to brew, then it works. If I just pop in the Kcup and close it, my machine shuts off a few seconds into the brewing process. It is a basic Keurig-nothing high tech. I don't mind the extra step as I love the coffee.

title: Absolutely Delicious!!

So I have to brew my k-cup as soon as my coffee maker is warmed up. Unfortunately I can't change my brew temps. This peanut butter cup flavor is one of my favorites!!!! The smell when it's brewing... I can't seem to leave the coffee maker even for that minute. I am disappointed in the shipping. They sent the box in an envelope so the box was smashed and some of the k-cups dented and a couple even smashed open. That's why the 4 stars. From now on I will buy directly from Crazy Cups.

title: SHODDY MANUFACTURER'S PACKAGING
review_description: I receive this product every month, so obviously I really like the coffee. What I don't like is the manufacturer packing. This product is shipped with other Subscribe and Save items. I admit that Amazon could make more intelligent choices as to the other products contained in the shipping box but that is not the core problem. The issue is the manufacturer packaging. It is a flimsy paper barely substantial enough to be shaped into a box-like shape. The packaging can be torn with the bare hand by a child. The result is damaged and unusable pods. If the coffee weren't so good I would change brands. Instead I keep looking for another brand that tastes as good and is packaged properly. So with a taste worth a five and packaging worth only a one, I split the difference with a resulting score of a three.
cleaned_reviews: i receive this product every month, so obviously i really like the coffee. what i don't like is the manufacturer packing. this product is shipped with other subscribe and save items. i admit that amazon could make more intelligent choices as to the other products contained in the shipping box but that is not the core problem. the issue is the manufacturer packaging. it is a flimsy paper barely substantial enough to be shaped into a box-like shape. the packaging can be torn with the bare hand by a child. the result is damaged and unusable pods. if the coffee weren't so good i would change brands. instead i keep looking for another brand that tastes as good and is packaged properly. so with a taste worth a five and packaging worth only a one, i split the difference with a resulting score of a three.

title: Crazy Cups Does a Better Job with their Hot Cocoa than their Flavored Coffee
review_description: In all honesty, I'm not the biggest fan of flavored coffees because they tend to be weak in their coffee flavor. Crazy Cups makes some to-die-for flavored hot cocoas, so I thought I'd give some of their flavored coffees a try. This is the third flavor I've sampled from Crazy Cups. Like all of their blends, it smells delicious. The taste, however, is typical of a flavored coffee: okay. There's not enough coffee strength and the flavoring doesn't really taste all that much like caramel. It's not a bad cup of joe, just not my favorite. I like that this company tries to put out some unique flavor blends, but they're always okay...not great. I do highly recommend any of their hot cocoa KCups. Those always taste like the flavor and are low in calorie for a cup of liquid chocolate.

I am disappointed with this and will be searching for another brand. In the meantime I'll continue to brew my Godiva chocolate creme coffee, which doesn't come in a k-cup and doesn't brew well in the disposable cups, but is robust and chocolaty from the drip or French press.
cleaned_reviews: i used to love crazy cups chocolate coffees and was excited to see this in stock but not only is the coffee too weak to enjoy, it also has a strange after taste. i am disappointed with this and will be searching for another brand. in the meantime i'll continue to brew my godiva chocolate creme coffee, which doesn't come in a k-cup and doesn't brew well in the disposable cups, but is robust and chocolaty from the drip or french press.

Save your money and find another brand.

title: Sour taste

I liked it so much, I decided to buy just that flavor alone. I was highly disappointed in the flavor of this pack. While the one I tasted in the sample pack was smooth, this one was extremely sour. title: Horrifying! Blech!
review_description:
I'd be "crazy" to say the flavor is anything but flavorful. I tried it iced last week and thought perhaps I had added too much cream so the next day I tried it with less. Still terrible! The only salvation for this flavor was to "doctor" it by adding raspberry extract and a K-Cup of hot cocoa. And tonight some black raspberry ice cream to make a frappe. Sadly, there was still an odd aftertaste. Van Houtte has a far superior flavor and nothing to worry about this as competition. Unfortunately I ordered 80 pods of this swill so I ordered six bottles of extract to get me thru it.

Second: to say these pods are recyclable is a joke. Sure, the lids peal off but from there it's a chore. You have to empty out the grounds, rinse what remains, and then rip the filter from the weld. Then most recycling centers won't accept this size plastic - unless things have greatly changed. Keurig has some pods where the filters are attached to the peal-able lids - it comes out cleanly. Chances are these pods won't be recycled which is a shame.
cleaned_reviews: i'd be "crazy" to say the flavor is anything but flavorful. i tried it iced last week and thought perhaps i had added too much cream so the next day i tried it with less. still terrible! the only salvation for this flavor was to "doctor" it by adding raspberry extract and a k-cup of hot cocoa. and tonight some black raspberry ice cream to make a frappe. sadly, there was still an odd aftertaste. van houtte has a far superior flavor and nothing to worry about this as competition. unfortunately i ordered 80 pods of this swill so i ordered six bottles of extract to get me thru it. second: to say these pods are recyclable is a joke. sure, the lids peal off but from there it's a chore. you have to empty out the grounds, rinse what remains, and then rip the filter from the weld. then most recycling centers won't accept this size plastic - unless things have greatly changed. keurig has some pods where the filters are attached to the peal-able lids - it comes out cleanly. chances are these pods won't be recycled which is a shame.

title: Exploding K-cups!  Do Not Buy!
review_description: This product exploded in my coffeemaker. It took me 90 minutes to clean up the mess. The manufacturer admitted to me that they have had complaints from others about their K-cups exploding. Their rep asked me for the Lot # on the box and for info about my coffeemaker. The rep's response was to tell me that "people in the field" told him that machines like mine "generally break down within a year" He told me to call the manufacturer of my coffeemaker even though this had never happened before and he admitted that they had received complaints about their K-cups exploding. I tried to use another one of the cups in my office coffeemaker and BOOM! Guess who had another mess to clean up today. This manufacturer was only concerned with blaming my coffeemaker and had no interest in addressing the problem with their product. I do not recommend buying anything from this company. Amazon graciously refunded the purchase price.
cleaned_reviews: this product exploded in my coffeemaker. it took me 90 minutes to clean up the mess. the manufacturer admitted to me that they have had complaints from others about their k-cups exploding. their rep asked me for the lot # on the box and for info about my coffeemaker. the rep's response was to tell me that "people in the field" told him that machines like mine "generally break down within a year" he told me to call the manufacturer of my coffeemaker even though this had never happened before and he admitted that they had received complaints about their k-cups exploding. i tried to use another one of the cups in my office coffeemaker and boom! guess who had another mess to clean up today. this manufacturer was only concerned with blaming my coffeemaker and had no interest in addressing the problem with their product. i do not recommend buying anything from this company. amazon graciously refunded the purchase price.

title: Burnt Chocolate with No Peanut Butter
review_description:
I was really looking forward to enjoying a nice cup of Chocolate Peanut Butter coffee. Instead what I got was coffee that smelled and tasted like burnt chocolate, with absolutely no peanut butter flavor at all.

I live in Costa Rica and have my own coffee plants, so I know what good coffee tastes like, and unfortunately this isn't it.

The only time I drink flavored coffee is when I'm back in the States, and I look forward to those few cups. Since I'm only here for a few weeks it's not worth the time and effort to return this for a different flavor. Fortunately I have different flavors from other companies that I can enjoy while I'm here.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: A 40-Flavor Journey!
review_description:
Let me tell you about my experience with the Coffee Pods Variety Pack Sampler, Assorted Single Serve Coffee for Keurig K Cups Coffee Makers, 2 Each of 40 Unique Coffees, Great Coffee Gifts, 80 Count. I ordered this pack on a whim, looking for something to spice up my morning routine. Little did I know, this pack would become my new obsession.

First off, the variety is unparalleled. With 40 unique coffees, there's something for everyone. From bold and strong to sweet and creamy, this pack has it all. And with two pods of each flavor, I could share with my friends and family (though I'll admit, I was tempted to keep them all for myself).

But let's talk about the taste. Oh. My. Goodness. I felt like a kid in a candy store, trying a new flavor every day. The Blueberry Cobbler had me singing "a-wop-bop-a-loo-bop-a-lop-bam-boom" like Little Richard. The French Vanilla made me want to break out my beret and start speaking with a terrible French accent. And the Caramel Macchiato? Let's just say, I'm pretty sure I saw the face of God.

But the best part? The packaging. The pods come in a beautifully designed box that looks like it belongs on the shelves of a boutique coffee shop. It made me feel fancy just looking at it. And when I opened it up, I was like a kid on Christmas morning, tearing through the packaging to get to the goodies inside.

Overall, I would give this Coffee Pods Variety Pack Sampler a 5 out of 5 stars. It's the perfect gift for any coffee lover, or just a treat for yourself. Plus, it's a great way to discover new flavors without committing to a full bag of coffee. So go ahead, treat yourself. You won't regret it. And who knows, maybe you'll find your new favorite brew (just be prepared to sing its praises like I am).

Here are some dos and don’ts:

Dos:
1. Do choose a variety pack that includes different coffee flavors and roasts so that you can try different types of coffee.
2. Do read the product description carefully to ensure that the coffee pods are compatible with your coffee maker.
3. Do consider the number of coffee pods in the pack and the price per pod to ensure that you are getting good value for money.
4. Do read reviews from other customers to get an idea of the quality of the coffee and the variety pack.
5. Do store the coffee pods in a cool, dry place to ensure that they stay fresh and flavorful.
Don'ts:
1. Don't choose a variety pack without checking the compatibility with your coffee maker, as this may result in wastage.
2. Don't overlook the price per pod, as some variety packs may seem like a good deal, but end up being more expensive per pod than buying individual packs.
3. Don't buy a variety pack without researching the different types of coffee included in the pack, as you may end up with flavors that you don't enjoy.
4. Don't store the coffee pods in a humid environment, as this can cause them to lose their flavor and become stale.
5. Don't assume that a variety pack will include your favorite coffee flavor or roast, as it is important to read the product description carefully to ensure that it meets your preferences.

title: great tasting coffee, but MUST make sure that the machine pierces the bottom of the cup
review_description:
This coffee tastes amazing, and brews well.

The one problem, which many other people have mentioned, is that the needle on your machine that needs to pierce the k cup, is not always able to pierce the bottom of these cups. It does cause the coffee to explode all over the place and makes a mess.

There is an easy fix though. My machine has a removable case that the k cup sits in. With other k cups when you put the pod into the case in the machine, the needle will pierce the cup. I don't trust that it will with these cups, so instead I push the cup hard into the case that has the needle, and make sure that it pierces the hole in the bottom before I put it into the machine. Most of the time this works, and you will be able to tell because you can hear the sound when it pierces the cup. If that does not work I cut a hole in the bottom of the cup with a knife. Not a perfect fix but thought I would put it out there that you can make these cups work in the machine.

That said, Crazy Cups really needs to look at their manufacturing process and make the plastic a little thinner.

Also, I tried their method for making the iced coffee and it still tasted watery. I brew my coffee the night before, put it in a travel mug, and let it cool in the refrigerator. I also make some coffee ice cubes out of the same batch of coffee, and put those in the coffee the next day. Works great!
cleaned_reviews: this coffee tastes amazing, and brews well. the one problem, which many other people have mentioned, is that the needle on your machine that needs to pierce the k cup, is not always able to pierce the bottom of these cups. it does cause the coffee to explode all over the place and makes a mess. there is an easy fix though. my machine has a removable case that the k cup sits in. with other k cups when you put the pod into the case in the machine, the needle will pierce the cup. i don't trust that it will with these cups, so instead i push the cup hard into the case that has the needle, and make sure that it pierces the hole in the bottom before i put it into the machine. most of the time this works, and you will be able to tell because you can hear the sound when it pierces the cup. if that does not work i cut a hole in the bottom of the cup with a knife. not a perfect fix but thought i would put it out there that you can make these cups work in the machine. that said, crazy cups really needs to look at their manufacturing process and make the plastic a little thinner. also, i tried their method for making the iced coffee and it still tasted watery. i brew my coffee the night before, put it in a travel mug, and let it cool in the refrigerator. i also make some coffee ice cubes out of the same batch of coffee, and put those in the coffee the next day. works great!

BUT
Advertising one thing and then filling the box with less 'specialty' flavors is deceptive.

title: They EXPLODE!
review_description:
The flavors are great, the different choices are even better, BUT THE PODS EXPLODE IN MY COFFEE MAKER! I haven’t had this issue ever before, but as soon as I set my sights on that white chocolate covered strawberry and popped it in the maker IT POPPED BACK! Thought it was a fluke with that pod or maybe my maker was acting up—-so I tried another one (same flavor) and IT DID THE SAME! Coffee grounds were floor to ceiling!

They don’t have any sort of return or replacement policy standing, so I feel like I’ve been cheated out of something I was so looking forward to having…this is such a disappointing purchase. Sadly, I don’t like playing Russian Roulette in the morning.

title: Flavors I Never Knew I Wanted in Coffee
review_description: I can't handle the caffeine anymore, but I LOVE the smell & taste of coffee. So, I looked for decaf & found Crazy Cups with such a good value for so many kcups and various flavors to try. They smell amazing. My husband and I enjoy playing "guess that flavor" when I brew a cup. He smells it and likes to guess what flavor it is. So far, the only 2 I've not enjoyed, personally, are the peanutbutter chocolate and (surprisingly) the French vanilla. The peanutbutter smells and tastes like dirt/soil (oddly, my husband and I both thought so without even mentioning it to one another), and the vanilla left an odd aftertaste on my tongue that wouldn't go away. The rest are delightful though and I will be buying them again in the future. My favorites are Death by Chocolate, Coconut Chocolate, and Iced Oatmeal Cookie. Even the Lavener Honey flavor was delicious. That was a big surprise - it being coffee. Oh, & the Bananas Foster!!! OMG! Smells and tastes so good! I never knew I'd even want those flavors in a cup of coffee! But now, I'm hooked.

review_description: I absolutely love to have a variety of flavors to choose from for my morning coffee, and this one fit the bill! In fact, I liked this assortment so much that I'm placing another order today. I was a little concerned about all of the reviews stating that the pods were defective, but I've gone through at least a dozen already and have not had any issues with grounds in my coffee or the pods exploding. The only thing I'd like to see change would be to have fewer vanillas (20% of the box was vanilla flavors from all different companies)... would love to see more fall flavors in the future.

title: GREAT Flavored Decaf Coffee
review_description: I usually have one cup of regular coffee first thing in the morning but have to switch to decaf after that, otherwise I get the caffeine jitters. Many of the regular decaf blends are ho hum and watery tasting so I was hoping to find something flavored that sparked my taste buds. I tried this 50 count assortment on a whim (I almost didn't buy it). I am SO glad I did. There are a couple of flavors (white chocolate strawberry and bananas foster) that aren't my favorite but there are so many other great ones that I don't mind few "bad" ones in the bunch. I have enjoyed trying the different flavors and love the variety. If you are looking for a tasty decaf option, give these a try!

title: If I actually liked chocolate with raspberry, this would have been perfect…
review_description:
You can definitely taste the peppermint, glazed donut, peanut butter, coconut, raspberry, and, of course, chocolate flavors.

Lastly, for the most flavor per cup, I find it best not to exceed the 8 oz cup size.

title: Surprise flavors.
review_description:
First the good.. the price for the 24 pack is great, especially if you get it on a lightening deal like I did. The part that wasn't so great was you have no idea what flavors you might be getting. From the review, it look like there were a few different collections. They should state exactly what is in the box. I received 4 each of 6 flavors .. Here's a list and my review of each one :
Death By Chocolate : Really deep chocolate flavor and really good.
Chocolate Coconut Dream: Good chocolate flavor with coconut if you like coconut .. found it ok
Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: Gave this one away as I don't like Raspberries. Did try a sip and the person I gave it to loved it.
Chocolate Chipolte Mole: Threw this one away as I hate anything spicy. Can't even imagine this one.
Peppermint Chocolate Mocha: Again a nice brew if you like Peppermint.
Italian Chocolate Cheesecake: Tastes like the name, really good too
All in all, I would order the Death by Chocolate and the Cheescake again as single flavors. I just wish they would tell you upfront what you are getting. These fits all standard K cup coffee makers.The flavors are not bitter at all like some of the other flavored kinds. They are smooth. It was well worth a try and my friends like the flavors I didn't.
cleaned_reviews: first the good.. the price for the 24 pack is great, especially if you get it on a lightening deal like i did. the part that wasn't so great was you have no idea what flavors you might be getting. from the review, it look like there were a few different collections. they should state exactly what is in the box. i received 4 each of 6 flavors .. here's a list and my review of each one : death by chocolate : really deep chocolate flavor and really good. chocolate coconut dream: good chocolate flavor with coconut if you like coconut .. found it ok chocolate raspberry truffle: gave this one away as i don't like raspberries. did try a sip and the person i gave it to loved it. chocolate chipolte mole: threw this one away as i hate anything spicy. can't even imagine this one. peppermint chocolate mocha: again a nice brew if you like peppermint. italian chocolate cheesecake: tastes like the name, really good too all in all, i would order the death by chocolate and the cheescake again as single flavors. i just wish they would tell you upfront what you are getting. these fits all standard k cup coffee makers.the flavors are not bitter at all like some of the other flavored kinds. they are smooth. it was well worth a try and my friends like the flavors i didn't.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Solid variety
review_description:
I’ve ordered this variety pack a handful of times. Great variety of brands, and pretty good variety when it comes to flavors.
The last package I received included 20 different k-cups, 2 each. There were no decaf (can get a separate package for that). If I had to say what the dominate flavors are in each package, I’d say it’s (generally) caramel, vanilla, and hazelnut.
The pricing it’s too bad; usually around $20 for a 40-pack. Would definitely recommend.

title: Good value, good flavor, frustrating with Keurig 2.0
review_description:
Good value for the money. I thought they tasted as good as any mocha coffees I have purchased in the past, However, they do NOT work well with my Keurig 2.0. They seem to clog it up and it processes VERY slow. They are not the only pods that I have had this issue with. I believe it is because of a flaw in the Keurig design, but none-the-less, that is the model I have. If the grounds/flavorings are ground too fine, then they float inside the pierced pod and then clog the spouts.
I will probably not buy them again, not because of the flavor of the coffees, but because they do not run well in my machine.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Good value, nice assortment
review_description:
I was recently gifted a Keurig machine and needed to buy some pods, but I was kind of shocked at the cost of some brands.

So I was happy to find this sampler of 40 different flavors for under $20. I've sampled 4 or 5 so far and they're good but not great, but I'm a grind and brew girl so wasn't expecting these to measure up. Basically I like the occasional hazelnut, smore or pumpkin flavor and this satisfies that urge without paying $5 at the Seattle-based chain. It will also be great at the holidays or when entertaining, allowing guests to pick and brew their own flavors.

title: You'd Better REALLY LOVE Blueberry If You Drink This
review_description:
The wife liked the Blueberry flavor of another brand so we tried this mixed selection and discovered very quickly that the flavor was so overpowering as to make the drink worth dumping. Given the price tag this seemed a waste, so today I mixed one of the flavors (Cinnamon Blueberry) with another ground bean (Hazelnut) at about 50/50. The result suited our taste much better in that there was just a hint of blueberry instead of being overpowered by it.

I brewed two individual cups and mixed them together then poured them back into each of our cups. Since I drink mine black the blueberry was readily identifiable, the wife uses an almond creamer (Lactose Intolerant) and was barely able to detect the blueberry, so next time I'll give her an extra 20% ratio. This means we won't waste the batch, an it will last over a much longer period of time.

title: Flavors received not as pictured
review_description:
Update: 10/17/21: I did not look closely at the listing for this item. It is not sold by Crazy Cups, but a second-party seller, Perfect Cup. I will, henceforth, purchase my flavored coffee directly from the Crazy Cups website.

As someone who cannot drink caffeine, I appreciate the vast flavor menu Crazy Cups offer. I was truly excited to purchase this pack, which is larger than the one I normally buy. My main reason for this larger purchase was to sample the Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup and Peppermint Mocha flavors that are only available in this pack (based on the picture in the listing). Spoiler alert: those two flavors, as well as, White Chocolate Strawberry and Butter Pecan Swirl are not included. This feels a little like bait and switch as those flavors enticed me to spend more than I normally would, but I did not receive what was pictured. Please make this right Crazy Cups! I want to continue enjoying your decaf coffee. However, this has left a bad taste in mouth.

3 star compromise because my son thinks they are delicious and deserve 5, even though I totally disagree and think they deserve 1.

title: Needs More Chocolate Flavor!
review_description: These are okay, they contain lot of different chocolate variety flavors. This works fine in my first generation Keurig causing no problem while brewing. They seem really exciting and fun with great flavor combos and smell so good. They are a really light coffee which I enjoy. They do the job in waking me up as my usual morning routine, however, they smell so much better than they really taste, it is kind of a tease. You would think that they claim this as an assorted chocolate lovers coffee, it should be really chocolaty, borderline rich and sweet flavored, yet it leaves something to be desired. Don't get me wrong, these are good, but certainty do not live up to my expectations I had of them. The peppermint is the only one that has a distinct different flavor, yet that is the minty part and not really a strong chocolate back flavor. I really wanted the death by chocolate and the raspberry truffle to be extra good, but they are no better or distinctive from the other flavors. This variety pack is along the same plain as others I have tried. Again, while still good and effective as a regular coffee, I was expecting a lot more considering the description given of these and the smell of the coffee. Probably won't buy this pack again, but if they show up as the only option to drink somewhere, I won't say no.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I'm not sure if I'm exactly satisfied with my order yet
review_description: I'm not sure if I'm exactly satisfied with my order yet. Out of the 40 cups, there were several duplicates and an abundance of pumpkin spice coffee/hazelnut/vanilla (20 cups worth, 12 being pumpkin spice). I only received 2 from the Entenmann's brand, both vanilla. Not much of the variety I had hoped for, and not at all what was pictured in the listing's photo. The first two cups I tried, none of the coffee was brewed. Plain water filled my cup and it caused leaking everywhere (my machine is fairly new and in top notch working order). The k-cup tops were also swelled... old maybe? The third cup I tried, I actually got coffee in my mug. But it was filled with grounds as well. For the price of $.50 per cup, I'd hope for better variety and quality. Maybe my order was just an old batch of unwanted/unpopular flavors tossed in a box? If the quality continues with every cup I try, I'm going to have to request a refund or some sort of return compensation for the waste I received.

title: Great smell but lacking flavor
review_description: I was really excited to try these new K-cups after using the same old ones for years and with the name Crazy Cups I really expected a flavor explosion but that isn't what I got. The smell of these cups brewing has been amazing but I have yet to drink one that the taste actually lives up to the smell. Not sure if I expected too much from a K-cup or what but I just feel like they are a bit lacking. title: Hope the manufacturer can fix the seals
review_description: Love the coffee, but not the cleanup. I have purchased this offering multiple times for about a year. The last two orders have had defective seals at the rim of the plastic cup. When the seal fails and opens coffee grounds spew everywhere, including into the cup of coffee leaving grounds in the bottom of the cup. After the coffeemaker cycle is done, I have to disassemble the brewer head and clean the grounds from the parts and wipe up the adjacent area. I may have to find another supplier, which is sad because I enjoy the variety of flavors and the quality of the coffee.

title: creative, but lacks balance
review_description: After trying this Chocolate Lovers mix as well as the PB&J flavor I can say this is just not my favorite brand. I don't mind exotic flavor choices but the balance between the selected roasts and the flavor combinations is just not there. In particular, the Italian Chocolate Cheesecake flavor is overpowered by an espresso-like roast (I get that "Italian" roasts are strong, but still...) that overwhelms what could be a really good combination. Similarly, Chocolate Coconut Dream is rendered off-putting by a bitter mix of strong coffee and coconut. Death by Chocolate and the Peppermint Mocha are probably the better flavors of this bunch, but for me it's not worth enduring the others to get to them.

title: 4 to 2 stars
review_description:
Prior review is below.

I am lowering this to two stars because the second time I ordered this I had an inordinate amount of pods I don't like very much including a duplicate of hot chocolate. The order I had prior were many nice flavored coffees and cappuccinos and top notch tea with some interesting hot chocolate. It did have one of those typical mass produced store brands. This one was very disappointing and I'm cancelling my subscription.

--------------------------
I was very happy with this box I received from subscribe & save, I saw I had it for every 3 months and thought, "No! Every month at least! This is great!"
Then I saw the price on the next delivery and went with. "3 months it is!"

Overall it's a very strong blend with one I term as NO (Folgers, we all know what Folgers is. Don't put it into a variety pack).

I loved a lot of the flavored coffees which were much like dessert, but what occurred to me while I was drinking a deluge happened to be...How many calories have I consumed of this wonderful sugary artificial goodness?

I decided some things are best left not knowing.

The blend is primarily coffee, but there is also some tea and hot chocolate blended in.

I'm familiar with many of the blends but this is my first time having "Crazy Cups" and I absolutely love the taste of these without adding any milk or something else. But, my guess is they have a high calorie count.

title: CRAZY CUPS PAY ATTENTION: Be careful if you value your coffee maker but flavor is spot on ; (
review_description:
Okay lets start with the pros for encouragement....the flavors of each of these chocolate lovers coffees are spot on (peanut butter and the coconut one are my favorites) all with out any bitter bite and are very smooth.

now the cons: They are not compatible with all Keurig coffee makers, for I have read some people have no problems, but many others have repeated blow outs...I tried one in the pod it came in and it shut down my machine so having read other peoples problem I removed the top and filled my reusable pod with the coffee and it did the samething so I removed some of the coffee and it worked just fine, but still blew out my paper filter I use for easier clean up, Next time I used even less of the coffee in my reusable set up and it worked even better. Now when I removed the top from the first pod I found it had blown out the filter in the pod and that is the reason most people get grounds in their coffee even when it works with their coffee maker. I had to remove all the coffee and put it in individual baggies and use my reusable pods. Part of buying the pods is the convenience of use and these do not provide that, then there is the possible damage it can do to your coffee maker.

So if you do not mind the inconvenience of pouring out the coffee into baggies and then scooping the coffee out into reusable pods it is okay, but it has to be cheaper and a time saver to buy this coffee in bags (if only they came in bags) in place of the pods if you are going to do this. It is a pain to have to open these pods and pour them into individual baggies. Right now I will not be a repeat customer for I just got my new Keurig and want to continue to enjoy it.

Crazy Cups are you reading any of your reviews? If not you need to and if so then you need to fix your problem for the rest of us who love your coffee but will not take a chance of ruining our coffee makers. Thank you for your consideration.

review_description: The coffee was weak. Flavors were good, but the coffee itself was not at all robust. Prefer my plain old 8 O'clock coffee over these. Was expecting great flavor. So disappointing. Worst of all, several of the cups were defective and made a big mess. Not much variety in the flavors, lots of repeats even though there were several brands. I do not recommend.
cleaned_reviews: the coffee was weak. flavors were good, but the coffee itself was not at all robust. prefer my plain old 8 o'clock coffee over these. was expecting great flavor. so disappointing. worst of all, several of the cups were defective and made a big mess. not much variety in the flavors, lots of repeats even though there were several brands. i do not recommend.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I love the flavors, but the pods are terrible.
review_description: I love the flavors, but unfortunately we had SEVERAL of the pods bust in two different brands of kcup machines. It was super messy and I had to spend 5 minutes cleaning up grounds each time. I have been using pods like this for over a year and never had this problem before.

title: Not for me - - sorry folks
review_description:
Sorry folks but apparently I am NOT a chocolate flavored coffee drinker. I just don't like these and I have tried to add extra Splenda and cream and nothing helps. I will stick to regular coffee. I know there are those who like flavored coffee and I do love chocolates but I thought they would taste more like chocolate! My husband didn't even care for these.

The other day I ordered these again by mistake but I didn't realize it was a mistake until the day they were to arrive. This is the time to say " put your glasses on before you order anything using your cell phone." I hopped out of my chair and immediately call Amazon and in the matter of a minute or so I was speaking to a live person. Actually a real lies and breathing person who understood what I had done and immediately help me with my problem. Plus I was able to order my chocolate! Even though I give the chocolate flavored coffee only one star I will give Amazon service 10 Stars. I wished they could show up as stars in this review.
Since I am getting older and have learned to put my glasses on when ordering comma I have purchased a lot from Amazon from vitamins, hair products, CDs, millions of cookbooks and diet books - - notice that the cookbooks and diet books go together - - dishes and glasses, just name it and I have purchased it from Amazon and everything has arrived perfect. The only mistakes that have happened are due to me and Amazon did not blame me but took care of me. End of my review chocolate flavored coffee :-)

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Very poor quality control
review_description: Many of the seals on the pods were broken. The coffee lost its freshness because of this and tons of coffee grains would fall into the cup. It also diverted water outside of the perimeter of the cup, which left a mess to clean. I contacted the manufacturer, they declined to help and instead blamed their poor quality control on Amazon. I contacted Amazon and they said they couldn't help me because I contacted them a tad outside of their 30 day window for returns. The whole purchase was a disaster from the get-go. It literally left a bad taste in my mouth...no pun intended!

title: What a Gyp!
review_description:
This turned out to be a big disappointment. I felt so lucky! I was not only getting coffee pods for my Keurig but also cocoa and tea. I was going to get tea pods--my drink of choice! But also pods for my coffee-drinking friends and cocoa mostly for my younger friends. I have dug around in the box and have yet to find a tea pod and thus far only 1 cocoa pod. From the maker's names on the pods thus far I am guessing these are coffees that haven't sold so well.

Now, don't ask me to send the box back--I'm 90 and getting to the PO isn't an easy task. I'm stuck with a box of least favorite drinks, if there are tea pods, there are very few. I've learned an expensive, for me, lesson. If it's a good deal, it probably isn't

Amazon, you've disappointed me!

Disappointed Great Grandmom

title: Broken pods
review_description: I’ve been buying from you guys for the past 6 months now. The flavors are good and the pricing is reasonable, but for the last 2 boxes; I’ve had over 10 pods that didn’t work or were broken. I thought maybe the first box (7 broken pods) was just a fluke but this last box o got was just horrible. I haven’t even used up the 40 pods and already 2 pods were broken before use, and 8 pods broke in the machine which all the grinds spilled all over my machine. I’m definitely disappointed. I don’t think I’ll buy it from this place again.

title: Very Disappointed!
review_description: I was very disappointed in the quality of these Kcup pods! The 40 pods were packaged in a box marked "Perfect Samplers". How ironic...they were far from perfect!!! I am a little over halfway through the box and at least 5 of the pods have been defective. They were not sealed properly. I don't think I will purchase any Crazy Cups variety pack in the future!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Same problems as Others, Pods don't fit Keurig correctly, Odd Pods
review_description:
As others have reported, a few of the K-pods are full of air (probably indicating they are old). Others don't fit the Keurig correctly and so they fill with water that doesn't release through the bottom and grounds come out the top into your coffee maker. This makes it so you have to clean the coffee maker.

It's such a shame because it's great to be able to try various flavors and have a variety rather than the same coffee each morning. I only wish I could find this type of variety but where I'm getting appropriate value for the money. And of course you would NEVER want to gift someone these troubled pods.

The problem-- 1) If I am told I will receive 24 K-cups- I EXPECT 24 K-cups! As another reviewer, I only received 23 K-cups. OK- THAT IS A PROBLEM- DON'T SHORT PEOPLE 1 CUP FIGURING THEY WON'T COMPLAIN

6 PEPPERMINT COCOA
6 DEATH BY CHOCOLATE
4 MOCHA TURTLE
3 RAZZBERRY CHOCOLATE
2 CHOCO COCONUT
2 PEANUT BUTTER CUP

Of course, my adult kids, 23yo, and 25yo, LOVED THE PEANUT BUTTER CUP. AND, OF COURSE, I DIDN'T GET TO TRY IT.

A WORD TO THE SELLERS, I SWEAR TO GOD, I BETTER NEVER HAVE TO CALL AMAZON ABOUT THIS ?*&"?%*
IF, I SOMEHOW, DECIDE TO BE COERCED TO BUY A BOX OF PEANUT BUTTER CUP, I BETTER FREAKING GET EVEY DAMNED CUP I PAY FOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Received Pack with Expired "Best Used By" Date
review_description:
I ordered the box of assorted coffees, cocoas and teas on April 20, 2022 and received the package April 22, 2022. The "Best Used By" date was April 11, 2022. Each cup was not marked with a date, but as shown by the photo, the whole package had the date of 4/11/22.

While I like the assortment, I am very disappointed to find that the "best used by" date had already passed. I had planned to use these as part of a gift basket but cannot, in good conscience, include them.

title: Didn't include advertised brands - K-cups expired too soon
review_description:
I was disappointed with this purchase for 3 reasons.
First, most of the major name-brand coffees that were advertised in the picture were NOT included in my batch of k-cups. No Cinnabon, Caribou, Tim Hortons, 8 O'Clock, Donut Shop, Donut House, or Torani k-cups were included. I was deeply disappointed because sampling those brands was the main reason I purchased this sampler pack.
Secondly, I was disappointed because there was a sticker on the outside of the box stating that the expiration date for the k-cups was 9/20/16, which is just over 3 weeks from the date I received the sampler pack! That is ridiculous. The majority of the k-cups are exotic flavors that I'm not going to drink every single day. They should not have sent almost-expired k-cups.
Third, the selection was poor, in my opinion. There were 3 teas, 3 cappuccinos, 1 cider, 6 hot chocolates, and 17 coffees. I expected a lot more tea, at least, and was disappointed there were only 3. Additionally, at least half of the flavors were holiday flavors, which I was disappointed with as well.
I do not recommend this sampler pack.

title: Very Very Dissapointed :(
review_description:
I was not very happy with this purchase as there is a very uneven distribution of flavors. I ordered this assortment wanting to try some new flavors of chocolate coffee. I am a huge fan of chocolate flavored coffee and I really do like the Choco Coconut flavor which I have ordered on its own a few times. I decided to order the assortment even though I knew that I more than likely would not care for all the flavors. I had a pretty good idea that I would probably dislike the Chocolate Chipolte Mole, but I figured the most I would get of any one flavor would be 4 at most. I took that chance and here is what I got:
8 Chipolte Mole; 0 Peppermint Mocha; 3 Coconut Dream; 4 Italian Cheesecake; 5 Death by Cocolate; 4 Raspberry Truffle
Needless to say very disappointing since the Chipolte Mole is my least favorite, I find it horrible actually. I was very excited to try the Peppermint and I did not receive a singe one of these. The distribution of flavors is the worst and certainly needs to be improved on.

title: Great variety of flavors but pods explode!
review_description: Updated 11/19/19- Well, after the 3rd pod exploding and shooting coffee grounds all over the place, I'm afraid I won't be reordering these. As much as I LOVE the coffee, I can't risk ruining my keurig machine, not to mention the mess and the waste. Sucks! ORIGINAL REVIEW: I really love the variety of flavors. It's so hard to find decaf in flavors other than French vanilla and hazelnut. I was a little skeptical about apple pie a la mode and bananas foster, but with a little Italian sweet creme creamer they were great and would go great with a muffin or other pastry. It's fun experimenting with "pairing" them with different creamers, like a fine wine! I have had a couple of them leave grounds in my keurig and my coffee, and just handling the pods, grounds seem to leak out onto the counter, so they really need to work on quality control. I'm a little concerned that it could ruin my keurig, which will not make me happy. Otherwise, I am very happy with them.

title: Cups won't pop and coffee tastes weird
review_description: Could have sworn I'd had this brand in the past and loved it but I guess I could be wrong. First, the cups are made of some tough material that my machine couldn't pierce. Maybe it's because I have something made by Hamilton Beach and not a real Keurig but I've used a lot of different brands of kcups in this machine and never had a problem. So I opened the cup, and used the filter basket. The grind is weird and instead of running through it most of the water overflowed making a mess. Again not a real Keurig but never had a problem before. What coffee I got out of it tasted weird and artificial like cheap canned food. Will be careful to avoid this brand in the future.

Most of the flavors were just ok.
And every 1 out of 5 especially the good flavors, were NOT recognized by our keurig machine. So I took some to my home machine of a different brand and still didn’t work!

Fast forward to the end of the box , this has made me literally HATE pumpkin to the point that the smell makes me sick. Out of 40, 16 were pumpkin flavored. I thought they were all supposed to be different I guess I was wrong and it's not even fall when you would expect to see a lot of pumpkin which leads me to think they threw in a bunch of it to get rid of it from last season! I thought this was going to be my go to coffee but I was wrong I have to keep looking for a actual variety pack. As for now thanks for making me hate pumpkin.

title: These K-Cups spill coffee into my Cuisinart Keurig system!
review_description:
My household is coffee drinkers. The Mrs and I drink a pot of coffee every a.m., so we know coffee. The whole point for a K-Cup system is for that one-off cup, or when you don’t feel like drinking a pot! We’re a LavAzza household, ever day… so it’s important to us.

The boys love the hot chocolate… and I was notified that Amazon was out of the Solimo… so they suggested Crazy Cups... Here’s how I arrived in this brand… that we don’t know.. It was a suggestion from Amazon (first mistake).

I purchased the sampler pack, which had five different flavors. Price seemed decent, sure, why not, seems to have an overabundance of positive reviews (I needed to have dug deeper before I pulled this trigger!), so I bought a pack.

Box arrived, excellent packaging... no assembly of rhyme or reason in the box to how the flavors were just thrown in (first lousy omen), and I noticed what felt and seemed like they overstuffed each K-Cup (second horrible omen). So we separated the piles of flavors, and I took one for a test spin.

On the seal, “Freshly Roasted Coffee” – I’ve always found, when they say “good, eat, tasty, etc.” in the title, usually it’s the opposite and chaos ensues, sadly this was not any different. What poured out, smelled terrific, a little too good to be true! At first sip, black coffee, nothing in it, just to taste the base. To my shock and dismay, I was underwhelmed... UNDERWHELEMD PEOPLE!

I’ve had better coffee at Denny’s on a road trip when you need that cuppa, just to keep your eyes peeled on the road.. they have a far better-tasting coffee then this! Secondly, the flavor... “Death by chocolate,” I think not! Frankly, for all the Betty Ford recovering chocaholics, this is insulting to call this chocolate… little foil coins have far better-tasting chocolate then this!

Tried the 2nd K-Cup and BOOM coffee grounds everywhere. Remember the overstuffing comment earlier… well, this is my theory, or it’s just NOT compatible with the system we own... gee that would have been nice to know to go in! Crazy Cups has this weird indentation on the bottom like the K-Cup sat on a basketball.. left an odd dimple… what’s the point?

The other K-Cups that we enjoy, such as Cafe Bustelo, Swiss Miss, LavAzza, and even Amazon’s own Solimo, works fine. Crazy Cups, your K-Cups make the grounds go everywhere except where they belong! Now I am stuck with K-Cups that will probably break then give coffee. This isn’t the first one to do this! I’ll never repurchase your brand!
If you drink coffee, like we drink coffee, this is not your coffee! Crazy Cups K-Cup coffee is a sad joke pretending to be coffee! The base flavor is insulting to any coffee drinker.. and it smells far better then it tastes!
cleaned_reviews: my household is coffee drinkers. the mrs and i drink a pot of coffee every a.m., so we know coffee. the whole point for a k-cup system is for that one-off cup, or when you don’t feel like drinking a pot! we’re a lavazza household, ever day… so it’s important to us. the boys love the hot chocolate… and i was notified that amazon was out of the solimo… so they suggested crazy cups... here’s how i arrived in this brand… that we don’t know.. it was a suggestion from amazon (first mistake). i purchased the sampler pack, which had five different flavors. price seemed decent, sure, why not, seems to have an overabundance of positive reviews (i needed to have dug deeper before i pulled this trigger!), so i bought a pack. box arrived, excellent packaging... no assembly of rhyme or reason in the box to how the flavors were just thrown in (first lousy omen), and i noticed what felt and seemed like they overstuffed each k-cup (second horrible omen). so we separated the piles of flavors, and i took one for a test spin. on the seal, “freshly roasted coffee” – i’ve always found, when they say “good, eat, tasty, etc.” in the title, usually it’s the opposite and chaos ensues, sadly this was not any different. what poured out, smelled terrific, a little too good to be true! secondly, the flavor... “death by chocolate,” i think not! frankly, for all the betty ford recovering chocaholics, this is insulting to call this chocolate… little foil coins have far better-tasting chocolate then this! tried the 2nd k-cup and boom coffee grounds everywhere. remember the overstuffing comment earlier… well, this is my theory, or it’s just not compatible with the system we own... gee that would have been nice to know to go in! crazy cups has this weird indentation on the bottom like the k-cup sat on a basketball.. left an odd dimple… what’s the point? the other k-cups that we enjoy, such as cafe bustelo, swiss miss, lavazza, and even amazon’s own solimo, works fine. crazy cups, your k-cups make the grounds go everywhere except where they belong! now i am stuck with k-cups that will probably break then give coffee. this isn’t the first one to do this! i’ll never repurchase your brand! if you drink coffee, like we drink coffee, this is not your coffee! crazy cups k-cup coffee is a sad joke pretending to be coffee! the base flavor is insulting to any coffee drinker.. and it smells far better then it tastes!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: A Dream Unfulfilled
review_description: Have you ever kicked back after an excellent meal and thought to yourself, 'wow, that was good... I wish I could somehow drink all of those flavors that I just enjoyed via boring old eating'? Well if that's you, then you need to pay attention. Because this product is a cruel mockery of that beautiful dream. Each pod is delightfully labeled with such descriptive titles as "Chocolate Raspberry Truffle," "Chipotle Mole" (I'm not freaking kidding you), or--my personal favorite-- "Party Cake!" However, underneath these elegant descriptors, every pod shares a common label visible only to your taste buds: "Hot Filthy Garbage." The Entenmann's Peppermint smacked of the same smell that I encounter each time I go to the local tire factory to get a new set put on the family vehicle. The "Death By Chocolate" flavor was almost appropriately labeled; it merely needs to drop the last two words and go simply by "Death." "Apple Pie Ala Mode" is an insult to an American classic. Drinking it was like shoving bamboo shoots under George Washington's fingernails. In short, I probably wouldn't buy this grab bag of insanity a second time. You're welcome.

"apple pie ala mode" is an insult to an american classic. drinking it was like shoving bamboo shoots under george washington's fingernails. in short, i probably wouldn't buy this grab bag of insanity a second time. you're welcome.

title: Buyer Beware: These K-Cups did not work in our Keurig 2.0 K475
review_description: We were really looking forward to this variety pack. Beware: Even though they say it works in all Keurig machines including the 2.0: THEY DO NOT. In fact, as you can see from the picture I uploaded, the part that punctures the bottom of the K-cup was broken by the cups from this variety pack. None of them worked in our Keurig 2.0 model K-475. Not only did we pay $30 for this variety pack, but it cost another $48 to replace the K-cup holder assembly because of the damage caused by these K-Cups. To add insult to injury, we put our best foot forward and tried again using another of these cups with the new assembly and the same thing: the bottom of the cup was not punctured. So, it's not the machine. Very disappointed and we will never buy this variety pack again.

title: Chocolate Lovers Jackpot
review_description:
I love chocolate.
And I love coffee.

But for years, every coffee that promised me chocolately goodness left a bitter taste in my mouth (literally). Others might have the scent, but the chocolate flavor is always washed out by the coffee (exception being cafe escapes mocha, but that’s a literal blend of coffee and cocoa powder).

I decided to try once more. Death by Chocolate? Yes, please.
Well…oh my stars is this fantastic. The perfect blend of chocolate and coffee with a heavenly aroma. I’ve even trying to lessen my caffeine intake…these are going to make that a challenge, lol.

So if you’re like me—always disappointed by chocolate flavored coffees—these are for you. Total game changer. Fantastic brew, intoxicating aroma.

title: Heaven in a cup!
review_description:
I recently bought a Crazy Cups variety pack that included this flavor, and I immediately fell in love. I had to switch to decaf coffee about a year ago because I noticed a major difference in my overall sense of calm, so this purchase was an accident in that I thought it was their decaf version (this company is one of the few out there making an incredible array of flavored decaf coffees, which is frustratingly hard to find). Deciding to drink it anyway, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it didn't give me jitters, so I'm thinking the caffeine level isn't very strong. Not so great for folks who love high caffeine content, but perfect for me.

The chocolate flavor is rich, bold, and fills my kitchen with a truly intoxicating smell in the morning. I suck and I'm not a fan of black coffee, so I can't comment on the taste in that regard (it all tastes bitter and acidic to me), but with a little bit of almond milk or sweetened creamer, it's heaven. Definitely buying again!

title: Great Tasting But Weak With Creamer
review_description:
I actually really like this coffee. It is a weaker, mild flavor with no tang like you get in a lot of coffees. It tastes almost like a mixture between hot cocoa and coffee. It is very smooth and easy to drink black. It gets a little weak if creamer is added, but I almost always drink my coffee black so it doesn't affect me much.

There is one con that I have experiences with this particular coffee. It is a pretty full K-Cup and the shipping box had a slight ding in it. This meant that two of the K-Cups had actually busted open in transit. The coffee smells awesome and very chocolaty so it made for a great smelling box, but I would have preferred if they all stayed in tact.

Amazon came to the rescue and refunded my purchase in full without batting an eye so I can't really consider it a con. 20 free K-Cups is hard to beat.

This review is based on my experience using the Keurig travel mug. I always use the medium and small setting to fill it using one K-Cup for each. (2 K-Cups per travel mug fill).

(2 k-cups per travel mug fill).

title: Smells and tasts like coffee - death by chocolate review
review_description: I don't like coffee at all. Normally I feel like people would ask me would you like a splash of coffee with your milk and sugar. I am prefacing this review with that important information because I spent a lot of time going through reviews of different flavored coffee k-cup options. I choose the Crazy Cups Death by Chocolate because most of the reviews were positive. Even from non-coffee drinkers. As a non-coffee drinker I would stay away from this. I will have to use a flavored creamer and some kind of sweetener for this product, which I was trying to avoid. There is no chocolate taste at all. Very disappointing. It also left my mouth very dry. I know coffee is a diuretic so maybe that is why, but whenever I've had it I normally don't feel like I have to drink a gallon of water afterwords. I definitely would tell a non-coffee drinker to stay away from this product. I do really enjoy the Crazy Cups hot chocolate so I'm really disappointed about this not working out.

title: a coffee to die for
review_description: I decided to experiment with trying a new flavor as I am fussy about my flavored coffees. My favorite used to be Mudslide but Death by Chocolate has it beat now as my very favorite coffee. I tried it the way I usually make my coffee and it was great, but then I decided to add another packet of Splenda and now it is to die for. It's a little pricey but well worth the extra. It has a true chocolate flavor. If you are someone who prefers dark chocolate flavor then just add less sweetener. This is a nice alternative to hot chocolate for me. Although it is strong on chocolate it doesn't take away from the coffee taste. It's a perfect blend of the two ... better than any mocha I have ever had.

title: wonderful aroma. It has a smooth flavor with minimal ...
review_description:
This is very tasty chocolate coffee, with a heady, wonderful aroma. It has a smooth flavor with minimal bitterness. I don't like bitter flavors, which is why I can't even bring myself to drink most coffees. But the chocolate flavor here seems to "smooth out" the small amount of bitterness in this coffee.

It's just chocolate flavor and coffee, with no sweeteners. This allows me to choose whether to sweeten it or not. I like that, because sweetened coffees are usually too sweet for my taste. Actually, I usually don't sweeten it at all - I typically drink it with some cream. I guess with the cream you could call it a bargain version of an unsweetened hot mocha.

Bottom line: if you are a chocoholic who needs a caffeine fix, I highly recommend that you give this coffee a try.

title: I must be crazy or something.

I don't know if I got a bad batch or what.

title: Great coffee

title: Needs more caramel.
review_description:
It's okay as far as coffee goes. I mean. It's not bad coffee, but I didn't taste the caramel.
We need a crazy for caramel flavor where the caramel oozes from the cup like oceans of sugary goodness!
Yes, I really like caramel, but alas there was not much to be tasted in this cup. If you like good coffee in general though, I'd recommend this cup and this brand.
Crazy cups does know what they're doing when making a cup of coffee, but this time they hit it a bit short. Sorry guys. I do like your product though.

title: Love this coffee!

I love the flavor and I especially like the fact that the pods are so easy to take apart. The only thing that goes in my trash is the foil lid. The coffee and filter go in my composting and the plastic cup goes in my recycling. Thank you for making them easy to recycle.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: One pod was open/used, very thin and no taste
review_description:
Received item and box looked unsealed, but figured maybe it was damaged in shipping. Opened box and started putting away and noticed bottom of box had a lot of grounds in it. Then found a pod that appeared opened and used.
These do not have much flavor and brew very thin, all you taste is water really even on a small cup or expresso size setting. Just really no flavor or thickness. They have a lot left in them after brewing unlike most other pods so it’s almost like they don’t really brew.
I liked the amount of flavor options offered in the box initially, but you do not taste any of the flavors.
Description of product in listing also stated you could come brew over ice which was what I was really looking for. They are even thinner and more tasteless as cold brew.
Do not recommend this product at all. If you like flavored coffee, thicker coffee, or cold brew, avoid these. They are thin, tasteless, and seem to be a very cheap, poorly made product. Not with the money.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: DO NOT PURCHASE, THESE DO NOT WORK WITH KEURIG MACHINES
review_description:
I purchased these K-cups because the flavors sounded interesting and they looked aesthetically pleasing (I really need to stop buying things because they look pretty). Every time I tried to pop one of these suckers into my Keurig machine, it would immediately shut off. I thought, well maybe its my machine, so I tried one of the Starbucks K-cups I have, and it works just fine. I also have a brand new Keurig (the one that makes lattes and whatnot) so I highly doubt its my coffee maker. I am really let down, because I really wanted to try these! I'm probably going to see if I can just get my money back, because I don't need these just collecting dust in my pantry.

Don't waste your money like I did. Don't buy something because it looks "cool". The only thing "crazy" about these K-Cups, is the fact that they cause your Keurig to have a literal meltdown.
cleaned_reviews: i purchased these k-cups because the flavors sounded interesting and they looked aesthetically pleasing (i really need to stop buying things because they look pretty). every time i tried to pop one of these suckers into my keurig machine, it would immediately shut off. i thought, well maybe its my machine, so i tried one of the starbucks k-cups i have, and it works just fine. i also have a brand new keurig (the one that makes lattes and whatnot) so i highly doubt its my coffee maker. i am really let down, because i really wanted to try these! i'm probably going to see if i can just get my money back, because i don't need these just collecting dust in my pantry. don't waste your money like i did. don't buy something because it looks "cool". the only thing "crazy" about these k-cups, is the fact that they cause your keurig to have a literal meltdown.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Poor Quality Cup
review_description: I've ordered Crazy Cups coffee samplers for a while and I do enjoy the flavor. My problem is that this is the only brand of cups that consistently has problems with my Keurig. The problem seems to be primarily related to the inability of the Keurig needle to puncture the bottom of the K-Cup cleanly on a consistent basis. This causes the brewer to shut down with grounds dripping everywhere and no coffee in the cup or a cup of coffee filled with floating grounds. I enjoy trying other varieties of k-cups and this is the only brand that has this problem. Additionally, while other k-cups have a return policy, this brand is NOT returnable.

user_name: Real Person from the Real World
title: Ain't Starbucks, but everyone is out of the overpriced Starbucks Peppermint Mocha K Cups
review_description:
Yeah, I got the 80 pod pack ...Gotta hit that $25 level, since i am already over paying by staying inside and ordering online where all I can see is that .44 vs .75 ...if I go to eBay, I'll just end up over paying some enterprising individual who bought up the real Starbucks out of date 3 years old pods some store sold at discount, from earning a buck... but 80 pods is a rather abstract amount until you open the box.
Quite palatable, but interestingly, nothing anywhere on any of the "buy me" pages says whether they use natural or artificial flavoring (not that "natural" is necessarily what you think it is). As for clogging your pod brewer, that's usually the bits of chocolate in the pod if you get good stuff instead of "flavored." The bits clog up the teeny tubes in the brewer. Anyway, just run a water cycle, no pod! AFTER brewing a cup and you will be less likely to clog. Personally, i suggest we all band together and buy Starbucks stock when the market crashes, and then demand management increase manufacture of the more desirable flavor pods, at least for stockholders!

Hmm, maybe ran out of water...!? No.
Tried rotating cup .... Still shut off.

Cleaned out the brew chamber, insert new cup.. Tried again, still shut off.

Hmm, getting worried... Machine crap out..!?
No.

Tried another brand of coffee, not this flavor, but brewed fine.

Determined that if I shake the pod, then tap the pod on the counter.... I get about 30% succes rate.

Otherwise, they dont work.... Oh yeah, did I mention...two different brew machines, same issues.
cleaned_reviews: got these in because other brand was discontinued. everything was in order until i tried to make a cup. first try, machine cut off after 5 seconds of brew cycle. hmm, maybe ran out of water...!? no. tried rotating cup .... still shut off. cleaned out the brew chamber, insert new cup.. tried again, still shut off. hmm, getting worried... machine crap out..!? no. tried another brand of coffee, not this flavor, but brewed fine. determined that if i shake the pod, then tap the pod on the counter.... i get about 30% succes rate. otherwise, they dont work.... oh yeah, did i mention...two different brew machines, same issues.

title: Delicious and eco-friendly as well!
review_description: I received a sampler of these months ago for my birthday from my housemate. I loved them! I just found them on Amazon and decided to 'experiment' with flavors. I ordered the chocolate variety pack and the chocolate raspberry truffle pack (my favorite and was my gift previously mentioned!) They are amazing! The description on the lid of each pod label is 100% correct; whatever it says that is the flavor, by golly it is -- some other brands' flavors listed is nowhere near the a actual flavor. I like the fact that the pods themselves are biodegradable and compost friendly which is very eco-friendly. I use them in my Keurig and my housemate opens them up and makes the coffee in his French press. The flavor isn't bitter or artificial tasting like other I have tried, they have a nice smooth flavor and you really don't need to add any creamer or sugar to enhance the flavor. I like the chocolate raspberry truffle with a little squirt of Redi-Whip cream on top and some chocolate sprinkles or powder as well. I served this to company and they thought I brewed this in a cappuccino machine. I showed them the pods and now they will order some as well. They are great to brew in my travel mug and out the door I go. Thank you for an excellent product.

title: 100mg CAFFEINE!!!
review_description: I bought these intending to drink them in the evening like hot cocoa. They are basically hot cocoa without the chocolate. I absolutely adore the taste. They are VERY sweet, so if you don't like super sweet things you may not like them. However, I was surprised to see when they arrived that they contain 100mg CAFFEINE! It's fine, I'll just drink them in the mornings. However it's in pretty small print so I could have missed it, which would have been bad! I checked the listing again and the text about the caffeine is indeed there on one of the images, however if I missed it others may too. So I just wanted to leave a warning about the CAFFEINE.

title: Works perfectly in Keurig 2.0
review_description:
I read the reviews before buying and was concerned I would have “exploding cups” or not be able to brew as the 2.0 is notorious for not accepting off brand k-cups.

I rec’d the correct flavor and immediately opened the box. I assume the company has listened to the customer’s feedback as the cups are no longer a thick plastic, at least my box wasn’t. The k-cups were the same as any other.

I popped it in my Keurig and it brewed a perfect cup. My home smelled like a Reese’s cup and the coffee was delicious. I will say the coffee was a little strong compared to other medium roasts because they put more coffee in their pods than other brands, but it’s nothing crazy.

Overall, don’t be afraid to buy, seems like the prior issues have been fixed.
