title: Yum
review_description:
have ordered crazy cups about 8 separate times and several different flavors. I have never had any issue with a “blow out” or grounds in my coffee. I have only drank it hot but they have all been amazing. My daughter is a caramel and Carmel macchiato nut. She loves these!
To give a balanced review: the tops are a little tougher than some other k-cups I have used but this has never caused an issue. The boxes have come damaged several times. The sides are crushed in because whoever packs them (Amazon?) sometimes puts them in a bag mailer. So of course they are going to get smashed. Never bothered the actual product but if you were thinking about a gift I would take that into consideration.
I had to share the love because when I looked at the reviews there were quite a few negative reviews. Bottom line- I have never had a bad experience with these and would recommend to anyone.

title: As Far As Flavored Coffee Goes...
review_description: This is my husband's favorite flavored coffee, and brand. I don't particularly like raspberry, but even I like it. In our quest to find a chocolate-flavored coffee, I guess the biggest reality is none of the coffee bean growers can grow chocolate coffee beans, or any other flavor. The "flavors" are added in later, by all the coffee suppliers. We find Crazy Cups is the closest to the taste and aroma we are looking for. I love that that they have such a wide variety of flavors. However, since they do have a large variety, it's easy to misread them. Make sure you read the exact flavor you want to order and don't blame the company because you didn't read correctly, and make sure you give an honest review for the right products.

title: Flavorful, But the Ingredients That Give the Flavor Are Not Specfied
review_description: The ingredient list for this Crazy Cups Flavored Coffee for Keurig K-Cup Machines, Caramel Vanilla, states that this product contains 100% Arabica Coffee and natural and artificial flavors. The natural and artificial flavors are not specified. I do not usually drink flavored coffees, but my wife does, so we decided to try these K-Cups. The K-Cups fit in our Keurig machine and brew coffee without any problem. To us, the caramel flavor seems more dominate than the vanilla and the coffee has a sweet flavor, so much so that my wife needs to add only very little sugar to suit her taste. She states that she finds the coffee tasty and she likes it. As for me, I would have preferred that the ingredients be defined a little better, so I would know whether I am drinking artificial or a real sugar product. The Amazon product page does state that there is no “added sugar,” but since this coffee is definitely sweet, there has to be some sweet ingredient here that is not defined. In any event, if you are looking for a flavorful coffee, you may want to give these K-Cups a try.
cleaned_reviews: the ingredient list for this crazy cups flavored coffee for keurig k-cup machines, caramel vanilla, states that this product contains 100% arabica coffee and natural and artificial flavors. the natural and artificial flavors are not specified. i do not usually drink flavored coffees, but my wife does, so we decided to try these k-cups. the k-cups fit in our keurig machine and brew coffee without any problem. to us, the caramel flavor seems more dominate than the vanilla and the coffee has a sweet flavor, so much so that my wife needs to add only very little sugar to suit her taste. she states that she finds the coffee tasty and she likes it. as for me, i would have preferred that the ingredients be defined a little better, so i would know whether i am drinking artificial or a real sugar product. the amazon product page does state that there is no “added sugar,” but since this coffee is definitely sweet, there has to be some sweet ingredient here that is not defined. in any event, if you are looking for a flavorful coffee, you may want to give these k-cups a try.

title: Caramel Vanilla is a winner
review_description: This one comes with 80 individual Keurig pods with a key selling point being that each pod has 13 grams of coffee versus the standard 10 grams. The coffee portion is punched up to make the pods suitable for iced coffee (let the brew drip into a glass of ice) or for a decent hot cup at the 10 ounce setting. Typically I'm not a fan of flavored coffees but the caramel vanilla version is well done with good flavors that are blended in harmony with the base coffee flavor. Worth it.
cleaned_reviews: this one comes with 80 individual keurig pods with a key selling point being that each pod has 13 grams of coffee versus the standard 10 grams. the coffee portion is punched up to make the pods suitable for iced coffee (let the brew drip into a glass of ice) or for a decent hot cup at the 10 ounce setting. typically i'm not a fan of flavored coffees but the caramel vanilla version is well done with good flavors that are blended in harmony with the base coffee flavor. worth it.

title: Caramel vanilla
review_description: The Carmel Vanilla flavor is pretty good. There are a bunch of different flavors offered, and all of the reviews are mixed together, so this review is for the Caramel Vanilla One. Right when you open the box, you can smell the strong scent. The box is large, and each of the k-cups are loose in the box (not individual boxes of 6, 12, etc). This bulk pack would be great for offices or parties. Expiration for the ones I received is April 2022, so a little more than a year to use. The coffee has a strong flavor and it’s not bitter. It’s good with cream and a little sugar. I’d say it’s a medium roast.

title: Flavor's good but irritated stomach/esophagus lining
review_description: I usually buy Starbucks peppermint mocha but it has not been available so I tried this brand. I liked the flavor but after a week of drinking the coffee, I developed a chronic cough. I have never had reflux issues or a sensitive stomach, but some ingredient in this coffee caused GERD symptoms. I stopped drinking it and symptoms are gone. This may be a completely individual issue due to allergies, but I wanted to make others aware in case they experience the same thing. It took me weeks to make the connection. Otherwise, the coffee was flavorful and reasonably priced.

title: SHODDY MANUFACTURER'S PACKAGING
review_description: I receive this product every month, so obviously I really like the coffee. What I don't like is the manufacturer packing. This product is shipped with other Subscribe and Save items. I admit that Amazon could make more intelligent choices as to the other products contained in the shipping box but that is not the core problem. The issue is the manufacturer packaging. It is a flimsy paper barely substantial enough to be shaped into a box-like shape. The packaging can be torn with the bare hand by a child. The result is damaged and unusable pods. If the coffee weren't so good I would change brands. Instead I keep looking for another brand that tastes as good and is packaged properly. So with a taste worth a five and packaging worth only a one, I split the difference with a resulting score of a three.

title: Awsome - Highly Recommended

These Crazy Cups Premium Hot Chocolate, Salted Caramel pods were included in a sampler pack the manufacture sent me to review but I liked it so much that I bought it. While I haven't worked my way through all of the flavors, this one is likely going to be my favorite.

Highly Recommended!

CFH

title: I find that other salted caramel cocoa like Dunkin Donut’s tasted kind of gross to me
review_description:
This is my latest addiction. I find that other salted caramel cocoa like Dunkin Donut’s tasted kind of gross to me. I bought this to try it out when it was on sale and now I’m hooked. I have a glass almost every day now, I know I shouldn’t but I can’t help it! It works perfectly with my Keurig Elite and it is cheaper than going out and getting cocoa at a local independent shop. I feel like that addiction won’t be ending until the weather starts to warm up again.

As for flavor, it isn’t too salty, just the right amount and it is a nice creamy chocolate taste to it. It really is the perfect blend.

title: Flow Problems & Bland Taste
review_description:
The blend produces a liquid a bit too thick to properly flow out of the K-cup's exit hole, and forms a water tension bridge over it, only after enough water is pushed into the cup, ie enough pressure applied, does some of the hot chocolate come out. When the cup is finished brewing, there's quite a bit of liquid left inside it. This has happened to every cup I've tried, on my own machine (B155) and other's machines, 4, 6, 8, 10, or 12 oz.

The kicker is even on 4oz, and draining the cup manually after it's done, the flavor is bland and not sweet at all, definitely recommend the Oatmeal Biscotti and Cinnamon Bun over this and the Salted Caramel, which just tastes like you lifted the burned acidic flavor out of a bad cup of coffee, added a lot of sugar and a hint of rotten fruit up top.
cleaned_reviews: the blend produces a liquid a bit too thick to properly flow out of the k-cup's exit hole, and forms a water tension bridge over it, only after enough water is pushed into the cup, ie enough pressure applied, does some of the hot chocolate come out. when the cup is finished brewing, there's quite a bit of liquid left inside it. this has happened to every cup i've tried, on my own machine (b155) and other's machines, 4, 6, 8, 10, or 12 oz. the kicker is even on 4oz, and draining the cup manually after it's done, the flavor is bland and not sweet at all, definitely recommend the oatmeal biscotti and cinnamon bun over this and the salted caramel, which just tastes like you lifted the burned acidic flavor out of a bad cup of coffee, added a lot of sugar and a hint of rotten fruit up top.

title: 2.25 Stars. Eval is broken down by product.
review_description: I ordered a variety pack for the 2021 Christmas season, but I mostly received cappuccinos and dark chocolate. Out of 44 packets, I only got 6 milk chocolate. I wanted to return/exchange it but they don't accept returns. WHO DOESN'T STAND BY THEIR PRODUCT? I'm giving this 2.25 stars based on the following evaluation: Vanilla Cappuccino - 5 stars (amazingly rich and flavorful), Hazelnut Cappuccino - 0 stars (I actually threw them away), Caramel Cappuccino - 3 stars, Dark Chocolate - 3 stars, Milk Chocolate - 4 stars, no-exchange policy - 0 stars, even distribution of product - 1 star, product condition - 2 stars (the product in many packets had hardened and looked and tasted old). I wouldn't recommend this product.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: One pod was open/used, very thin and no taste
review_description:
Received item and box looked unsealed, but figured maybe it was damaged in shipping. Opened box and started putting away and noticed bottom of box had a lot of grounds in it. Then found a pod that appeared opened and used.
These do not have much flavor and brew very thin, all you taste is water really even on a small cup or expresso size setting. Just really no flavor or thickness. They have a lot left in them after brewing unlike most other pods so it’s almost like they don’t really brew.
I liked the amount of flavor options offered in the box initially, but you do not taste any of the flavors.
Description of product in listing also stated you could come brew over ice which was what I was really looking for. They are even thinner and more tasteless as cold brew.
Do not recommend this product at all. If you like flavored coffee, thicker coffee, or cold brew, avoid these. They are thin, tasteless, and seem to be a very cheap, poorly made product. Not with the money.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: DO NOT PURCHASE, THESE DO NOT WORK WITH KEURIG MACHINES
review_description:
I purchased these K-cups because the flavors sounded interesting and they looked aesthetically pleasing (I really need to stop buying things because they look pretty). Every time I tried to pop one of these suckers into my Keurig machine, it would immediately shut off. I thought, well maybe its my machine, so I tried one of the Starbucks K-cups I have, and it works just fine. I also have a brand new Keurig (the one that makes lattes and whatnot) so I highly doubt its my coffee maker. I am really let down, because I really wanted to try these! I'm probably going to see if I can just get my money back, because I don't need these just collecting dust in my pantry.

Don't waste your money like I did. Don't buy something because it looks "cool". The only thing "crazy" about these K-Cups, is the fact that they cause your Keurig to have a literal meltdown.
cleaned_reviews: i purchased these k-cups because the flavors sounded interesting and they looked aesthetically pleasing (i really need to stop buying things because they look pretty). every time i tried to pop one of these suckers into my keurig machine, it would immediately shut off. i thought, well maybe its my machine, so i tried one of the starbucks k-cups i have, and it works just fine. i also have a brand new keurig (the one that makes lattes and whatnot) so i highly doubt its my coffee maker. i am really let down, because i really wanted to try these! i'm probably going to see if i can just get my money back, because i don't need these just collecting dust in my pantry. don't waste your money like i did. don't buy something because it looks "cool". the only thing "crazy" about these k-cups, is the fact that they cause your keurig to have a literal meltdown.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Poor Quality Cup
review_description: I've ordered Crazy Cups coffee samplers for a while and I do enjoy the flavor. My problem is that this is the only brand of cups that consistently has problems with my Keurig. The problem seems to be primarily related to the inability of the Keurig needle to puncture the bottom of the K-Cup cleanly on a consistent basis. This causes the brewer to shut down with grounds dripping everywhere and no coffee in the cup or a cup of coffee filled with floating grounds. I enjoy trying other varieties of k-cups and this is the only brand that has this problem. Additionally, while other k-cups have a return policy, this brand is NOT returnable.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Some really good flavors in this pack
review_description:
I love flavored coffees and I love trying out new flavors. This pack gives you tons of flavors to try, and you are sure to find at least one that you will love! I have seen some reviews here that state that their pods sometimes did not work, or left coffee grounds everywhere or whatever. I will say honestly that I did not have that problem with any of the pods in my pack. There were a few pods that for whatever reason seemed to have "bubbled." The top of the pod and/or the sides were bubbled. But the coffee in them seemed fine. I am using a Keurig Mini Plus, and all of my pods worked with this machine with no problem.

Here is a breakdown of my impressions of each flavor that I received in this pack:

White Chocolate Strawberry: Smells like Strawberry Quick or Captain Crunch with Crunchberries while brewing. Definitely taste the strawberry, but it’s got a bitter aftertaste.

Chocolate Glazed Donut: This one is pretty tasty. It does taste a bit like a chocolate donut tastes, and no bitter aftertaste, so I am happy with it.

Cinnamon French Toast: I have tried the Double Donut Coffee flavored k-cups, and they also have a Cinnamon French Toast flavor. My thoughts on that one were that it tastes like burnt coffee with cinnamon. Which kind of makes sense, I guess. I just wasn’t a fan. BUT...the Crazy Cups version of Cinnamon French Toast? A completely different experience. As soon as it started brewing, there was a cinnamon/maple aroma that was very reminiscent of french toast. The flavor was the same: cinnamon with a hint of maple. I did get some sort of toasty flavor, but not burnt toast like the Double Donut Coffee version. No bitter aftertaste. This one was subtle, but lovely.

Toasted Oatmeal Cookie: My thought was that this would probably be similar to the Cinnamon French Toast flavor, but no. When it was brewing it actually did smell kind of like Oatmeal Cookies baking, which is bizarre but good. I was trying to think of what was in an oatmeal cookie that they could have replicated here...butter and brown sugar maybe? The taste was slightly like carmel, but not exactly. Again, a really lovely flavor.

Butter Pecan Swirl: definitely has a buttery, nutty aroma while brewing. The flavor is more nutty than buttery.

Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup: I can’t decide if I like this one, honestly. It had a vaguely peanut butter smell when brewing, and did in a way taste like a peanut butter cup. But it also had this weird “dirt” flavor to it. I guess some would argue that peanuts have a weird dirty flavor, and they wouldn’t be wrong, so, maybe this is spot on in terms of flavor? I just don’t know if I would drink it all the time.

Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: I definitely smell the raspberry when this is brewing. Nice raspberry flavor with a hint of chocolate. A tiny bit bitter at the finish like the White Chocolate Strawberry was. Maybe this is due to the berry flavoring?

Death by Chocolate: Okay...this does have a more chocolatey flavor than any of the others. Kind of reminds me of the dark chocolate suckers you can get from Sees Candy.

Salted Caramel: One of my favorites, at least in the brewing process, because I love salted caramel, and this smells amazing while brewing! Taste is also really good! The finish is very caramelly.

Bananas Foster Flambe: Yep, this smells and tastes like bananas and caramel. There are other banana flavored things that I have tried that taste a little to fake, but this flavor of coffee, for me, did not tip too far into the “fake banana” realm.

Vanilla Pumpkin Spice: Very nice “pumpkin spice” aroma as it’s brewing, but not too strong. But, not really a fan of this one in general. Not a whole lot of “pumpkin spice” flavor while you’re drinking it, though the finish is nice.

Peppermint Chocolate Mocha: This one was okay, but really could have had a bit more peppermint in it. I do understand that it’s easy to go overboard with the peppermint, but a tiny bit more would have helped here.

Better than Hazelnut: Loved this one! VERY hazel-nutty, if that’s a word, and I love hazelnut. I have had some hazelnut coffees that are more chocolate, or taste more like Nutella, but this one is more hazelnut than anything else, and I am fine with that.

Cinnamon Churro: This one was a bit underwhelming. Could have used a lot more cinnamon flavor. I’ve tried this twice now, and both times I’ve been disappointed by the lack of flavor.

Chocolate Coconut Dream: When this is brewing, there is a definite aroma of a Mounds Bar, or some other chocolate coconut candy. There is a nice chocolate/coconut taste to this one, very much like an Almond Joy or Mounds.

Caramel Pumpkin Spice: Same as the Vanilla Pumpkin Spice above. A nice aroma of Pumpkin Spice while brewing, but this one had that layer of Caramel that smelled really delicious. Tastes amazing as well! This is one of my favorite flavors so far. A good one for the fall season!

French Vanilla Twist: This smelled a lot like a glazed donut while brewing. The taste has a very mild but pleasant vanilla flavor, with some toasty notes.

Caramel Vanilla: Kind of like this one didn’t really know what it wanted to be, caramel or vanilla. There wasn’t enough of either flavor to give it any kind of distinction. For caramel, I prefer the “Salted Caramel” flavor, and for vanilla, I prefer the “French Vanilla Twist.”

Chocolate Meltaway: Really nice chocolate aroma while brewing, and a good strong chocolate flavor. This may be another of my favorites.
cleaned_reviews: i love flavored coffees and i love trying out new flavors. this pack gives you tons of flavors to try, and you are sure to find at least one that you will love! i have seen some reviews here that state that their pods sometimes did not work, or left coffee grounds everywhere or whatever. i will say honestly that i did not have that problem with any of the pods in my pack. there were a few pods that for whatever reason seemed to have "bubbled." the top of the pod and/or the sides were bubbled. but the coffee in them seemed fine. i am using a keurig mini plus, and all of nice chocolate/coconut taste to this one, very much like an almond joy or mounds. caramel pumpkin spice: same as the vanilla pumpkin spice above. a nice aroma of pumpkin spice while brewing, but this one had that layer of caramel that smelled really delicious. tastes amazing as well! this is one of my favorite flavors so far. a good one for the fall season! french vanilla twist: this smelled a lot like a glazed donut while brewing. the taste has a very mild but pleasant vanilla flavor, with some toasty notes. caramel vanilla: kind of like this one didn’t really know what it wanted to be, caramel or vanilla. there wasn’t enough of either flavor to give it any kind of distinction. for caramel, i prefer the “salted caramel” flavor, and for vanilla, i prefer the “french vanilla twist.” chocolate meltaway: really nice chocolate aroma while brewing, and a good strong chocolate flavor. this may be another of my favorites.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Absolutely great flavors - except when you get a cupful of grounds.
review_description:
The first few boxes I bought, I had ZERO issues with the pods. Pop them in and voila, a wonderful cup of coffee. Next box, the first couple of pods brewed just fine. Then, randomly the pod would overflow and there would be grounds in the coffee. Returned the box, got another - same thing. Some pods brewed fine - others 'exploded'. I cleaned my coffee maker- didn't help. Bought a new 1 cup coffee maker- didn't help.

I don't know why I didn't have issues with the first couple of boxes. I did all the troubleshooting - so I think something is up with their pods. Note: the problems were not attributed to certain flavors.

I eventually just started pouring the contents of the pod into the 'ground' receptacle to avoid the mess.

The coffee flavors are absolutely awesome but I wish I could just use the pods without worrying about a big mess and a cupful of grounds.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: These were great, i didnt think i was going to get ...
review_description: These were great, i didnt think i was going to get so many duplicates that kinda sucked a bit but i wasnt like super upset, it was like more of an Awe moment then that was it. as for flavors, i tried 3 so far, because i wanted to get an idea based on how most coffees taste to me ( this is my first time using pods just got me a Keurig) so far all have worked in there. Caramel Truffle Sundae is what i used first, smelled divine, don't think i really tasted what made it a sundae or truffle but the caramel was good. Banana foster i tried, because A)normally not a banana person and B) its a strong differnt flavor then im use to with most of my coffee or similar drinks, so i thought this would give me a good idea of how flavored they are. IT was not over powering, just a hint at the first sip each time, but then turned to the more familiar warm coffee taste. this was good but it made me worry since banana is such a strong flavor and it was so mild, so i tried peppermint mocha one. WHICH IS MY FAVORITE DRINK EVER by the way. i love almost all things peppermint mocha. i was a bit disappointed i wanted the peppermint to be stronger, while it was there, it was barely a hint. and no chocolate tasting at all. These are still great, don't get me wrong, they taste yummy and are great coffee in general. not too strong not too weak. but i do wish the flavors were a bit more bold. still got more flavors to try ( by the way i got 16-17 flavors in the 4 count, one set of 4 several sets of 3, 2 sets of 2 and then 2 singles)

title: Fun Sampler Mix!
review_description:
I had no issues with the quality of this coffee sampler - all of them were shipped in a blue sampler box, and all K-cups were perfectly intact.

I thought it was a fun variety - I love experimenting with new flavors, and finding new things to enjoy. There was a good mix of teas, regular coffee (dark, medium and light roasts), flavored coffee, cappuccino, hot cocoa, and even a couple of hot apple ciders to try. I think my favorite was actually the Cake Boss Hazelnut Biscotti - so strong and delicious! Even theCake Boss Buddy's Blend tasted good, so I might end up getting the Cake Boss variety sampler next! I also really enjoyed the Crazy Cups Vanilla Cloud Premium Cappuccino (very smooth and sweet) and the Southern Pecan by Copper Moon.

There were a quite a lot of K-cups that I weren't too crazy about, but I never go into a sampler expecting to love them all - I planned on getting this to see what specific brands to continue sampling further, and that's what I got. It was fun to try something new every day!
cleaned_reviews: i had no issues with the quality of this coffee sampler - all of them were shipped in a blue sampler box, and all k-cups were perfectly intact. i thought it was a fun variety - i love experimenting with new flavors, and finding new things to enjoy. there was a good mix of teas, regular coffee (dark, medium and light roasts), flavored coffee, cappuccino, hot cocoa, and even a couple of hot apple ciders to try. i think my favorite was actually the cake boss hazelnut biscotti - so strong and delicious! even thecake boss buddy's blend tasted good, so i might end up getting the cake boss variety sampler next! i also really enjoyed the crazy cups vanilla cloud premium cappuccino (very smooth and sweet) and the southern pecan by copper moon. there were a quite a lot of k-cups that i weren't too crazy about, but i never go into a sampler expecting to love them all - i planned on getting this to see what specific brands to continue sampling further, and that's what i got. it was fun to try something new every day!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Press Firmly! Flavors are Decent!
review_description:
Tip: My first one didn’t pierce all the way and oozed our the top of the machine creating quite a mess. Since then, I’ve learned to press firmly when I close the Keurig lever. Then I open it and make sure the rim is flat against the Keurig (this means it’s fully punctured), then you are golden! Ive caught a few errors this way, then repressed firmly, and the ooze has never happened again. It’s because the cups are larger.

Flavor: The flavors are 80% delicious, with some being the best coffee I’ve ever had. The chocolate varieties were disappointingly my least favorite; they just weren’t chocolatey. The French toast and Berry ones are off the chain!

Strength: Due to the size, They can truly be used with iced coffee and/or have enough power to brew two 10 oz cups.

I would recommend, and I will be reordering.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Super strong, but tastey flavors.
review_description:
Beware, the coffee is super strong! My husband and I enjoy strong coffee(he takes it black I do little milk) but these, wow! Weve found that we have to run it the the keurig 2-3 times and mix the cups to get a little weaker balance of flavor and caffeine, otherwise we get the jitters. Love that these cups are recyclable, and love the flavors. Some flavors are better and more noticeable than others, some are very bland. Like everyone says, peanut butter and jelly is delicious, so is blackberry blast. Our number of flavors are off like everyone else's, which is not a big deal for us but they shouldn't tell you how many of each to expect if it's not accurate. Love that the coffee itself is organic and gluten free,which many coffees are except for some of the flavored ones. Making note of it just made me more comfortable.
*Used 1 of the cups to make a pot of coffee this am... there's enough in 1 pod to make a half pot of coffee! 😳. That's how strong they are! 😆Be ready.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great way to experiment with flavors you are not sure of...
review_description: First off, I usually don't like a lot of flavored coffees, so keep that in mind. I really only "loved" two of the flavors, but the rest were just so-so. I did get more of the two flavors that I loved (Blackberry blast and Pina Colada). So I would recommend if you don't know what flavors you would really like and want to experiment before making a commitment to a full box of one flavor. The most you get is two of one flavor and a several that it's just one of the flavor. So you get to try all of them without being "stuck" with a bunch of pods that you don't like. Also, none of the flavors were so bad that I could not drink and I thought the quality of the coffee was good. As a side note, I thought the Pina Colada flavor made really good iced coffee. I found this out after a cup cooled too much to drink and I decided to put over ice.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: 40-count Crazy Cups Flavored Coffee Single Serve Cups for Keurig K Cups Brewer Variety Pack Sampler from Custom Variety Pack
review_description: A good variety pack and a great way to explore Crazy Cups flavors (especially since some of the flavors are really crazy). When I ordered, this picture showed a different variety than I received (which they do say at the bottom of their description). It's been about two weeks since I ordered and received my shipment and the picture shown now does accurately show what I received so it appears the seller does try and update their picture every so often to match what they can provide. I am a little disappointed that I only received one of some flavors while receiving four of others, so my one comment to the sellers is maybe ensure you ship at least two of a flavor....my significant other and I have had to agree to brew a few of them only when the other is home so we can both try out the single cups. Other than that, I am pleased with the price and am happy to now have a better idea what flavors sound strange but taste amazing and which fall a little short.

cleaned_reviews: they were good but to much chocolate flavors

title: Love all the flavors included!
review_description: I love this hot chocolate set! All three of the flavors are delicious! I only wish that they had a set that included all of their hot chocolate flavors. The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is that sometimes, the k- cup seemed to get clogged and would not completely empty. Initially, I was having to slightly open and close the machine until it seemed to empty the mixture that was trapped in the k-cup & then brew again, on a smaller cup setting. Eventually, I figured out that I, if I made the hole in the bottom a little bigger, it would brew normally. The strange thing was that this didn't happen with every k-cup. This leads me to believe that maybe some of the cups had powder in them that had hardened up a little, causing the mixture to get stuck in the cup until it disolved enough to flow through. Either way, I love this brand of hot chocolate & coffee. I have ordered more from this brand & will continue to do so (especially, if they continue to have good prices).

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Tasty but pierce with care
review_description:
Mmmmm, smells nice. Unfortunately the plastic is harder and the cups shaped a little differently than the normal k-cups so sometimes the piercing has to be helped along with some extra force closing my brewer. Also sometimes the plastic cracks a little during the process and it dumps some grounds into my coffee.

These are still the best variety of flavors I've had and they're reasonably priced so I'm ordering them again even with the piercing flaws.

P.S. Who knew bananas in coffee would taste so good? My new favorite flavor!

title: Delicious but NOT truly dairy free!!
review_description:
We ordered the variety hot chocolate pack and checked the company website FAQs, reviews, the individual box ingredients thoroughly because my boyfriend has a SEVERE dairy allergy (whey).
He can have casein, which is a milk derivative because he has it every day in his non-dairy coffee creamer for the past 25 years.

These hot chocolates are absolutely delicious! I love them and will continue to drink them. But if you have a dairy allergy I would steer clear of them! My boyfriend was able to drink a few flavors but he encountered one that immediately caused a severe allergic reaction. Thankfully we were home & prepared to handle it promptly since it's a known allergy so he is ok. We went back to the website to verify. They should update with accurate ingredients and nutrition especially regarding allergens as it is extremely dangerous to have inaccurate info. It clearly says ALL their hot chocolates have no dairy and only casein. But there is 100% dairy (whey) in some of these.

So, please be safe and find an all vegan hot chocolate if you have an actual allergy. If not- these are super yummy!
cleaned_reviews: we ordered the variety hot chocolate pack and checked the company website faqs, reviews, the individual box ingredients thoroughly because my boyfriend has a severe dairy allergy (whey). he can have casein, which is a milk derivative because he has it every day in his non-dairy coffee creamer for the past 25 years. these hot chocolates are absolutely delicious! i love them and will continue to drink them. but if you have a dairy allergy i would steer clear of them! my boyfriend was able to drink a few flavors but he encountered one that immediately caused a severe allergic reaction. thankfully we were home & prepared to handle it promptly since it's a known allergy so he is ok. we went back to the website to verify. they should update with accurate ingredients and nutrition especially regarding allergens as it is extremely dangerous to have inaccurate info. it clearly says all their hot chocolates have no dairy and only casein. but there is 100% dairy (whey) in some of these. so, please be safe and find an all vegan hot chocolate if you have an actual allergy. if not- these are super yummy!

title: peppermint party = bad. Didn't drink after the first cup
review_description:
They were okay. I will try to write a helpful review. First of all, none of these popped inside Keurig. A crazy cup popped once, and that crazy cup was from a different package (it was red velvet flavor)/different third party. So a crazy cup might pop once in awhile, but not for the majority of the time.

Flavor-wise: molten chocolate souffle, frosted cinnamon, dulce de leche, maple, frosted oatmeal = all similar, not much different (just hot chocolate flavor if you don't pay too much attention to the flavors). Caramelized banana split: I think this had a bit of banana scent.. This was just okay. Irish creme cheesecake, peppermint party = bad. Didn't drink after the first cup.

Also, I tried some more flavors from different packages. Red velvet: color is really fake. Taste-wise, hard to distinguish if it were good or bad because I got very distracted by its color. Because color was pretty (bright red/pink), it tasted okay too to me lol. Macha: also had a really fake grass color. I wouldn't get this again (still better than the peppermint and creme cheesecake). Peanut butter: sucked, disgusting. Threw out after a few sips.

As you can see, I got all the flavors. So I hope you will!

title: Very weak flavor.
review_description: They are ok. The flavor is weak. A lot of the product stays in the k- cup. The k- cups were dirty or dusty when I opened the box , most likely from transit, its fine they were all intact. They definitely didn’t give me the flavors as advertised in the picture. I got one red velvet only and one mint. I learned that after i made the one k cup with 8 oz of water( thats the max my little machine allows) the flavor was weak and I actually opened another k cup and just poured it in and added a little cream/ half and half in and then i could truly taste and appreciate the flavor of the hot cocoa. It was delicious. So if i have to use 2 k-cups each time then I really only received 10 servings . I will definitely enjoy tasting all of the different flavors until I finish them but i won’t be purchasing again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Cute packaging but.....
review_description: I love the name! I loved the box that they sent these cute crazy cups in ! I even loved the colorful menu they sent in the box! Kudos to them for going the extra mile! But unfortunately the taste wasn't there in any of them for me, the taste was mediocre at best :( I love flavors I love different tastes and was really excited to try these!! I thought maybe it might have been my taste buds, so I let my mother who is not very fond of flavors drink a cup, it took a little convincing but she did, she really liked it ! ( but I am guessing it was from lack of flavor) I let my boyfriend try who likes flavors but also doesn't mind black coffee and he said he couldn't taste the flavors. Normally I don't like all the artificial flavoring of flavors but every once in awhile I will indulge in them, but these little cups were not worth the flavor! But like I said they did a good job on the packaging (which I have always been a sucker for! And it came quickly. They do look cute, the cup looked bigger than my other k cups but for perfectly ( I have a regular kurig not 2.0) hope this helped someone :)

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Don't be surprised if your box is not as described!
review_description: I love these flavors so far. I was disappointed that some flavors were substituted with Christmas or seasonal flavors so I didn't get exactly what was listed or in the quantities described. That was my purpose in getting such a big box to sample was for the biggest variety of flavors to try out. So that's a definite downside considering it was so detailed in the description as to what I would get in my box. I kinda feel if it was so precise that I should've gotten exactly what was listed. But what I have tried so far is really good. They have much more coffee and flavor to them and are really good for someone who really enjoys flavored coffee. If you don't like fruity or chocolate flavored coffee definitely skip this. But if you like some funky flavors or are open to trying something different this will be great. I have an older, smaller keurig machine that doesn't have a water reservoir and does single cups and it worked just fine, no grounds at all. Don't know if they'd work with the newer machines.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I love the coffee and the variety of flavors available
review_description: I love the coffee and the variety of flavors available. I only gave 3 stars for this particular sampler because the product description was not what I got and I was very disappointed that a couple of the mentioned flavors were not even included. Here is what my box had: 4 each of: Bananas Foster Flambe, Death By Chocolate, Caramel Truffle Sundae, Chocolate Coconut Dream, and Chocolate Raspberry Truffle. 3 each of Italian Chocolate Cheesecake, Frosted Oatmeal Cookie, Cinnamon Churro. 2 each of: Apple Pie a la Mode, Peanut Butter & Jelly Sandwich, Jamaican Me Crazy, and Chocolate Chipotle Mole. Only one each of: Salted Caramel, Peppermint Chocolate Mocha, and Pumpkin Vanilla Creme. I got none of the Blackberry Bliss or Pina Colada flavors, and only one of the Peppermint (which is one of my favorites) and was part of the reason why I chose this particular sampler. If you are up for being surprised as to the contents, this is a great variety box, if you want something specific don't count on this pack and try going directly to Crazy Cups' website and order what you want there.

title: BAD BARGAIN!!!!!
review_description: Not the worst k-cup I've had, but also not the best. The design of the k-cup keeps a lot of the cocoa powder left in the k-cup after it has supposedly all drained into the cup with the hot water, ready for you to have a nice cup of cocoa. But instead what you get is a very weak flavor and lackluster hot cocoa. It is adequate if you have nothing else. And although I couldn't tell a difference in taste between flavors, They did come through on their promise of a mixture of 6 different kinds. I got 10 each of 3 flavors, 9 each of 2 other flavors, and 2 of the final flavor. This is not a product I will be buying again. Too much money, Not enough taste.
cleaned_reviews: not the worst k-cup i've had, but also not the best. the design of the k-cup keeps a lot of the cocoa powder left in the k-cup after it has supposedly all drained into the cup with the hot water, ready for you to have a nice cup of cocoa. but instead what you get is a very weak flavor and lackluster hot cocoa. it is adequate if you have nothing else. and although i couldn't tell a difference in taste between flavors, they did come through on their promise of a mixture of 6 different kinds. i got 10 each of 3 flavors, 9 each of 2 other flavors, and 2 of the final flavor. this is not a product i will be buying again. too much money, not enough taste.

title: Fall flavors forever.  Hope you like hot cocoa and pumpkin stuff in February.

However, as the boxes progressed, it was an even higher ratio of hot cocoa and hot apple cider and pumpkin/seasonal flavors that everyone is pretty "over" by now Jan/Feb/March. There was less variety now in the most recent box (maybe trying to purge of all the holiday stuff?) then there was when I started getting these. I had to cancel the subscription. Six months of fall flavors and hot cocoas are too much. Nobody's drinking this stuff anymore.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Hit and Miss
review_description:
I LOVE flavored coffee and though this sampler would be perfect. In some ways it was and others it wasn't.

Disclaimer: I do not like the taste of fruit or jelly flavor in my coffee.

With that being said I did not care for about 1/4 of the flavors in this set. There were a lot of banana, raspberry, and berry flavored coffees that I didn't care for, but hey, if they're your thing then you may love them.

Overall most of the flavors were pretty pleasant especially the chocolate based ones.

I don't think I would but this set again, I would probably just look for specific 12 packs.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Good for my tastebuds, but not for my Keurig
review_description:
Most of the flavors were really tasty, especially the salted caramel, frosted oatmeal cookie, and italian chocolate cheesecake. The pumpkin and peanut butter and jelly were a little too florally aromatic for me-I felt like it interfered with the flavors. But overall, the taste of most was quite yummy.
My big issue was technical. Though they advertise 35% more coffee than regular k-cups, which does make them nice and strong, it also tends to clog my Keurig so that I have to run hot water through it a couple of times every few days. And randomly I get a cup full of coffee grounds. It makes me wonder if they are doing lasting damage to my machine. For this reason alone, I won't buy them again.

The flavors were ok and some I enjoyed more than others, like the banana one. If the texture was smooth they could be at least 4 stars.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Unique flavors
review_description:
I received the 40-count Crazy Cups a couple of weeks ago and have been trying a different flavor every day. I gave some to my daughter-in-law as well. We both love the Salted Caramel and Apple Pie flavors. I didn't like any of the chocolate flavors so far... the chocolate tastes bitter and is not a good compliment to the coffee (unfortunately, more than half of the flavors I received have chocolate in them....)
One thing I do like, it that the coffee is a medium roast - too many flavored coffees are light roast for some reason.
While the coffee was fun to try, I don't think I'll be switching from my normal (San Francisco Breakfast Blend)

title: Good chocolate... when you can get to it.
review_description: Good hot chocolate, but the cups don't always puncture properly when inserted in the machine. Sometimes it doesn't puncture at all, other times a large piece breaks off, other times it works fine. Also, as others have noted, the selection process is seemingly randomized rather than constant. Sometimes this works in your favor... other times not so much. I'll happily raise the rating as soon as the issues are fixed.

title: On time delivery, package damage
review_description:
I was going to request a refund because the package was damaged. That's FedEx though. I decided to keep it because first time it happened. Usually the coffee I buy from Amazon has a longer use by date. This only til November. However the coffee I buy is usually. This is a variety pack which you get tired of the same thing. I'll have to let you know if the coffee is as good as my regular brand.
So far not particularly pleased. Not many pods of unflavored coffee. The box says for Keurig including Keurig 2 which I have. So far Garibaldi brand will not work. The ones with the moose may or may not have been damaged in shipping, but 1 moose brand was torn open at one edge. Another was already flat on top as were several other brands. That causes loss of flavor apparently. A medium dark roast I tried was ok but the aroma of rich brewed coffee was lacking in smell and taste. There are flavored coffees and cappuccinos, as well as hot chocolate and some flavors like Entemann do not even say what's in the pod. Surprise in whatever flavor. It was not thoughtfully chosen. The use by date of October is unacceptable for a box of 50, especially when it's already losing flavors. I will never knowingly buy this brand but Crazy Cups packed it apparently, and I like their brand as variety pack. These were assorted brands and not very well handled at all. Will I buy from Crazy Cups again after this view of how they handle other brands, probably not, even definitely not.

title: Why are coffees with amazing delicious names made without sweetener? Such a disappointment.
review_description:
I open a k pod called something like Taffy Apple Extravaganza coffee and it tastes just like plain coffee! Even when I add Equal to it, it's still no Taffy Apply Extravaganza. This was true of ALL the coffees. Blah without sweetener. Coffee pod makers, here's my note to you. Don't give your pod these delicious names and then leave out the sweetener!! In the batch I had the only one that lived up to its name was Caramel Cappucino from Grove Square. When I opened the pod after, there were no grounds inside. So maybe it was some kind of instant coffee with flavors and sweetener. That works for me! The coffee was sweet and delicious. (Maybe they should make one variety box with sweeteners and one without?)

Of the box, oddly the pods I liked most here Teas and Hot Chocolates! At least the teas tasted like real tea. Pretty good. And the hot chocolates were sweet. I have now bought some reusable pods and will just either put in my own coffee or buy regular coffee pods. Then I will add my own sweet creamer!! And I can change up flavors easily without investing in a whole box of k pod mystery.

review_description: If you like strawberry and almond cream coffee, or cherry and pumpkin, this pack is for you. If you are looking for some straight-forward coffee variety (like medium roasts or dark roasts) this pack is not for you. Bought it as a gift for someone who got a new Keurig. We tried a dozen or so of these cups.The rest of the flavors are so wacky there was no appetite to try them. Nasty and overly sweet.

title: They just don't work

I was really excited for this product. It doesn't work in the Keurig, even though it's in a K- cup. The hot chocolate just turns into a sludge and doesn't pour through. I have to peel off the top to get it in my mug. I have turned to just peeling the top off, pouring the powder in my mug, and adding hot water... like a peasant.
The flavors were also "off." They tasted very chemically made and most were too sweet with not much flavor. Overall, sadly disappointed.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: You Get What You Get
review_description: My husband and I decided the flavors sounded good so we wanted to try a variety pack to try several at once. We blew up the picture to look at the flavors pictured and purchased this one because in the picture were Death By Chocolate and Maple French Toast which we wanted to try. It arrived (right on time) and I started putting the cups away. I searched through them, and NO Maple French Toast. I counted the cups and we got the entire 40 count. I pulled up the listing and realized the flavors were listed in the description. No Maple French Toast in the description despite the fact it IS in the picture. The description is ALSO wrong. It listed 3 Bananas Foster and we did not get 3 of those (but I'm not sad about that.) Apparently when it comes to the variety packs, you just get whatever they feel like throwing in so you'd be better off ordering the single flavor if there's one you want to try. The one flavor I tried so far was good but it's VERY annoying that we weren't able to trust either the picture or description.
cleaned_reviews: my husband and i decided the flavors sounded good so we wanted to try a variety pack to try several at once. we blew up the picture to look at the flavors pictured and purchased this one because in the picture were death by chocolate and maple french toast which we wanted to try. it arrived (right on time) and i started putting the cups away. i searched through them, and no maple french toast. i counted the cups and we got the entire 40 count. i pulled up the listing and realized the flavors were listed in the description. no maple french toast in the description despite the fact it is in the picture. the description is also wrong. it listed 3 bananas foster and we did not get 3 of those (but i'm not sad about that.) apparently when it comes to the variety packs, you just get whatever they feel like throwing in so you'd be better off ordering the single flavor if there's one you want to try. the one flavor i tried so far was good but it's very annoying that we weren't able to trust either the picture or description.

title: BUYER BEWARE NOT AS ADVERTISED
review_description: This was advertised as NO DUPLICATES and included a list of what would be included. This list contained a nice assortment of regular and decaf coffee, flavored and regular, as well as teas, regular and herbal, as well as hot chocolates and hot ciders. The box that was delivered however, contained NO Decaf, many DUPLICATES, only one cider. and was missing several of the herbal teas in the list. There were still 50 k-cups but the variety was far from what was described. While this order provided a selection of different things to try, it was disappointing to have duplicates, missing herbals and ZERO decafs. The description of the product made a point of stating NO DUPLICATE and indicating that decafs and several herbal were included. This description is the reason I chose to purchased it. Unfortunately it is not what I received. Other reviews indicated they received a lot of decaf so I'm thinking it's hit and miss on what ends up in the box. If you want what is advertised I would recommend against buying. If you don't mind a "Grab bag" of who knows what that included duplicates, then go for it.

title: Weird, unpleasant flavors that clogged my Keurig
review_description:
Several of the flavors in this box are not coffee, they're sugary flavored beverages. I think they taste terrible, but that's just an opinion. This is a variety pack, so that might be excusable.

What's NOT excusable is that these sugary non-coffee flavors clogged my Keurig machine, and made it dispense less liquid than usual. I had to run several cups of hot water through it to get things flowing again. I won't be buying this again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: It's Decent Coffee, But Try To Identify The Flavors...
review_description: First, let me state that I really wanted to like this coffee. I was intrigued by the flavors in the sampler, as I like unique flavors of coffee. That said, I was not blown away by any of the flavors. Many of them tasted exactly the same, and I couldn't tell what they were supposed to be. The best of the bunch with the strongest flavor is probably the peanut butter and jelly sandwich. In many of the others, the flavor is extremely weak. The other problem is with the k-cups themselves. They do not work well at all in a Keurig 2.0, probably because of the plastic cups. Yeah, it's nice to be environmentally conscious, but most people are not going to take the time to peel off the foil and deal with cleaning grounds out of a small plastic cup to recycle it. Most people are just going to toss it in the trash. This was a great disappointment.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Cup bottoms will not break plastic seal
review_description: I have a new very clean Keurig machine that works perfectly with a variety of brands of Keurig style pods - The issue is that these particular pod cups for some reason do not break the bottom seal when you close the pod holder - thus making a mess of the coffee and shutting down the machine. If you hold the cup and mash it in by hand - using brute force - some of them will snap-in and then you can close the pod holder and brew - however at least half of the cups will not break the bottom seal (the plastic part) and I have at least 20 pods that just made a mess all over the machine. Also, zero help or feedback from the seller after I emailed them for some replacement pods.
cleaned_reviews: i have a new very clean keurig machine that works perfectly with a variety of brands of keurig style pods - the issue is that these particular pod cups for some reason do not break the bottom seal when you close the pod holder - thus making a mess of the coffee and shutting down the machine. if you hold the cup and mash it in by hand - using brute force - some of them will snap-in and then you can close the pod holder and brew - however at least half of the cups will not break the bottom seal (the plastic part) and i have at least 20 pods that just made a mess all over the machine. also, zero help or feedback from the seller after i emailed them for some replacement pods.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I regret this purchase.
review_description: I tried to like these coffees, I did. I was extremely excited to try them, because the flavor descriptions sounded interesting and is so diverse. The banana flavor was the one I anticipated most. However, I only liked one flavor out of the entire box. Having ADHD, I drink coffee instead of medicating...& try just about any type or flavor that comes down the pike for variety. Although taste is subjective, I find it odd that the only flavor I liked is one that I normally don't-the peppermint mocha. I am also a lil irked that ironically, there was only one of the only flavor I liked in the entire box. Every single other flavor in the box was extremely acidic & left a funky aftertaste. I had several others try them, & they said the same thing. I may have received a bad batch, but unless every flavor was made in the same container or something, this seems unlikely. I truly regret paying $22 for one cup of coffee that I could actually swallow.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great Flavors Ruined by Bad Design
review_description:
These k-cups work about 20-30% of the time. Otherwise, they explode in the machine or worse. Today, my Keurig kept shutting down when I tried to brew these k-cups again, and then the descale-now alert came on. God only knows what these pods did to my machine, and whether it's even fixable. I'm really disappointed because the flavors were excellent in the ones I was able to try, and the promise of the flavors I'll never get to try since they exploded or failed...well, all I can say is:

Don't waste your money. This brand is faulty.

title: Not What I Expected
review_description: This had a nice variety of coffee and hot chocolate which is great because that is what I will be drinking primarily. There was no decaf. There was 2 K Cups of tea and they were both the same. There were also 2 K Cups of the same cider which I didn't know I would be receiving. I understand that it is a variety but I would have appreciated more of a variety. I didn't see an expiration date anywhere but I did receive a lot of "holiday" flavors such as pumpkin spice and eggnog. I'm not complaining since my favorite flavor of coffee/hot chocolate is pumpkin spice but it is a little strange to receive those flavors in March. This is a coffee and hot chocolate sampler. It is great to be able to try different flavors but I do wish there was more tea and no cider.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Don't let the flavor names fool you, they're all bland.
review_description:
I rarely write reviews on Amazon but I felt I had to review these Crazy Cups. When we buy K cups, it's usually Dunkin Donuts when they're on sale or Archer Farms from Target. Now you know our coffee history so you know we're not some aficionados thumbing our nose at anything that isn't gourmet.

When we saw these flavors they screamed buy me now! Which we did. We tried every combination possible to extract the flavor. Light, regular, and extra milk (the same with sugar) to no avail. The only hint of flavor was the aroma while they were brewing in the Keurig.

Maybe it was a bad batch? All the flavors tasted the same. Like some generic instant you'd get in an airport hotel room.

We both agreed that if this was purchased at a store, after the first few cups we would have returned them for an exchange.
cleaned_reviews: i rarely write reviews on amazon but i felt i had to review these crazy cups. when we buy k cups, it's usually dunkin donuts when they're on sale or archer farms from target. now you know our coffee history so you know we're not some aficionados thumbing our nose at anything that isn't gourmet. when we saw these flavors they screamed buy me now! which we did. we tried every combination possible to extract the flavor. light, regular, and extra milk (the same with sugar) to no avail. the only hint of flavor was the aroma while they were brewing in the keurig. maybe it was a bad batch? all the flavors tasted the same. like some generic instant you'd get in an airport hotel room. we both agreed that if this was purchased at a store, after the first few cups we would have returned them for an exchange.

title: Duplicated k-cups leaves a dissatisfied taste
review_description: This is the very first time we ordered a variety K-cup pack. We did receive 50 cups; however, the item really was not as described. We had duplicates. The item clearly states there are no duplicates. And it wasn't like just one or two items were duplicated--there were 7 duplicated items. Our box arrived with 3 teas, 20 hot chocolates, 4 apple ciders and 23 coffees. Very few of the items were the ones in the list that was described in the listing. The k-cups were just thrown into a box; however, they did arrive intact. I was expecting more teas and coffees and less hot chocolates in the box (again referring to the listing). So far we have tried 3 pods and two of them were terrible although I will admit that this is strictly a personal taste thing.
cleaned_reviews: this is the very first time we ordered a variety k-cup pack. we did receive 50 cups; however, the item really was not as described. we had duplicates. the item clearly states there are no duplicates. and it wasn't like just one or two items were duplicated--there were 7 duplicated items. our box arrived with 3 teas, 20 hot chocolates, 4 apple ciders and 23 coffees. very few of the items were the ones in the list that was described in the listing. the k-cups were just thrown into a box; however, they did arrive intact. i was expecting more teas and coffees and less hot chocolates in the box (again referring to the listing). so far we have tried 3 pods and two of them were terrible although i will admit that this is strictly a personal taste thing.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I'm not sure if I got a bad batch of cups or what
review_description: I am writing this review primarily because 2/3 of these that I have tried to us (4 out of 6) had something wrong with them. The water would not flow through the cups, even though my Keurig said it was brewing. I even went so far as to run a cleaning cycle on the coffee maker to be sure it wasn't that. I'm not sure if I got a bad batch of cups or what, but I probably won't take a chance on ordering these again. I had the same experience this morning with two cups in a row....different flavors....and neither would allow the water to go through the cup. However, the few flavors I got to taste were actually unique and I liked them. Just sad that these cups don't work well with my coffee maker.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Dont expect the right flavors
review_description: The item I received DID NOT match the description. I purchased this variety pack expecting the flavors and amount of each flavor that was listed under the product description and that is not what I recieved. 13 if my flavors were incorrect. And many of the ones I was so very impatiently looking forward to trying were not in the box. I went back to look at the product site to make sure that I didn't overlook somewhere saying variety box containing warehouse stock flavors. But nowhere can I find this. So don't expect to get the 40 flavors that are actually listed. Overall the coffee isn't bad. I just received more of the flavors I don't care for. And little or none of the ones I was supposed to recieve. Very dissapointing.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Gross
review_description:
Pros: Cheap, huge variety w/o any duplicates, smells good.
Cons: Almost all of them taste pretty gross. I even tried making smaller cups on strong setting, but still tasted watered down. I tried making an I've coffee from it & even added some chocolate syrup & it just tasted like funny water.
I bought these as a fill in, between my reg orders of the Starbucks brand k cups. Never again.

title: did not get what was pictured
review_description: I don't usually leave comments on orders but was very disappointed in the picture versus the words on our order. It showed 6 red velvet cups and none came. In reading the order, I see that the box may not contain what is pictured and may vary in number of what chocolates are supplied. The first order we made from Crazy Cups came exactly as advertised and my sister, who is not a coffee drinker, really enjoyed them (except the banana- she's not a banana person). She was looking forward to trying the red velvet, and was disappointed to find not one in the box. It pays to read first before ordering....

title: Banana good- beware all other flavors
review_description: These were disappointing. I bought the sampler pack on the strength of the banana flavor I had purchased previously- which I would give 4 stars. I figured I'd try some of the other interesting flavors. Rather than give a breakdown of each flavor I will say that every other flavor other than banana was anywhere from undrinkable to 'meh'. The chocolate mint was probably the only other one I semi-enjoyed but not enough to buy again. The other flavors all suffered from a very chemically artificial taste. Most I dumped down the sink after a few sips. Oh well. That's why I like the samplers- didn't waste my money trying each one individually.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Dissatisfied
review_description: I had a really high hopes to try different coffee flavors as I would consider myself a foo foo coffee drinker. I thought the price was great for the amount of coffee received in this box. Unfortunately, the chemical taste that this coffee leaves behind is not the greatest. I have tried at least eight different flavors now, and out of each of those flavors there is something that just does not make this enjoyable. I’m thinking it is the flavor oil or flavor substance used to create the flavor within the coffee. I usually enjoy the Dunkin Orginal brand as a normal day to day coffee brand. Typically I drink my coffee with milk and sugar and top it off with a little whip cream and caramel sauce. I have not changed any way that I prepare these coffees. After brewing one cup in trying it solely alone, I still got some kind of chemical taste in my mouth. Now I have a huge box of coffee and have no idea what to do with the rest of them. Again, the price was definitely worth it for the amount of K cups received in the box, but if you can’t enjoy the coffee then it’s really not worth it at all.

title: NOT for diabetics!
review_description:
Updated review: Now that my wife went through nearly the whole box (since she had to throw away brew after brew because they were sweetened coffee/tea/hot chocolate), I'm changing my review to 1 star.
This product is good if you want your k-pod packed with sugar. If you want coffee or tea and a choice whether or not you want it sweet, then stay away from this product. As to me, when you consider how many you throw away (more than 50%), it is not even a good bargain per K-pod.

Original review: When I order coffee, I don't expect sugar in my K-Pod, unless specifically ordering a caramel french vanilla or some other variation of a sweet coffee. My wife, a diabetic, has tried about 10. At least 3 of the 10 she tried were sweetened. There is no writing on the K-Pods for the most part except for the name.
The price is good if you don't want to drink the same coffee every day, but what you get is a lot of stuff that won't/can't sell by itself as an individual box, and they are definitely not labeled whether or not they contain sugar, either on the case or on the individual K-Pods. I'm rating it a 2 based on that, even though the value earns a 5 star. I cannot rate the flavor because it is a crap-shoot, and presentation, well they are all in a box. So no presentation.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Faulty K-Cups
review_description:
My sister and I love our flavored coffees, and have a few cups a day. We received this shipment on April 13 and started using Crazy Cups flavored k-cups from Perfect Samplers a couple weeks ago. Hmm, we were surprised after a few successful cups when the machine shut down after a second or two after putting down the top. I thought my fairly new Keurig Select was at fault. This happened with 6 or 7 k-cups from this shipment before one exploded all over the counter area when the top was put down! I ordered a new Keurig Select, which we used yesterday morning for the first time. First cup was successful (another brand) but... second which was from this box of Crazy Cups turned off the new machine. Threw that one away and tried another- it worked but the new machine turned off again when the next k-cups was inserted! Both coffee makers work for other coffee brands but I hold my breath when using the Crazy Cups.

The same shipment which was ordered on April 11 has 49 flavored decaf Crazy Cups, but I’m almost leery of putting them out, hoping the new Keurig doesn’t get affected if another one explodes or stops the machine. I have the feeling that the cup itself is defective or has been sitting around too long. I am a frequent shopper with Amazon and don’t really want to take my business elsewhere. Any suggestions?

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Teenagers are the worst.
review_description:
A lot of coffee snobs on here. Geez.
Make no mistake, I had initially purchased this same brand a while back and had experienced the 'EXPLOSIVE CUP' syndrome many customers are referring to. The weak adhesive they used to seal the lid would simply fail, releasing the contents of the k-cup into a wonderful derpy gross heap of wet cigar ash and empty dreams.
I bypassed this deliciously fun circumstance by simply emptying the k-cup into a refillable filter, finishing the box, and swearing them off until such time as my children were old enough to force into indentured servitude.
My son is now 16 and more than willing to clean a mess or two in order to appease the car gods through the weekend. Figured now was a good time to retry them.
Unfortunately, my master plan failed ceremoniously... No mess... And now I have a teenager stealing my delicious new coffee.
Flavors are great. Not a big fan of the caramel variety as they seem a bit weak. The rest are rather tasty.

Edit: 8/17/2020
What kinda s*** you trying to pull?? They sent a random 'variety pack' with ZERO of the flavors pictured and brands I've never heard of nor wanted. Folgers???? Seriously!?!?!? Pull this crap on me again and I'm switching.

I wasn't going to waste my time and energy just to have them send me more nasty coffee, life is too short. And even giving them the benefit of the doubt as to the freshness of the coffee. If that was truly "fresh" then their coffee really is disgusting. I will NEVER waste my money on this brand ever again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I’ve had several I really enjoyed, and several I really disliked
review_description: I bought a box of regular flavors, and a box of decaf flavors. As far as the TASTE of the flavors, I’ve had several I really enjoyed, and several I really disliked. The reason I’m only giving it one star is because of the way the cups are made. They don’t work well in my Keurig. They become too pressurized and the foil seal becomes compromised. The result is water and coffee grounds all over the counter, and in every crack and crevice of the coffee maker. This has happened about 2 out of every 3 times I’ve tried to use them. Now I refuse to use what’s left of them for fear I’ll ruin my expensive coffee maker. So not only do I not get to drink any of the coffee I paid for, I also get the added bonus of a huge mess and possibly property damage.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Marketing: A  Coffee Taste: F  Worst Coffee Ever
review_description:
Crazy Cups Marketing: A
Crazy Cups Coffee Taste: F
The wide variety of unique and fun flavors sounded very tantalizing. Great job coming up with unique names for your flavors.
The problem is that Crazy Cups starts with bad coffee, then adds something very artificial for flavor. The end result is coffee that smells and tastes nothing like coffee. Most flavors smelled and tasted like burned liquid plastic. I could barely tell the difference in taste regardless of the flavor. My advice to the Crazy Cups is to hire the chemist from Gloria Jeans that created Butter Toffee (which actually smells and tastes like it is labeled, yummy!). Crazy Cups is the worst coffee I have ever tasted. Gross. Disgusting. Icky. Burned Liquid Plastic.

title: Economical way to try new flavors without the committment of buying an entire box of a single flavor
review_description:
I received 10 regular coffees (most of them single-source), 10 flavored coffees, 10 decaf coffees (mix of single-source and flavored), 10 cocoas, and 10 teas. It was well worth the gamble as this pack gave me the opportunity to try out flavors which I wouldn't risk buying an entire box for. If a flavor wasn't to my taste, then it was only one pod and I could move on to the next. If it was a flavor which I particularly liked, then I wrote its name down to order an entire box for my collection.

Each pod was well within its 'use by' date and there were no defects. I have absolutely no complaints with the sample pack, and the only admonition I can offer is to remember that you're receiving *assorted* pods. Out of 50 pods, you will invariably find flavors which you'll detest. But, at the same time, you will find flavors which you'll fall in love with. It's a gamble, but whether you're looking for fresh new flavors or just a break from the same old flavors which you have in the pantry, this is worth a try.

In my area, boxes of single flavor pods average around $10 dollars (online or in the store) each. If you try a new flavor by buying a box and hate it, then you're stuck: do you throw away the rest of the box, and thereby throw away the money you spent, or do you frantically try to pawn the rest of the box off on a friend (and still lose your money)? This sampler is fifty *different* flavors and if you don't like one, then you're committed to only the one cup that gets poured into the sink or potted plant. If you like one, then you can safely invest in buying a box of it.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Well above my expectations
review_description: If I'm being totally honest I've never been a huge fan of the taste of the coffee that came from k-cups. The convenience, yes. The taste, not so much. Bitter and burning are two words that come to mind to describe the flavor of the coffee in most k-cups I've tried. For the most part for years I've kept true to my drip coffee maker. Then my husband brought home a Keurig. Meh. I thought I'd order a variety pack and give something different a go. Friends, I have fallen hard for Crazy Cups. The flavors are incredible. Also, I know that they say they pack more coffee in to their cups but it seems to me they actually do. The coffee is not watered down with the flavor of that piece of your mom's baking chocolate you snuck thinking it would taste good. I would recommend giving this a try especially if you find most k-cup coffee not to your taste. You just might change your mind. I did.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Delicious and Saving me so much money!!
review_description:
Every morning before work I would always stop by the coffee shop to get a large cup of their "flavor of the day" with extra creamer and then I would add a couple packets of Stevia. My husband bought me a Keurig Mini Plus brewer for Christmas for me to have at my office and then I purchased a sample pack of these cups. This is saving me so much money and I have enjoyed every flavor so far! With my Stevia and Half & Half, I am averaging about 60c per cup of delicousness every morning instead of the $3 I used to spend and I get a choice of so many different flavors. Very impressed with these.

The cups *are* a little bigger than your standard K Cup so you'll want to push the cup down so the bottom needle punctures it before you close the lid of your Keurig. But, the size of these cups allow me to enjoy 2 cups of coffee from one pod, which is something I was unable to do with the other K Cup sizes.

You won't be disappointed if you try these out, especially if you're a flavored coffee lover like me.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: italian chocolate cheesecake and chocolate raspberry truffle 1 oatmeal cookie My favorite is the pumpkin vanille creme
review_description:
In this set, here is what we received:
4 each of: apple pie a la mode, pumpkin vanilla creme, jamaican me crazy, and peppermint chocolate mocha
3 each of: peanut butter and jelly sandwich, chocolate chipotle mole, and caramel truffle sundae
2 each of: cinnamon churro, death by chocolate, chocolate coconut dream, bananas foster flambe, salted caramel, italian chocolate cheesecake and chocolate raspberry truffle
1 oatmeal cookie

My favorite is the pumpkin vanille creme, it has a nice strong spiced flavor and isn't weak like some pumpkin coffees. The cinnamon churro and the applie pie a la mode tasted about the same to me, just like cinnamon which I enjoyed. No one in the house cared for the peppermint chocolate mocha, the mint flavor with coffee was not for us. My husband tried the peanut butter and jelly sandwich flavor, and said it was alright. He liked the chocolate coconut and the chocolate raspberry truffle the most.

All of the flavors have a distinct and strong flavors, which is what we like most about this brand. I don't like to buy a flavored coffee only to find out that it is a cheap bean with an artificial flavor added to cover the acidity and bitterness, and that isn't the case here. They used quality coffee and added quality flavor for a satisfying cup every time.

My Mr. Coffee brewer struggled to pierce these cups for some reason, but with a little extra force they did work and brewed fine.

title: If you're looking for excellent coffee at a fraction of the price you'd pay ...
review_description:
If you're looking for excellent coffee at a fraction of the price you'd pay in store... look no further.
I wasn't expecting such an awesome variety. Usually I find one or two that I don't like, but I enjoy every flavor this one has to offer. Outstanding!

Item arrived very quickly, as always with Amazon! Can't wait to drink them all so I can order more!

This will definitely be the go-to coffee pack from now on, no doubt about it.

The Coconut Dream is absolutely to die for! By far my favorite in the entire pack, great earthy coconut flavor with a hint of sweetness that my regular sweet cream really helps shine! This one is great as is, with cream, over ice, etc. Hoping to find this one alone so I can add more of it to the collection of k-cups we already have.

Next best flavor is the Italian Chocolate Cheesecake - a mild sweetness with Cheesecake overtones really makes this one shine. Now that I think about it, it might be as good or better than the Coconut Dream... Might have to do some drink testing and find out. The real deal breaker will come down to which one is more universal (iced, blended, etc.)

If you're looking for a crazy (Awesome!) bundle of coffee, look no further. Definitely buy asap!

-S

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great Variety - Great Coffee
review_description:
I am a coffee lover, and also a low carber. I have always treated my daily (or sometimes 2-3 times/daily) cup of coffee as my 'sweet treat for the day by adding torani sugar free syrups. I recently purchased a Keurig machine and fell in love with the different flavored kcups. These cups are sugar free, and the flavors are amazing. Best of all, no more syrups for me! I just add a few drops of EZ-sweetz and a splash of cream for a decadent treat I love the variety of different flavors that Crazy Cups has to offer. Every time I try a new one, I'm pleasantly surprised at how flavorful and close to the description they are! The variety pack is a great option to find your favorite flavors.

My favorites so far (I've ordered stand alone boxes of each)
PB & J Sandwich
Death by Chocolate
Cinnamon Churro (tastes like cinnamon toast crunch)
Peppermint Chocolate Mocha
Jamaican Java
Apple Pie Ala Mode

While the coffee snobs may look down their noses at me, I actually enjoy the coffee flavor as well. In my k machine, I do set the brew on 8 ounces and 'strong', and really enjoy the flavors and aroma. Everyone in my office always comes asking what flavor I'm drinking today. Great buy.
