flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: A 40-Flavor Journey!
review_description:
Let me tell you about my experience with the Coffee Pods Variety Pack Sampler, Assorted Single Serve Coffee for Keurig K Cups Coffee Makers, 2 Each of 40 Unique Coffees, Great Coffee Gifts, 80 Count. I ordered this pack on a whim, looking for something to spice up my morning routine. Little did I know, this pack would become my new obsession.

First off, the variety is unparalleled. With 40 unique coffees, there's something for everyone. From bold and strong to sweet and creamy, this pack has it all. And with two pods of each flavor, I could share with my friends and family (though I'll admit, I was tempted to keep them all for myself).

But let's talk about the taste. Oh. My. Goodness. I felt like a kid in a candy store, trying a new flavor every day. The Blueberry Cobbler had me singing "a-wop-bop-a-loo-bop-a-lop-bam-boom" like Little Richard. The French Vanilla made me want to break out my beret and start speaking with a terrible French accent. And the Caramel Macchiato? Let's just say, I'm pretty sure I saw the face of God.

But the best part? The packaging. The pods come in a beautifully designed box that looks like it belongs on the shelves of a boutique coffee shop. It made me feel fancy just looking at it. And when I opened it up, I was like a kid on Christmas morning, tearing through the packaging to get to the goodies inside.

Overall, I would give this Coffee Pods Variety Pack Sampler a 5 out of 5 stars. It's the perfect gift for any coffee lover, or just a treat for yourself. Plus, it's a great way to discover new flavors without committing to a full bag of coffee. So go ahead, treat yourself. You won't regret it. And who knows, maybe you'll find your new favorite brew (just be prepared to sing its praises like I am).

Here are some dos and don’ts:

Dos:
1. Do choose a variety pack that includes different coffee flavors and roasts so that you can try different types of coffee.
2. Do read the product description carefully to ensure that the coffee pods are compatible with your coffee maker.
3. Do consider the number of coffee pods in the pack and the price per pod to ensure that you are getting good value for money.
4. Do read reviews from other customers to get an idea of the quality of the coffee and the variety pack.
5. Do store the coffee pods in a cool, dry place to ensure that they stay fresh and flavorful.
Don'ts:
1. Don't choose a variety pack without checking the compatibility with your coffee maker, as this may result in wastage.
2. Don't overlook the price per pod, as some variety packs may seem like a good deal, but end up being more expensive per pod than buying individual packs.
3. Don't buy a variety pack without researching the different types of coffee included in the pack, as you may end up with flavors that you don't enjoy.
4. Don't store the coffee pods in a humid environment, as this can cause them to lose their flavor and become stale.
5. Don't assume that a variety pack will include your favorite coffee flavor or roast, as it is important to read the product description carefully to ensure that it meets your preferences.

title: great tasting coffee, but MUST make sure that the machine pierces the bottom of the cup
review_description:
This coffee tastes amazing, and brews well.

The one problem, which many other people have mentioned, is that the needle on your machine that needs to pierce the k cup, is not always able to pierce the bottom of these cups. It does cause the coffee to explode all over the place and makes a mess.

There is an easy fix though. My machine has a removable case that the k cup sits in. With other k cups when you put the pod into the case in the machine, the needle will pierce the cup. I don't trust that it will with these cups, so instead I push the cup hard into the case that has the needle, and make sure that it pierces the hole in the bottom before I put it into the machine. Most of the time this works, and you will be able to tell because you can hear the sound when it pierces the cup. If that does not work I cut a hole in the bottom of the cup with a knife. Not a perfect fix but thought I would put it out there that you can make these cups work in the machine.

That said, Crazy Cups really needs to look at their manufacturing process and make the plastic a little thinner.

Also, I tried their method for making the iced coffee and it still tasted watery. I brew my coffee the night before, put it in a travel mug, and let it cool in the refrigerator. I also make some coffee ice cubes out of the same batch of coffee, and put those in the coffee the next day. Works great!
cleaned_reviews: this coffee tastes amazing, and brews well. the one problem, which many other people have mentioned, is that the needle on your machine that needs to pierce the k cup, is not always able to pierce the bottom of these cups. it does cause the coffee to explode all over the place and makes a mess. there is an easy fix though. my machine has a removable case that the k cup sits in. with other k cups when you put the pod into the case in the machine, the needle will pierce the cup. i don't trust that it will with these cups, so instead i push the cup hard into the case that has the needle, and make sure that it pierces the hole in the bottom before i put it into the machine. most of the time this works, and you will be able to tell because you can hear the sound when it pierces the cup. if that does not work i cut a hole in the bottom of the cup with a knife. not a perfect fix but thought i would put it out there that you can make these cups work in the machine. that said, crazy cups really needs to look at their manufacturing process and make the plastic a little thinner. also, i tried their method for making the iced coffee and it still tasted watery. i brew my coffee the night before, put it in a travel mug, and let it cool in the refrigerator. i also make some coffee ice cubes out of the same batch of coffee, and put those in the coffee the next day. works great!

title: Love the variety
review_description: I love the variety of flavors. I tend to like the cappuccino ones.what I didn't like was that some of the kups had to be placed 2x in my machine to puncture the bottom hole and release the coffee. It kept bending it instead and accumulating the water not dripping it as coffee into the cup. Also, few didn't have much flavor. But I guess it was a chance I took buying a variety pack. All in all, I liked most and would probably buy it again.

title: Flavors I Never Knew I Wanted in Coffee
review_description: I can't handle the caffeine anymore, but I LOVE the smell & taste of coffee. So, I looked for decaf & found Crazy Cups with such a good value for so many kcups and various flavors to try. They smell amazing. My husband and I enjoy playing "guess that flavor" when I brew a cup. He smells it and likes to guess what flavor it is. So far, the only 2 I've not enjoyed, personally, are the peanutbutter chocolate and (surprisingly) the French vanilla. The peanutbutter smells and tastes like dirt/soil (oddly, my husband and I both thought so without even mentioning it to one another), and the vanilla left an odd aftertaste on my tongue that wouldn't go away. The rest are delightful though and I will be buying them again in the future. My favorites are Death by Chocolate, Coconut Chocolate, and Iced Oatmeal Cookie. Even the Lavener Honey flavor was delicious. That was a big surprise - it being coffee. Oh, & the Bananas Foster!!! OMG! Smells and tastes so good! I never knew I'd even want those flavors in a cup of coffee! But now, I'm hooked.

title: GREAT Flavored Decaf Coffee
review_description: I usually have one cup of regular coffee first thing in the morning but have to switch to decaf after that, otherwise I get the caffeine jitters. Many of the regular decaf blends are ho hum and watery tasting so I was hoping to find something flavored that sparked my taste buds. I tried this 50 count assortment on a whim (I almost didn't buy it). I am SO glad I did. There are a couple of flavors (white chocolate strawberry and bananas foster) that aren't my favorite but there are so many other great ones that I don't mind few "bad" ones in the bunch. I have enjoyed trying the different flavors and love the variety. If you are looking for a tasty decaf option, give these a try!

You can definitely taste the peppermint, glazed donut, peanut butter, coconut, raspberry, and, of course, chocolate flavors.

Lastly, for the most flavor per cup, I find it best not to exceed the 8 oz cup size.

title: Surprise flavors.
review_description:
First the good.. the price for the 24 pack is great, especially if you get it on a lightening deal like I did. The part that wasn't so great was you have no idea what flavors you might be getting. From the review, it look like there were a few different collections. They should state exactly what is in the box. I received 4 each of 6 flavors .. Here's a list and my review of each one :
Death By Chocolate : Really deep chocolate flavor and really good.
Chocolate Coconut Dream: Good chocolate flavor with coconut if you like coconut .. found it ok
Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: Gave this one away as I don't like Raspberries. Did try a sip and the person I gave it to loved it.
Chocolate Chipolte Mole: Threw this one away as I hate anything spicy. Can't even imagine this one.
Peppermint Chocolate Mocha: Again a nice brew if you like Peppermint.
Italian Chocolate Cheesecake: Tastes like the name, really good too
All in all, I would order the Death by Chocolate and the Cheescake again as single flavors. I just wish they would tell you upfront what you are getting. These fits all standard K cup coffee makers.The flavors are not bitter at all like some of the other flavored kinds. They are smooth. It was well worth a try and my friends like the flavors I didn't.

title: Good value, good flavor, frustrating with Keurig 2.0
review_description:
Good value for the money. I thought they tasted as good as any mocha coffees I have purchased in the past, However, they do NOT work well with my Keurig 2.0. They seem to clog it up and it processes VERY slow. They are not the only pods that I have had this issue with. I believe it is because of a flaw in the Keurig design, but none-the-less, that is the model I have. If the grounds/flavorings are ground too fine, then they float inside the pierced pod and then clog the spouts.
I will probably not buy them again, not because of the flavor of the coffees, but because they do not run well in my machine.
cleaned_reviews: good value for the money. i thought they tasted as good as any mocha coffees i have purchased in the past, however, they do not work well with my keurig 2.0. they seem to clog it up and it processes very slow. they are not the only pods that i have had this issue with. i believe it is because of a flaw in the keurig design, but none-the-less, that is the model i have. if the grounds/flavorings are ground too fine, then they float inside the pierced pod and then clog the spouts. i will probably not buy them again, not because of the flavor of the coffees, but because they do not run well in my machine.

title: You'd Better REALLY LOVE Blueberry If You Drink This
review_description:
The wife liked the Blueberry flavor of another brand so we tried this mixed selection and discovered very quickly that the flavor was so overpowering as to make the drink worth dumping. Given the price tag this seemed a waste, so today I mixed one of the flavors (Cinnamon Blueberry) with another ground bean (Hazelnut) at about 50/50. The result suited our taste much better in that there was just a hint of blueberry instead of being overpowered by it.

I brewed two individual cups and mixed them together then poured them back into each of our cups. Since I drink mine black the blueberry was readily identifiable, the wife uses an almond creamer (Lactose Intolerant) and was barely able to detect the blueberry, so next time I'll give her an extra 20% ratio. This means we won't waste the batch, an it will last over a much longer period of time.

title: Flavors received not as pictured
review_description:
Update: 10/17/21: I did not look closely at the listing for this item. It is not sold by Crazy Cups, but a second-party seller, Perfect Cup. I will, henceforth, purchase my flavored coffee directly from the Crazy Cups website.

As someone who cannot drink caffeine, I appreciate the vast flavor menu Crazy Cups offer. I was truly excited to purchase this pack, which is larger than the one I normally buy. My main reason for this larger purchase was to sample the Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup and Peppermint Mocha flavors that are only available in this pack (based on the picture in the listing). Spoiler alert: those two flavors, as well as, White Chocolate Strawberry and Butter Pecan Swirl are not included. This feels a little like bait and switch as those flavors enticed me to spend more than I normally would, but I did not receive what was pictured. Please make this right Crazy Cups! I want to continue enjoying your decaf coffee. However, this has left a bad taste in mouth.

However, many of the seals were broken so the coffee was stale and I was not going to drink it. In addition, they were far too many chocolate coffee’s for my taste. If you like chocolate and you don’t mind the broken seals, there was a lot of coffee for the money.

title: Interesting Flavors
review_description:
I had no issues with blow outs when brewing any of the Crazy Cups Chocolate Lovers Coffee Pods Variety Pack. They smell absolutely delicious, but the taste to me leaves me dissatisfied. The initial hit on the tongue is pretty good, but then I get a weird after taste that is less than desirable. I've tried all the flavors and I have the same weird aftertaste. I've never had the Crazy Cup brand before, so I don't know if it's their coffee or the flavorings they add.

3 star compromise because my son thinks they are delicious and deserve 5, even though I totally disagree and think they deserve 1.

title: Needs More Chocolate Flavor!
review_description: These are okay, they contain lot of different chocolate variety flavors. This works fine in my first generation Keurig causing no problem while brewing. They seem really exciting and fun with great flavor combos and smell so good. They are a really light coffee which I enjoy. They do the job in waking me up as my usual morning routine, however, they smell so much better than they really taste, it is kind of a tease. You would think that they claim this as an assorted chocolate lovers coffee, it should be really chocolaty, borderline rich and sweet flavored, yet it leaves something to be desired. Don't get me wrong, these are good, but certainty do not live up to my expectations I had of them. The peppermint is the only one that has a distinct different flavor, yet that is the minty part and not really a strong chocolate back flavor. I really wanted the death by chocolate and the raspberry truffle to be extra good, but they are no better or distinctive from the other flavors. This variety pack is along the same plain as others I have tried. Again, while still good and effective as a regular coffee, I was expecting a lot more considering the description given of these and the smell of the coffee. Probably won't buy this pack again, but if they show up as the only option to drink somewhere, I won't say no.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I'm not sure if I'm exactly satisfied with my order yet
review_description: I'm not sure if I'm exactly satisfied with my order yet. Out of the 40 cups, there were several duplicates and an abundance of pumpkin spice coffee/hazelnut/vanilla (20 cups worth, 12 being pumpkin spice). I only received 2 from the Entenmann's brand, both vanilla. Not much of the variety I had hoped for, and not at all what was pictured in the listing's photo. The first two cups I tried, none of the coffee was brewed. Plain water filled my cup and it caused leaking everywhere (my machine is fairly new and in top notch working order). The k-cup tops were also swelled... old maybe? The third cup I tried, I actually got coffee in my mug. But it was filled with grounds as well. For the price of $.50 per cup, I'd hope for better variety and quality. Maybe my order was just an old batch of unwanted/unpopular flavors tossed in a box? If the quality continues with every cup I try, I'm going to have to request a refund or some sort of return compensation for the waste I received.

title: Great smell but lacking flavor

Not sure if I expected too much from a K-cup or what but I just feel like they are a bit lacking. I have not tried every single flavor in the variety pack yet but I have probably tried at least 1/3 of them, I'm hoping I still have a chance to come across one or two flavors that really blow me away.

title: Hope the manufacturer can fix the seals
review_description: Love the coffee, but not the cleanup. I have purchased this offering multiple times for about a year. The last two orders have had defective seals at the rim of the plastic cup. When the seal fails and opens coffee grounds spew everywhere, including into the cup of coffee leaving grounds in the bottom of the cup. After the coffeemaker cycle is done, I have to disassemble the brewer head and clean the grounds from the parts and wipe up the adjacent area. I may have to find another supplier, which is sad because I enjoy the variety of flavors and the quality of the coffee.

title: Not strictly 2.0 compatible, but still good
review_description: The flavors are fun and interesting and I love that these come in decaf, but they're not strictly "compatible" with 2.0 machines. True, most of the flavors do pop in and run through a brew cycle, but it's an unusually slow and pained cycle and some flavors don't work at all. All of the bananas foster were defective and stopped halfway through after dumping grounds into the coffee. If you have a hacked 2.0, don't expect better luck--I tried these both with and without the machine unlocked. All that said, where else are you going to get this many flavors of decaf, and especially at this price?

title: creative, but lacks balance
review_description: After trying this Chocolate Lovers mix as well as the PB&J flavor I can say this is just not my favorite brand. I don't mind exotic flavor choices but the balance between the selected roasts and the flavor combinations is just not there. In particular, the Italian Chocolate Cheesecake flavor is overpowered by an espresso-like roast (I get that "Italian" roasts are strong, but still...) that overwhelms what could be a really good combination. Similarly, Chocolate Coconut Dream is rendered off-putting by a bitter mix of strong coffee and coconut. Death by Chocolate and the Peppermint Mocha are probably the better flavors of this bunch, but for me it's not worth enduring the others to get to them.
cleaned_reviews: after trying this chocolate lovers mix as well as the pb&j flavor i can say this is just not my favorite brand. i don't mind exotic flavor choices but the balance between the selected roasts and the flavor combinations is just not there. in particular, the italian chocolate cheesecake flavor is overpowered by an espresso-like roast (i get that "italian" roasts are strong, but still...) that overwhelms what could be a really good combination. similarly, chocolate coconut dream is rendered off-putting by a bitter mix of strong coffee and coconut. death by chocolate and the peppermint mocha are probably the better flavors of this bunch, but for me it's not worth enduring the others to get to them.

title: 4 to 2 stars
review_description:
Prior review is below.

I am lowering this to two stars because the second time I ordered this I had an inordinate amount of pods I don't like very much including a duplicate of hot chocolate. The order I had prior were many nice flavored coffees and cappuccinos and top notch tea with some interesting hot chocolate. It did have one of those typical mass produced store brands. This one was very disappointing and I'm cancelling my subscription.

--------------------------
I was very happy with this box I received from subscribe & save, I saw I had it for every 3 months and thought, "No! Every month at least! This is great!"
Then I saw the price on the next delivery and went with. "3 months it is!"

Overall it's a very strong blend with one I term as NO (Folgers, we all know what Folgers is. Don't put it into a variety pack).

I loved a lot of the flavored coffees which were much like dessert, but what occurred to me while I was drinking a deluge happened to be...How many calories have I consumed of this wonderful sugary artificial goodness?

I decided some things are best left not knowing.

The blend is primarily coffee, but there is also some tea and hot chocolate blended in.

I'm familiar with many of the blends but this is my first time having "Crazy Cups" and I absolutely love the taste of these without adding any milk or something else. But, my guess is they have a high calorie count.

title: CRAZY CUPS PAY ATTENTION: Be careful if you value your coffee maker but flavor is spot on ; (
review_description:
Okay lets start with the pros for encouragement....the flavors of each of these chocolate lovers coffees are spot on (peanut butter and the coconut one are my favorites) all with out any bitter bite and are very smooth.

now the cons: They are not compatible with all Keurig coffee makers, for I have read some people have no problems, but many others have repeated blow outs...I tried one in the pod it came in and it shut down my machine so having read other peoples problem I removed the top and filled my reusable pod with the coffee and it did the samething so I removed some of the coffee and it worked just fine, but still blew out my paper filter I use for easier clean up, Next time I used even less of the coffee in my reusable set up and it worked even better. Now when I removed the top from the first pod I found it had blown out the filter in the pod and that is the reason most people get grounds in their coffee even when it works with their coffee maker. I had to remove all the coffee and put it in individual baggies and use my reusable pods. Part of buying the pods is the convenience of use and these do not provide that, then there is the possible damage it can do to your coffee maker.

So if you do not mind the inconvenience of pouring out the coffee into baggies and then scooping the coffee out into reusable pods it is okay, but it has to be cheaper and a time saver to buy this coffee in bags (if only they came in bags) in place of the pods if you are going to do this. It is a pain to have to open these pods and pour them into individual baggies. Right now I will not be a repeat customer for I just got my new Keurig and want to continue to enjoy it.

Crazy Cups are you reading any of your reviews? If not you need to and if so then you need to fix your problem for the rest of us who love your coffee but will not take a chance of ruining our coffee makers. Thank you for your consideration.

This is the time to say " put your glasses on before you order anything using your cell phone." I hopped out of my chair and immediately call Amazon and in the matter of a minute or so I was speaking to a live person. Even though I give the chocolate flavored coffee only one star I will give Amazon service 10 Stars. I wished they could show up as stars in this review.
Since I am getting older and have learned to put my glasses on when ordering comma I have purchased a lot from Amazon from vitamins, hair products, CDs, millions of cookbooks and diet books - - notice that the cookbooks and diet books go together - - dishes and glasses, just name it and I have purchased it from Amazon and everything has arrived perfect. The only mistakes that have happened are due to me and Amazon did not blame me but took care of me. End of my review chocolate flavored coffee :-)

title: What a Gyp!
review_description:
This turned out to be a big disappointment. I felt so lucky! I was not only getting coffee pods for my Keurig but also cocoa and tea. I was going to get tea pods--my drink of choice! But also pods for my coffee-drinking friends and cocoa mostly for my younger friends. I have dug around in the box and have yet to find a tea pod and thus far only 1 cocoa pod. From the maker's names on the pods thus far I am guessing these are coffees that haven't sold so well.

title: Same problems as Others, Pods don't fit Keurig correctly, Odd Pods
review_description:
As others have reported, a few of the K-pods are full of air (probably indicating they are old). Others don't fit the Keurig correctly and so they fill with water that doesn't release through the bottom and grounds come out the top into your coffee maker. This makes it so you have to clean the coffee maker.

It's such a shame because it's great to be able to try various flavors and have a variety rather than the same coffee each morning. I only wish I could find this type of variety but where I'm getting appropriate value for the money. And of course you would NEVER want to gift someone these troubled pods.

title: Received Pack with Expired "Best Used By" Date
review_description:
I ordered the box of assorted coffees, cocoas and teas on April 20, 2022 and received the package April 22, 2022. The "Best Used By" date was April 11, 2022. Each cup was not marked with a date, but as shown by the photo, the whole package had the date of 4/11/22.

While I like the assortment, I am very disappointed to find that the "best used by" date had already passed. I had planned to use these as part of a gift basket but cannot, in good conscience, include them.

title: Didn't include advertised brands - K-cups expired too soon
review_description:
I was disappointed with this purchase for 3 reasons.
First, most of the major name-brand coffees that were advertised in the picture were NOT included in my batch of k-cups. No Cinnabon, Caribou, Tim Hortons, 8 O'Clock, Donut Shop, Donut House, or Torani k-cups were included. I was deeply disappointed because sampling those brands was the main reason I purchased this sampler pack.
Secondly, I was disappointed because there was a sticker on the outside of the box stating that the expiration date for the k-cups was 9/20/16, which is just over 3 weeks from the date I received the sampler pack! That is ridiculous. The majority of the k-cups are exotic flavors that I'm not going to drink every single day. They should not have sent almost-expired k-cups.
Third, the selection was poor, in my opinion. There were 3 teas, 3 cappuccinos, 1 cider, 6 hot chocolates, and 17 coffees. I expected a lot more tea, at least, and was disappointed there were only 3. Additionally, at least half of the flavors were holiday flavors, which I was disappointed with as well.
I do not recommend this sampler pack.

title: Very Very Dissapointed :(
review_description:
I was not very happy with this purchase as there is a very uneven distribution of flavors. I ordered this assortment wanting to try some new flavors of chocolate coffee. I am a huge fan of chocolate flavored coffee and I really do like the Choco Coconut flavor which I have ordered on its own a few times. I decided to order the assortment even though I knew that I more than likely would not care for all the flavors. I had a pretty good idea that I would probably dislike the Chocolate Chipolte Mole, but I figured the most I would get of any one flavor would be 4 at most. I took that chance and here is what I got:
8 Chipolte Mole; 0 Peppermint Mocha; 3 Coconut Dream; 4 Italian Cheesecake; 5 Death by Cocolate; 4 Raspberry Truffle
Needless to say very disappointing since the Chipolte Mole is my least favorite, I find it horrible actually. I was very excited to try the Peppermint and I did not receive a singe one of these. The distribution of flavors is the worst and certainly needs to be improved on.

title: Great variety of flavors but pods explode!
review_description: Updated 11/19/19- Well, after the 3rd pod exploding and shooting coffee grounds all over the place, I'm afraid I won't be reordering these. As much as I LOVE the coffee, I can't risk ruining my keurig machine, not to mention the mess and the waste. Sucks! ORIGINAL REVIEW: I really love the variety of flavors. It's so hard to find decaf in flavors other than French vanilla and hazelnut. I was a little skeptical about apple pie a la mode and bananas foster, but with a little Italian sweet creme creamer they were great and would go great with a muffin or other pastry. It's fun experimenting with "pairing" them with different creamers, like a fine wine! I have had a couple of them leave grounds in my keurig and my coffee, and just handling the pods, grounds seem to leak out onto the counter, so they really need to work on quality control. I'm a little concerned that it could ruin my keurig, which will not make me happy. Otherwise, I am very happy with them.

title: These K-Cups spill coffee into my Cuisinart Keurig system!
review_description:
My household is coffee drinkers. The Mrs and I drink a pot of coffee every a.m., so we know coffee. The whole point for a K-Cup system is for that one-off cup, or when you don’t feel like drinking a pot! We’re a LavAzza household, ever day… so it’s important to us.

The boys love the hot chocolate… and I was notified that Amazon was out of the Solimo… so they suggested Crazy Cups... Here’s how I arrived in this brand… that we don’t know.. It was a suggestion from Amazon (first mistake).

I purchased the sampler pack, which had five different flavors. Price seemed decent, sure, why not, seems to have an overabundance of positive reviews (I needed to have dug deeper before I pulled this trigger!), so I bought a pack.

Box arrived, excellent packaging... no assembly of rhyme or reason in the box to how the flavors were just thrown in (first lousy omen), and I noticed what felt and seemed like they overstuffed each K-Cup (second horrible omen). So we separated the piles of flavors, and I took one for a test spin.

On the seal, “Freshly Roasted Coffee” – I’ve always found, when they say “good, eat, tasty, etc.” in the title, usually it’s the opposite and chaos ensues, sadly this was not any different. What poured out, smelled terrific, a little too good to be true! At first sip, black coffee, nothing in it, just to taste the base. To my shock and dismay, I was underwhelmed... UNDERWHELEMD PEOPLE!

I’ve had better coffee at Denny’s on a road trip when you need that cuppa, just to keep your eyes peeled on the road.. they have a far better-tasting coffee then this! Secondly, the flavor... “Death by chocolate,” I think not! Frankly, for all the Betty Ford recovering chocaholics, this is insulting to call this chocolate… little foil coins have far better-tasting chocolate then this!

Tried the 2nd K-Cup and BOOM coffee grounds everywhere. Remember the overstuffing comment earlier… well, this is my theory, or it’s just NOT compatible with the system we own... gee that would have been nice to know to go in! Crazy Cups has this weird indentation on the bottom like the K-Cup sat on a basketball.. left an odd dimple… what’s the point?

The other K-Cups that we enjoy, such as Cafe Bustelo, Swiss Miss, LavAzza, and even Amazon’s own Solimo, works fine. Crazy Cups, your K-Cups make the grounds go everywhere except where they belong! Now I am stuck with K-Cups that will probably break then give coffee. This isn’t the first one to do this! I’ll never repurchase your brand!
If you drink coffee, like we drink coffee, this is not your coffee! Crazy Cups K-Cup coffee is a sad joke pretending to be coffee! The base flavor is insulting to any coffee drinker.. and it smells far better then it tastes!
cleaned_reviews: my household is coffee drinkers. the mrs and i drink a pot of coffee every a.m., so we know coffee. the whole point for a k-cup system is for that one-off cup, or when you don’t feel like drinking a pot! we’re a lavazza household, ever day… so it’s important to us. the boys love the hot chocolate… and i was notified that amazon was out of the solimo… so they suggested crazy cups... here’s how i arrived in this brand… that we don’t know.. it was a suggestion from amazon (first mistake). i purchased the sampler pack, which had five different flavors. price seemed decent, sure, why not, seems to have an overabundance of positive reviews (i needed to have dug deeper before i pulled this trigger!), so i bought a pack. box arrived, excellent packaging... no assembly of rhyme or reason in the box to how the flavors were just thrown in (first lousy omen), and i noticed what felt and seemed like they overstuffed each k-cup (second horrible omen). so we separated the piles of flavors, and i took one for a test spin. on the seal, “freshly roasted coffee” – i’ve always found, when they say “good, eat, tasty, etc.” in the title, usually it’s the opposite and chaos ensues, sadly this was not any different. what poured out, smelled terrific, a little too good to be true! at first sip, black coffee, nothing in it, just to taste the base. to my shock and dismay, i was underwhelmed... underwhelemd people! i’ve had better coffee at denny’s on a road trip when you need that cuppa, just to keep your eyes peeled on the road.. they have a far better-tasting coffee then this! secondly, the flavor... “death by chocolate,” i think not! frankly, for all the betty ford recovering chocaholics, this is insulting to call this chocolate… little foil coins have far better-tasting chocolate then this! tried the 2nd k-cup and boom coffee grounds everywhere. remember the overstuffing comment earlier… well, this is my theory, or it’s just not compatible with the system we own... gee that would have been nice to know to go in! crazy cups has this weird indentation on the bottom like the k-cup sat on a basketball.. left an odd dimple… what’s the point? the other k-cups that we enjoy, such as cafe bustelo, swiss miss, lavazza, and even amazon’s own solimo, works fine. crazy cups, your k-cups make the grounds go everywhere except where they belong! now i am stuck with k-cups that will probably break then give coffee. this isn’t the first one to do this! i’ll never repurchase your brand! if you drink coffee, like we drink coffee, this is not your coffee! crazy cups k-cup coffee is a sad joke pretending to be coffee! the base flavor is insulting to any coffee drinker.. and it smells far better then it tastes!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: A Dream Unfulfilled
review_description: Have you ever kicked back after an excellent meal and thought to yourself, 'wow, that was good... I wish I could somehow drink all of those flavors that I just enjoyed via boring old eating'? Well if that's you, then you need to pay attention. Because this product is a cruel mockery of that beautiful dream. Each pod is delightfully labeled with such descriptive titles as "Chocolate Raspberry Truffle," "Chipotle Mole" (I'm not freaking kidding you), or--my personal favorite-- "Party Cake!" However, underneath these elegant descriptors, every pod shares a common label visible only to your taste buds: "Hot Filthy Garbage." The Entenmann's Peppermint smacked of the same smell that I encounter each time I go to the local tire factory to get a new set put on the family vehicle. The "Death By Chocolate" flavor was almost appropriately labeled; it merely needs to drop the last two words and go simply by "Death." "Apple Pie Ala Mode" is an insult to an American classic. Drinking it was like shoving bamboo shoots under George Washington's fingernails. In short, I probably wouldn't buy this grab bag of insanity a second time. You're welcome.

"apple pie ala mode" is an insult to an american classic. drinking it was like shoving bamboo shoots under george washington's fingernails. in short, i probably wouldn't buy this grab bag of insanity a second time. you're welcome.

title: Buyer Beware: These K-Cups did not work in our Keurig 2.0 K475
review_description: We were really looking forward to this variety pack. Beware: Even though they say it works in all Keurig machines including the 2.0: THEY DO NOT. In fact, as you can see from the picture I uploaded, the part that punctures the bottom of the K-cup was broken by the cups from this variety pack. None of them worked in our Keurig 2.0 model K-475. Not only did we pay $30 for this variety pack, but it cost another $48 to replace the K-cup holder assembly because of the damage caused by these K-Cups. To add insult to injury, we put our best foot forward and tried again using another of these cups with the new assembly and the same thing: the bottom of the cup was not punctured. So, it's not the machine. Very disappointed and we will never buy this variety pack again.

title: Little variety and stale
review_description:
The flavors are very hit or miss with this collection. The coconut and
raspberry is great- the
death by chocolate/pb/peppermint/glazed donut flavors are sadly gross, and have a stale-like quality to them once brewed.
There needs to be a better "sampler" minded concept for the different flavors because you get stuck with several pods that you do not like.
The variety also left something to be desired- you get 8 or 9 pods of the gross flavors and only 2 or 3 of the decent flavors.

This is not the best and I would not buy again.

title: Does not work in my Keurig 2.0 machine

title: Excellent if/when they work right!
review_description:
These are awesome when they get to me in good condition! 2 or 3 times now, I have gotten them with the bag ripped open, coffee ☕grounds everywhere, bloated up keurig cups I am guessing from sitting in the sun when shipped. And when they look like they are swelled up, be careful. They WILL explode in your keurig.

That said, when they come in good condition, and work right in my keurig, these are probably the best tasting flavored coffee I have ever had. And, I am kind of a coffee snob, so there is that. The average is AMAZING! And no, these contain NO sugar, they are not sweet. I have seen a lot of people asking this. Flavored coffee doesn't USUALLY mean sweet, for people that drink flavored coffee like Hazelnut, etc. know that flavored just means the raw flavor.

Update 8/10/20
Ok... I decided to order these again since they were so good! However, THIS TIME they were DISGUSTING!! They tasted like someone poured some actual chemicals into some coffee grounds, packed them in a k-cup and shipped them. They were absolutely vile! Made me sick! I threw them in the garbage. Absolutely disgusting! Very disappointed. I will NOT order these ever again!

title: Delicious Coffee!
review_description:
I just received my 40 ct package today and I made the Banana Fosters Flambe. Some reviews stated that they couldn't taste any of the flavors. To that, I say they must have tongues of leather. I could clearly taste the banana flavor in mine and it was delicious! It's not overbearing; it's just right and it leaves a nice banana after taste in my mouth. Also, some have reported that their k-cups have "exploded" in their Keurigs; basically the k-cup broke open and spilled grounds everywhere. Because I read that in several reviews, I carefully lowered my lever down to enclose the k-cup. I'm not sure that was even necessary because all of mine look very well sealed across the top, but needless to say, I didn't have the explosion problem.
Some folks have also complained that all of the flavors weren't evenly distributed in the variety pack. Mine was pretty close. I got 4 of everything except for two flavors which I got 3 of and 5 of two other flavors. Keep in mind, though, that all of these flavors are available on Amazon individually, so if you find that you really love a particular flavor, just buy those; you don't have to buy the sampler pack.
I'm not able to drink any caffeine because my heart has a sensitivity to it. Therefore, I'm stuck with buying decaf. In the grocery stores, if I'm lucky, I have 3 options - french vanilla, hazelnut, or plain. Boring! I'm thrilled that I have so many new flavors to enjoy now! 5 stars all the way!

title: Yummy flavors, clogs every now and then
review_description:
A great variety of yummy flavors. Each day I randomly grab a pod and pop it in. While I like some better than others, there are NONE that are bad. Most of the flavors are distinct enough to taste but do not overpower the fact that its still coffee. Just the right blend.

I will say that about 1 in 10 pods must be packed to tight with grounds or something because water flows out over the top. When I see it happen I just hold the lid of the brewer down a little and it works. I have taken to shaking the pods to make sure the grounds are loose inside and I think that reduces the occurrences.

title: A MUST Buy!
review_description: I was tired of purchasing my K-Cups at most retailers as the cost was very expensive and buying direct through the manufacturers website seemed like a con to keep having you come back more and more. Also, it is very difficult to find decaffeinated flavored coffee let alone regular decaffeinated K-Cups. I found these on Amazon and figured I would give them a try. For the price and quantity, I figured if I didn't like them I could take them to work and give them away. My order arrived on time and I was absolutely amazed when I opened the box. The box was filled with different flavors and some that I have never heard of before. I have already tried the regular coffee flavor and Apple Pie A'La Mode. So far these have exceeded my expectations in flavor and quality. If you are thinking about trying these, do it. Do not hesitate. There are only two flavors that I know I will not drink Chocolate Raspberry and Banana's Foster (not a fan of the flavors overall in regards to desserts). I will DEFINATELY be buying these again and the Crazy Cups Brand.

title: Delicious!
review_description: Crazy Cups Coffee Flavor K-cups comes 24 per pack. My package had an even amount of 4 for each of the 6 different flavors. These are Medium strength Roasts which isn't too weak, even though I usually go for stronger roasts. These, very creative flavors, are delicious. It's like I'm drinking a dessert, not coffee. I am one of those people that uses a little bit extra flavored CoffeeMate creamers in my coffee. However with these Crazy Cups, I hardly used much creamer at all, which is unusual for me. My favorite flavors are the Bananas Foster Flambe and the Frosted Oatmeal Cookie. I brew these yummy flavors in my Keurig 2.0 that I purchased in March. So I was a little apprehensive about buying these K-cups because of the reviews that stated they don't work with a 2.0. I decided to buy them anyways because I tried them at my sister's house and loved them. I was also prepared to use a workaround to make these work in my 2.0. But much to my surprise they ended up working just perfectly in my machine. I think that I've finished half the box so far. Everyday, I look forward to having my Crazy cups and do highly recommend them.

title: NOT DECAF - but, good customer service
review_description:
I am a coffee lover, but I can no longer drink regular caffeinated coffee. I switched to decaf due to anxiety and also being pregnant. I ordered this variety pack so I could enjoy a daily cup of decaf coffee at work.

The item I received did not indicate that the cups were in fact decaf anywhere on the packaging, either on the box or on the individual cups. Additionally, the image posted with this listing also doesn't show that these are labeled decaf. Since I can't have regular caf coffee, I emailed Amazon to find out if there was a way to verify these are decaf. They responded very quickly, indicating that they had checked and confirmed these were decaf, but they decided to refund my money all the same due to my concern. I very much appreciate this quality of customer service.

However, I decided to do a little more digging of my own and went to the Crazy Cups direct website. The decaf KCups posted there were very clearly labeled with "Decaf" on the cups. Which means that these KCups are not decaf as listed. I'm still excited to try this brand out and so will order the decaf ones from the Crazy Cups site - but wanted to let everyone know that, at least based on what I received and based on the images provided with the listing, that these cups aren't decaf as the title of the listing indicates they are.

title: Great Flavor, not great pods

I have tried multiple ones and they create too much pressure in the brewer and it cannot finish brewing the cup. So I tried to open each pod and put it into my reusable k-cups. They brewed better. But still the same issue from time to time. This occurs I’ve found when coffee is ground too finely.

If you don’t mind opening each cup and pouring them into a reusable k-cup I think it’s worth the price.

title: I don't usually write a review for a product like this so soon after getting it - but I ...
review_description:
I don't usually write a review for a product like this so soon after getting it - but I opened up this pack to make sure everything was in good order. It was. Then I brewed one of the pods, the Oatmeal Cream Pie, and it was phenomenal. I cut open the pod to brew it a little stronger and I drank it black. The flavor was mild and pleasant, not artificial tasting, and the aftertaste was the best part, it was exactly like an oatmeal cream pie.

Right after I finished that cup I brewed another. This time I made it in the Keurig machine on the middle size setting. Came out tasting great. I decided to switch up and add cream and sugar. The flavor was excellent, but I actually prefer it black and I know that's just down to personal preference. I'm looking forward to trying every flavor but I can almost say the entire purchase was worth it for the four pods of the flavor I've already tried.

title: Great coffee! Tid bit on how to avoid grounds.
review_description:
I know in some reviews I did read how kcups exploded, a lot of grounds were in the coffee, and it plugged the Kerug machine.
Well some of those things happened to me. And I want people to know an easy solution.
Set your Kerug on hot chocolate mode (for water) and since I have done that I do not have any more problems. The grounds in this coffee are more dense which gives you that wonderful flavor. But can plug the machine because the water runs to slow. So you need the water to run a little quicker through your coffee machine.
The flavor is tremendous and I was satisfied with my delivery!! Well worth the money!!

title: Banging flavor!
review_description:
Pow! That is what this coffee does to your tastebuds; it knocks them for a loop. But in a good, flavorful, burst of coffee goodness. I tried the Bananas Foster first, whoa, smack my mama, could not believe how good it was. Then the Salted Caramel because I love caramel but I knew it wouldn't be as good. Wrong, it was. I've had the Pumpkin Vanilla Creme and it was good but my pie has brandy. Need to convince them to add brandy. The Caramel Truffle Sundae had my child's eyes closing in delight.
The jury is out on the other flavors of frosted oatmeal cookie and cinnamon churro but I will venture to say they have to be pretty good with the quality of the other flavors. Enjoy your coffees all. I know I am.

title: No Issues with Keurig brewer.
review_description: I was a little hesitant to place this order after reading reviews stating that some of the cups didn’t perform correctly and leaked grounds everywhere. I also read that out of a box of 40 K cups that were supposed to be “Decaf” some were not. I have been pleasantly surprise that not only was every cup in the assortment decaf, but the 10 cups I have tried so far have performed flawlessly in my 2.0. The flavors are not as intense on the 10 – 12 oz. settings on my Keurig 2.0 but the 8 oz. cups have excellent flavor. I’m glad I bought them and will definitely order more.

There is 8 Frosted Oatmeal Cookie cups, 5 Bananas Foster Flambé cups, 1 Salted Caramel cup, 2 Caramel Truffle Sundae cups, 4 Pumpkin Vanilla Creme cups and 4 Cinnamon Churio cups. I hate to be a whiner but I would have preferred an even number of each. All in all they are good tasting and I will buy more crazy cups, just not this variety pack.

title: "Good to the Last Pod"
review_description: I really like the name "Crazy Cups" and the eye-catching packaging designs! They work well in my Cuisinart dual-coffee machine (that makes both "carafe coffee" as well as "individual pod servings.") It's not easy to find varieties of flavored DECAF pods, but your company sure goes "crazily creative" in that department! So far, I've tried the following decaf flavors from Crazy Cups: Frosted Oatmeal Cookie, Banana Foster Flambe, and Chocolate Coconut Dream. For my first order, each of those flavors was sent in a separate box. Unfortunately, they all tasted the same, just like plain, UNflavored coffee! So, this time, I ordered the Variety Sampler package, and I hope some of the flavors in THAT group taste as they should! I look forward to starting off my mornings with those yummy flavors; the names sound sooo delicious, but alas, I fear they won't live up to the promise. By the way, Crazy Cups can be ordered thru Bed, Bath & Beyond, but only online NOT in the store itself! They carry almost every brand on the premises EXCEPT Crazy Cups! See if you can get shelf space!

title: Best flavor but the Worst pods
review_description: I don't know what is going on with these pods but I can't use them in my Hamilton Beach Flex coffee maker, the seals bust open on the top and grounds end up everywhere! EVERYWHERE! I have to take everything apart to clean it all out. But because they are the BEST flavors ever I have been reduced to taking the inside out and putting in my reusable pods so I can enjoy the flavors of a decaf coffee I can't find anywhere else. I don't know if it would do the same thing in a kurig and if anyone else has this issue please let me know. Just wish they had the chocolate cherry flavor in decaf, that stuff makes my taste buds sing no creamer needed!

title: Where's the Flavor?
review_description:
I'm not sure if they are bad or if I've been spoiled by coffee flavors from HEB grocery store. I order from HEB online and they have delicious coffees. Their brand is Cafe Ole Coffee Cups and they have lots of flavor. These Crazy cups just had a "sweet" flavor to them, but I could not tell what the flavor was. They just arrived today and I've had two flavors and my friends have had the others and we're not impressed. Again, maybe we've been spoiled by HEB grocery store coffee.
I was very impressed with Crazy Cups because they offer so many flavors, but I couldn't make out which flavor I was drinking. I don't do carbs and haven't for almost 20 years, so I was hoping this would be my "dessert" and I'd buy the decaf in the future. I'm going to drink these just because we paid for them, but I'm not interested in ordering, again, from this company. Maybe your experience will be different and maybe you'll taste the actual flavor labeled on the K cup, but I couldn't make it out. I'll stick to Green Mountain and HEB Cafe Ole.

title: Good, but not great.
review_description:
I purchased the Flavored Coffee Lovers variety. The coffee is strong but the flavors leave something to be desired. Bananas Foster had no banana undertone. I picked up the cinnamon in Cinnamon Churro, some caramel in Salted Caramel. Overall, the flavors can best be described as synthetic. Bananas Foster had an aftertaste which was slightly similar to the taste of PTC paper. If you're a 'super taster', you will understand what I mean. If you are not, the flavors might be more pleasing.

Overall, the price is in line with some of the Green Mountain K-cups, and I found the brewed Crazy Cups coffee had a bolder taste than Green Mountain's Dark Magic. (I find GM DM to brew a little on the watery side.)

I took off a star for the flavors, would be interested in trying a non flavored Crazy Cup single serve cup.

Worth noting: Crazy Cups includes instructions on the box as to how to recycle their cups.

(i find gm dm to brew a little on the watery side.) i took off a star for the flavors, would be interested in trying a non flavored crazy cup single serve cup. worth noting: crazy cups includes instructions on the box as to how to recycle their cups.

title: Too many defective pods
review_description: I really like all of these flavored decaf coffees, but there are way too many defective pods in the box I received. I keep having the problem of the little filter inside the pod being defective and letting coffee grounds escape. The grounds clog the bottom needle on the Keurig and cause it to stop brewing because the pod is "under pressure." Once that happens, there is no saving that cup of coffee since it's full of grounds and I have to reset the Keurig (unplug) to get the error to clear. I drink both decaf and regular. My regular coffee is a different brand and never ever has this problem so, I'm confident it's not my machine.
cleaned_reviews: i really like all of these flavored decaf coffees, but there are way too many defective pods in the box i received. i keep having the problem of the little filter inside the pod being defective and letting coffee grounds escape. the grounds clog the bottom needle on the keurig and cause it to stop brewing because the pod is "under pressure." once that happens, there is no saving that cup of coffee since it's full of grounds and i have to reset the keurig (unplug) to get the error to clear. i drink both decaf and regular. my regular coffee is a different brand and never ever has this problem so, i'm confident it's not my machine.

title: Love the coffee, hate the pods
review_description:
We use this coffee in our office and I like the flavors so much that I purchased it for home. In our brand new Keurig, 1/3 of the pods fail. Most of the time the problem is that the bottom needle doesn't puncture the pod, the pod just dents or stretches. Other times there is overflow out of the top of the brewer.

It may be that our brewer is the cause, but every other brand of coffee works just fine. Test the pods in your machine, if you have similar problems to ours pushing down on the pod lid of the brewer during brewing seems to salvage most of the troublesome pods.

title: Meh

title: Tasty, but cups malfunction often
review_description: The flavors are tasty, especially bananas foster, but too many of the pods malfunction in the Keurig machine. It seems that the plastic on bottom of cup is too thick and doesn’t always puncture. This makes it hard to justify the price when you end up having to throw pods away.
cleaned_reviews: the flavors are tasty, especially bananas foster, but too many of the pods malfunction in the keurig machine. it seems that the plastic on bottom of cup is too thick and doesn’t always puncture. this makes it hard to justify the price when you end up having to throw pods away.

title: Some will like them, some won't.
review_description: Let me start off by saying that I'm not a coffee drinker so take this review with a grain of salt. I really didn't like the taste of these. They tasted like dirt to me. I'm more of the carmel cappachino type to give you a point of reference. My wife didn't like any of them either but she loves the Dunkin Donuts French Vanilla flavored coffee. To be fair, I donated them to my local Sheriff's office and they LOVED them. I recommend you buy ONE box and see if you like them instead of buying multiple boxes like I did.

title: Flavors do not come as they appear.

title: Great coffee, poor design.
review_description: I am always looking for flavore decaf coffee and thought I found my prefered brand. These flavors are true to what they are supposed to taste like and have no chemical taste. However, the pods tend to overflow in the machine not only filling the cup with grounds, but also the mechanisms of the machine. It is a real mess and difficult to clean out. Though I love the coffee, this is becoming a real pain and I cannot recommend these and do not know if I would buy them again.

title: A Few Cups Weren't Compatible With 2.0
review_description: All the flavors were great, with the exception of the bananas foster flambe, which I personally thought was gross (banana flavored anything = abomination). I'm giving it three stars because, despite the claim that it was compatible with 2.0 brewers, two of my cups didn't work with my machine. I compared the non-compatible cups with ones that brewed just fine, and they looked exactly the same. Not sure what the issue was, but now I'm wary of reordering this particular sampler pack (I've also ordered the chocolate lovers, all of which worked fine on my 2.0 brewer).

title: Great flavor when the pods don't explode!

title: While the taste was good they did not work well in my Keurig coffee ...
review_description: While the taste was good they did not work well in my Keurig coffee maker. When using it in the k-cup it came in I always ended up with short cups of coffee. I started putting the coffee in the reusable k-cup filling with only half and it works fine. I think the coffee is just too finely ground and it doesn't drain quickly enough. I won't be buying the decaf again.

title: Newer Keurig Work-Around
review_description: Wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing. title: Very Bold, little non-coffee flavor

title: Half the pods don't work
review_description:
Let me begin on a positive note by stating that the Banana Foster is an exceptional flavor. I'd buy this pack again just for that flavor because its THAT good.
However, I'd read in some of the other reviews that some of the pods don't work with keurig and have to be just discarded.
I've had a similar problem and about 50% of our pods don't work. The keurig shuts down or if forced to start manually it leads to grainy coffee.
I alternate between pods of seven different brands including Green Mountain, Peets, Starbucks, and other sampler packs - so I know it's definitely not a machine problem, it's Crazy Cups. There's something about their packaging - a harder shell compared to others so coffee can't go through or similar.
It's a real shame because some of the flavors are really nice. But at a 50% success ratio, I don't recommend them.

title: After two boxes, we will not be buying more
review_description:
We use a very simple k-cup machine and between my wife and I we average at least 6 cups per day. Also, we use a variety of brands, but mostly the Amazon-brand, Green Mountain, and Newman's Own. Yet, occasionally we will try others and that is the reason for this review.
Over 50% of your k-cups explode through some part of the top seal. When our first box (#1) had this happen I thought it was a fluke - just a bad batch and wanted to give CRAZY another try because the coffee was sooo good.
Well, it was even worse with box #2.
Thought you should know.

If the flavor is phenomenal when I try them, I may change my review somewhat, but right now I am steaming mad!

title: Good coffee, but bad cup design
review_description: The coffee (what little I have been able to drink) tastes good. Unfortunately they have a problem with their cups and most of the coffee grounds have been ending up in my cup. I was originally thinking it was my coffee maker, but this particular coffee is the only cup I have ever had an issue with. Out of curiosity I took one cup apart and found that the coffee filter was ripped - not even close to where my coffee maker pierces the cup. Obviously a quality control issue if these filters are already ripped like that. I will not be ordering again due to the frustration of having to filter the coffee grounds out before I can drink each cup.

title: I love the flavors

I like to make a 10 oz cup and I only end up with about half of that when using this brand of coffee. When I lift the Keurig lid to remove the K cup, coffee pours out of the K cup. I've used many different brands of coffee, and this is the only one that I've experienced these issues. I'd love to get a refund for this product, but it's not worth the hassle of packaging up the remaining K cups and driving to the UPS store.

The flavors are great, but the mess and frustration isn't worth it.

title: These K cups frequently fail
review_description:
Coffee tastes good, but the pods have a very high failure rate.

The cups will leak in the coffee maker, with grounds and hot water spilling over the machine & into your cup. Be careful opening the coffee maker after use as hot water occasionally spurts out under pressure from the top of the K cup.

I've tries several different brands of K cups and these are by far the most problematic, with a failure rate exceeding 50%.

title: Defective K cups
review_description: I've purchased from this brand before (Death by Chocolate) for years - and decided to change things up and order a variety pack with different flavors. After 7 attempts - I've come to the conclusion that I unfortunately, have to throw these away, due to them being defective. Each time I place the K Cup in, the water won't brew into the cup and when I lift the lid, it pops and coffee grounds explode all over my kitchen. It's SOOOO annoying! This happens very rarely in the Death by Chocolate pack - but with this variety pack, it's happened EVERY time. Not only does it clog up my machine - it makes a massive mess of my kitchen and I am even grumpier without my coffee. I'm assuming that they are using a different grind that clogs up the machine and doesn't allow the water to go through, and then the pressure and heat cause an explosion. Pretty dangerous and messy. Additionally, they won't reimburse me and the item is not returnable. So now I'm out $25 and hate having to throw away all of this coffee. Terrible to not stand by your product. Don't waste your money and give yourself a major headache with cleaning!

title: Smells Great, Tastes Terrible
review_description:
I was so excited to purchase these K-cups for the office. The package arrived in a timely manner and the box is organized in an orderly fashion. I have purchased K-cups where they were thrown haphazardly in the box. Not so, in this case. A person brewed the first one in the office: Butterscotch—yum!

Let me tell you, Reader, that these coffees smell aMAZing! They smell exactly how they're labeled. Brew a chocolate caramel mocha, it smells just like a chocolate caramel mocha. Brew butterscotch, the sweet smell fills the office and makes everyone's mouths water.

But that's where it ends there. You take your first sip and the flavor is very underwhelming, almost plain.

And then it hits you.

A strong chemical aftertaste bombards your mouth. Reader, the closest equivalent would be to swish your mouth with Windex (please don't do this) in order to understand the intense taste that floods your mouth after. Or you can just attempt to drink one of these to understand what it would be like to sip some cleaner. I will not be purchasing again.
cleaned_reviews: i was so excited to purchase these k-cups for the office. the package arrived in a timely manner and the box is organized in an orderly fashion. i have purchased k-cups where they were thrown haphazardly in the box. not so, in this case. a person brewed the first one in the office: butterscotch—yum! let me tell you, reader, that these coffees smell amazing! they smell exactly how they're labeled. brew a chocolate caramel mocha, it smells just like a chocolate caramel mocha. brew butterscotch, the sweet smell fills the office and makes everyone's mouths water. but that's where it ends there. you take your first sip and the flavor is very underwhelming, almost plain. and then it hits you. a strong chemical aftertaste bombards your mouth. reader, the closest equivalent would be to swish your mouth with windex (please don't do this) in order to understand the intense taste that floods your mouth after. or you can just attempt to drink one of these to understand what it would be like to sip some cleaner. i will not be purchasing again.

title: Cup design issue for Keurig machine
review_description:
I’m super sad to have to give this a low rating overall. The flavors sounded amazing and the price was great. But not a single cup in my box worked in my Keurig machine. I had no problems with Victor Allen brand I purchased at the same time. I’ve never had a problem with any Kcup until this purchase. The odd thing is, I’ve purchased mixed brand boxes before that included some Crazy Cups Kcups in it and I don’t recall having any issue.
These cups simply didn’t “take” - it was as though the machine didn’t know there was a cup in it and would stop running. If you hold down the machine cover, it would keep the machine running but coffee would spew all over, grounds in my cup, in the machine and all over my counter. Please look at doing something with the cup design as your right on the mark with your fun flavors. I just wish I could have tasted them!!

review_description: Not one of the Kcups is a chocolate flavor! title: OVER 50% explode or leak!

If you like wasting money, then this is the brand for you!

title: One Star Reviews are Valid
review_description: I was so excited to try these that I dismissed the one star reviews. I love flavored coffee and these sounded great. As other reviewers have mentioned, these cups smell great, but taste just like regular, unflavored coffee. However, I could deal with the lack of flavor and just use up the coffee and never order these again, but the cups themselves are awful! They are too thick and my Keurig machine can't properly puncture them, causing a huge mess because I have to try to open and shut the machine to get a proper hole as the machine is dispensing water. I thought the first time it was a fluke, tried it again and experienced the same thing. I have never had this problem with any other cups. Just an outright, horrible product.

title: Company refuses to address cheap plastic pods causing grounds in machine and coffee.
review_description: The company uses a cheaper plastic for the pods... this causes the pods to expand when heated and under pressure. This rather causes the pod to crack or, more often, a cup with way too many grounds. It also causes you to have to constantly clean your Kuerig needles as they get clogged with the grounds. The company will not address this issue and apparently doesn’t care. It’s a shame as the coffee is quite good, but not worth a mouth full of grounds and constant cleaning of the maker.

title: Coffee grounds everywhere!

Thinking it was just a fluke, I tried a second and it happened again. title: Warning: not compatible
review_description: The plastic is too thick that my Keurig 2.0 K350's bottom pin doesn't puncture it (to pass water). So the machine stops after about 4 seconds. Or maybe the design of the cup is incompatible with 2.0 machines. Yes I'm stuck with this. My work-around is to allow the machine to mark the bottom hole on the K-Cup, and I remove the K-Cup and create a bigger hole with a small phillips screwdriver. I return the K-Cup and line it up with the pin. I close it. Brew again. Then it works.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Right flavors, wrong box name
review_description:
Let me start by saying, I got exactly what I thought I would get and could not be happier. I love crazy cups in general and there's not one flavor in this box that I dislike. That being said, it's called "flavored lover's variety pack" on Amazon but on the box is labeled "holiday variety pack" which also corresponds with the pictures. This can be confusing but I assure you, what is pictured, is what you get. Other than that - 5 stars, 1 removed for poor description.

Note to seller, you may want to change the name of the item to "holiday variety pack" to match the product picture and actual product.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Not exactly what I thought I was ordering- but all 20 cups were different
review_description: Every single cup was a different flavor- which was a sorta nice surprise, but I had ordered it based on the flavorings it had listed. This was a gift so I chose this listing knowing that my Mom would likely find the listed assortment to her liking. Instead I got 20 cups- every one a different flavor. Some I knew she would NOT like- so my husband who occasionally drinks coffee took the few that sounded good to him, but that we knew were not to her taste- Peanut Butter Cup, etc. I think he selected 6 out of the 20 cups. I would rather have had all 20 be different flavors than multiple of flavors that didn't sound as good- so I consider myself lucky that way. I don't even drink coffee- but it was kinda fun to open box and sort thru flavors before I wrapped the gift.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Coffee or Dessert?
review_description: Love the variety of different flavors! I never know for sure which ones will be included in each shipment so it's like a little surprise. There's ones that are popular flavors that are always included but some that are newer or seasonal flavors too. Some of the flavors are like drinking dessert in a cup what a way to start the day. The only reason I gave 4 out of 5 stars is that you can get a little grit or some grounds in the bottom of you're cup but it doesn't happen in every cup or the same flavor all the time so it's hard to predict until you take your last few sips.

title: All the flavors are delicious except for the Irish creme cheesecake.
review_description:
I absolutely love this flavored hot cocoa variety pack!! All of the flavors are absolutely delicious except for the Irish cream cheesecake, which tastes like dental fluoride. Here are my overall ratings for the flavors:
Frosted cinnamon bun-5/5, I felt like I was drinking a cinnamon roll!!
Peppermint Patty- 4/5, could have a little more peppermint flavor.
Salted caramel fudge-5/5, tasted like caramel fudge ice cream!
Irish cream cheesecake- 1/5, had a very strong dental taste
Peanut butter cup- 5/5, had the perfect amount of peanut butter flavor.
Caramelized banana split- one of my favorites,5/5.
Molten chocolate souffle-4/5, could have a little more chocolate flavor in it. Update: I ended up ordering the 20 pack this time and I got the red velvet hot chocolate in my variety pack! I brewed some of it in my Keurig this morning and the color was absolutely gorgeous 😁
cleaned_reviews: i absolutely love this flavored hot cocoa variety pack!! all of the flavors are absolutely delicious except for the irish cream cheesecake, which tastes like dental fluoride. here are my overall ratings for the flavors: frosted cinnamon bun-5/5, i felt like i was drinking a cinnamon roll!! peppermint patty- 4/5, could have a little more peppermint flavor. salted caramel fudge-5/5, tasted like caramel fudge ice cream! irish cream cheesecake- 1/5, had a very strong dental taste peanut butter cup- 5/5, had the perfect amount of peanut butter flavor. caramelized banana split- one of my favorites,5/5. molten chocolate souffle-4/5, could have a little more chocolate flavor in it. update: i ended up ordering the 20 pack this time and i got the red velvet hot chocolate in my variety pack! i brewed some of it in my keurig this morning and the color was absolutely gorgeous 😁

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Variety is key!
review_description:
Flavors are mostly good (some im not in love with (PB&Jelly-ewww) but most are tasty! Love banana foster!), coffee is good... Pods are just ok. My 2.0 brewer doesn't recognize about 10-15% of this brand as compatible pods, and occasionally the pin on the bottom squished the pod rather than punching a hole in it as it should (new machine too!)... I can slice the bottom of the pod off and turn it till the machine recognizes it.... It eventually does... But thats sort of a pain. For the price its something ill deal with since its so few of the pods that fail.

Still better than the McCafe pods by far.. Almost 50% of those just squish at the bottom and the pin cant punch its hole.

The Flavors variety with these is more than Ive seen with any other brand which is awesome!! And probably my #1 reason to buy again.

title: Great Sampler Pack for the $
review_description: The variety is really great! I think the pack was well worth the price. 4/5 stars because the expiration date on the box says 12/13/14 (and I just ordered the item a few days ago). If I drank multiple K-cups per day or lived with more than just one other person, this might be alright. However, I know that my husband and I will not go through 50 of these K-cups in less than 60 days. I hope that freshness isn't an issue and they last longer than that. If you're looking for a good variety that offers decaf, teas and hot chocolates, this is your item. Lots of 'Crazy Cup' varieties (thus the seller) and we haven't tried that brand before; hoping it's tasty. I primarily bought this sampler pack to accommodate the family & friends that visit with us; there is something for everyone!

title: Flavors True to Names

title: Better for Office or Large Family
review_description: I was very happy with this purchase for the first couple weeks, but I live by myself and after almost a month of crazy coffee flavors, It gets old. The flavors all ran together and have an overpowering taste. I will still purchase this brand in the future but not this large of quantity. I simply got sick of it. That being said there are a great variety and some pretty tasty flavors. The oatmeal cookie is my favorite. This would be perfect for an office or family with multiple coffee drinkers. I should have bought a smaller quantity to mix in with plain coffee but live and learn. Also, all but one KCup worked with my Keurig 2.0. So thats good!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: As expected, but NOT COMPATIBLE WITH KEURIG 2.0
review_description:
It's about what you would expect. An assortment of medium roast coffees with flavorings. No sweetener so you can sweeten or not with the sweetener of your choice. Personally, I wish I could get dark roast flavored coffees, but these are decent enough.

I deducted one star because the description claims COMPATIBLE WITH BOTH THE 1.0 AND 2.0 KEURIG K CUP BREWERS. These are definitely not compatible with the 2.0 brewer, although you can cheat it with stickers or a clip. My Keurig K575 brewer did not recognize the presence of a K-cup until I installed the SoloClip 2 (bought from Amazon) that I've had sitting next to it waiting for just this experience. Then it was fine.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: THESE DON'T FIT Hamilton Beach! (With Update)
review_description:
NOOOOOOO!!! My 48-cup chocolate sampler arrived this morning and the cups DO NOT FIT in my k-cup brewer!

I have a Hamilton Beach Dual Brewer, and have been using various brands for over a year (I had a Cuisinart k-cup brewer for 5 years before that). I had one variety which the brewer didn't always pierce the top foil, but I learned to check that and puncture with a chopstick. But the Crazy Cups DON'T FIT AT ALL. They won't slide deep enough into the k-cup holder to puncture the bottom, and there is no way I can slide the k-cup holder into the brewer with more than a quarter-inch sticking up on top. I'm adding 2 photos to show how the cups (a Maxwell House decaf) normally fit, and how the Crazy Cups cannot be forced any further down into the Hamilton Beach brewer. SO SAD!

UPDATE: By forcing the cups HARD into the k-cup holder (and having to PRY it out after with a knife!), we were able to get it down enough to close the brewer and make coffee. This stuff tastes GOOD, but the design is not suitable for HB k-cup machines, which cut a notch in the lower corner of the k-cups rather than piercing the bottom as both Keurig and Cuisinart do. I'm afraid of breaking the flexible piercing tool in the bottom of the cups by using these. I may simply wind up emptying the coffee content into the mini-brewing basket that comes with the HB, but that precludes the convenience of having the k-cups in the first place. Sad bunny.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Yummy, but do not work in a Keurig 2.0
review_description: I did get 2 boxes of 24 cups in each, I got 4 of each flavor, and I got all the flavors that were advertised. The flavors are fun and yummy BUT theses cups do not work well in my Keurig 2.0. The cups are larger than a normal k-cup and also contain more coffee grounds. When used in my Keruig, it causes a build up of water in the k--cup and I get an error message about a pressure problem. I have to slowly open the top of my Keurig to release the pressure and then I have a mess of hot water and coffee grounds to clean. The cups also cause the needle on the Keurig to get clogged. Once I cleaned the needle and ran hot water through the machine a couple times, my machine was good to go again. We have refillable k-cups so instead of throwing these out, I decided to open one and just use the grounds in my refillable cup. I'll include a picture so you can see just how many coffee grounds are in these cups!!! I used one scoop like I do for a regular cup of coffee, and the cup on the left is the Crazy Cup that still has enough coffee for 2 more cups (Keep in mind, I don't like strong coffee... if you do, you'd use more grounds per cup :o)

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I really enjoyed the different flavors - I'm not a coffee snob
review_description:
I first received these K-cups as a gift. I really enjoyed the different flavors - I'm not a coffee snob, I just enjoy my morning ritual of a cup of coffee in the still-quiet house before my kids wake up. I finished the gift pack I received and ordered another box. Unfortunately, with this second box, so many of the cups have been overfilled that they break open inside my keurig, spilling coffee grounds all around the machine and into my coffee cup -and sometimes coffee comes pouring out the top of the Keurig. Very disappointing. I mean, when the cups work, they are great, but when they don't, what a waste and a mess. I won't be ordering again :-( Too bad since it's such an interesting flavor variety.

UPDATE: So being as ingenious as I am, I decided to try to remedy the overfill situation so as to not waste the remaining K-cups. I have been placing the cup into the Keurig and closing the lid to get the punctures in the cup. I then remove the cup, tap out about a teaspoon worth of the grounds, and then replace the cup into the Keurig ensuring the existing puncture holes line up. Then I brew a cup of coffee. Voila! Problem solved. I'm still not increasing the star rating though since I shouldn't have to do this to enjoy my coffee ;-)
