flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Just meh..
review_description: I really wanted to love this coffee. I love the names and the flavors that are promised. Unfortunately, I don't think the flavors are all that flavorful. I'm a huge fan of flavored coffees with no sugar or calories but these are so lightly flavored that you can't even tell what it's supposed to be. My family did some blind taste tests and the universal answer to "what flavor is this" was "I like it but I don't know what it is". We couldn't even name the flavor when given a multiple choice of three. I much prefer my coconut mocha to taste like chocolate and coconut, etc. I thought maybe it was just my aging palate, but my 25 year old can't recognize the flavors either. I guess I'll have to stick to my Gloria Jean and Donut Shop, though the choices are becoming limited at my local retailers due to everyone and their brother jumping on the K-cup bandwagon. It's so annoying seeing 40 different brands of "Breakfast Blend", knowing that you have to buy a whole box of each to try it. Buying coffee has become as confusing and annoying as buying wine or beer with such a head-spinning variety and no way to make an educated choice. Anyone know of a multiple brand/flavor "coffee tasting"? lol

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I would order again if I knew they'd have at least 2 of each flavor in a box
review_description:
My order contained two 24-count boxes of coffee. The Chocolate Lovers Variety Pack was evenly divided. The Flavored Coffee Variety Pack had 7 cinnamon churro, 7 pumpkin vanilla, 6 salted caramel, 2 caramel sundae, 1 oatmeal cookie and 1 banana foster. We were disappointed because we both had wanted to try a cup of each of them.
In terms of the coffee itself, I find that I smell the aroma more than taste the flavor. I don't mind because it is enough to make me feel as though I'm having a little treat. I also like that the coffee is strong and gives me a little wake up zing. My husband thinks they taste harsh but does enjoy the aroma. We have a few more flavors to try, but at this point the banana is our favorite.
We have a Keurig mini and had no problem using the K-cups, although sometimes I did have to press the cup down into the hole to get it pierced since the plastic seemed thick. Other than that, all was good. The water brewed through it in regular time and there was no leaking.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Good coffee, but watch out.
review_description:
I have ordered these for a few years and have never had a problem, until now. I ordered these in Feb. And did not start using them until around the 27-28, the first one I used was oatmeal cookie, it only gave me a half cup from a setting of 12oz. and clogged up the coffee maker with grounds, had to take the machine apart to clean it.
The next pod I tried was pumpkin vanilla creme, same thing happened, again, had to disassemble the machine apart and clean it, it seems like there was to much coffee in the pods, coffee was running out the top of the pod and down into the coffee maker,therefore clogging up the machine.
There where four each of these pods and everyone did the same thing,clog the machine.
If anyone else has had this problem, maybe the company needs to know about it.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Typically good, but inconsistent, flavor
review_description: This was a good bargain and is the 2nd time I purchased Crazy Cups. I do not know if the age of the product has anything to do with it, but the flavors are not strong. They have cool-sounding names, but the taste doesn't quite live up to the names. Still, the coffee is tasty if a bit inconsistent in strength. Some are strong and flavorful while other pods seem a bit faint. The first set I bought was better, so I may have gotten some that were on the shelf too long. I'd buy them again...if only to break this tie: one excellent batch, one less so.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Went to give 5 Stars, but noticed this..
review_description:
The flavor is excellent and the price is good! I Really enjoy the variety of delicious flavors. I gave the product 3 stars due to the construction of the PODS. The plastic casing is too thick. This causes the containers to snap and break when placed into the Keurig. Rather than simply being pierced by the mechanism as designed. I've taken the pod out and seen a chunk busted out of the bottom on several occasions. This concerns me because I'm worried that it may damage my expensive Keurig machine, or, I may drink slivers of fractured plastic from the containers when they break.
Fix the design and you've got a great product.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Some Bad and Most are Just OK
review_description: Overall these K-cups are just OK. It is nice that they come in a variety pack so there is a multitude of flavors to try, but frankly some the flavors are not good at all. I find the Chocolate Chipotle Mole to be one of the worst K-cups I've ever tasted. There are some flavors that I should have really enjoyed like Chocolate Coconut Dream (I pictured it tasting like a Mounds Bar) but even that was just OK. The more exotic flavors like Pumpkin and Banana Foster didn't really have a strong flavor either and if I'm going to have something "Crazy" like that I want to at least taste it. There just wasn't really enough in this mix to make me want to order again or even order a single flavor for that matter. The K-cup market is very saturated with some quite good coffees so its likely best to look elsewhere.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Good coffee, poorly functioning product
review_description: As good as this coffee tastes, unfortunately it will not function in my Keurig. I don't know if the coffee/flavoring is ground too fine or if the internal filter is too efficient but the water does not pass through. I end up with about a quarter cup of coffee. It seems to push the water into the pod faster than it can release out the bottom. When I flip the pod access open, water/grounds ooze up out of the top of the pod. I've pulled out my mini Mr. Coffee with the mesh metal basket and I can open the pods and brew the coffee in it but it still seems to have the pass-through issue. If they can fix this problem, I'd buy it again because the flavors are good (especially the chipotle one!).
cleaned_reviews: as good as this coffee tastes, unfortunately it will not function in my keurig. i don't know if the coffee/flavoring is ground too fine or if the internal filter is too efficient but the water does not pass through. i end up with about a quarter cup of coffee. it seems to push the water into the pod faster than it can release out the bottom. when i flip the pod access open, water/grounds ooze up out of the top of the pod. i've pulled out my mini mr. coffee with the mesh metal basket and i can open the pods and brew the coffee in it but it still seems to have the pass-through issue. if they can fix this problem, i'd buy it again because the flavors are good (especially the chipotle one!).

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: "Flavors" are nonexistent after brewing
review_description: The "flavors" are incredibly subtle, as many other reviewers have pointed out. They smell amazing while brewing, but taste like watered down coffee afterwards. Some flavors, such as the Pumpkin Spice", are downright terrible and taste sour. Unfortunately this purchase comes with 2 boxes of the same few flavors, so you'll have plenty to get through if you don't care for one. More than likely I won't purchase these again. I've ordered other flavored K-Cups that can be used with a bit of creamer (or none) and taste wonderful. These need several doses of creamer and sugar to even be palatable; you shouldn't have to doctor up coffee like that. The two stars are because I had no issues fitting/using them in my Keurig like other buyers.
cleaned_reviews: the "flavors" are incredibly subtle, as many other reviewers have pointed out. they smell amazing while brewing, but taste like watered down coffee afterwards. some flavors, such as the pumpkin spice", are downright terrible and taste sour. unfortunately this purchase comes with 2 boxes of the same few flavors, so you'll have plenty to get through if you don't care for one. more than likely i won't purchase these again. i've ordered other flavored k-cups that can be used with a bit of creamer (or none) and taste wonderful. these need several doses of creamer and sugar to even be palatable; you shouldn't have to doctor up coffee like that. the two stars are because i had no issues fitting/using them in my keurig like other buyers.

review_description:
I really wished this product was better. The flavors seemed amazing but unfortunately there are problems with Crazy Cups.
The scent of each is amazing I will grant them that. However, the flavor is lacking. Yes there is a hint of flavor but for the most part it's just plain coffee tasting.
Another problem is the actual cups themselves. They are thicker than normal k-cups which means some makers may have issues piercing the bottom of each cup. I noticed the brewing is slower also. I'm not sure if this is due to the thicker cup design or if the coffee is more densely packed in each cup.
Overall, I felt disappointed with Crazy Cups. I wanted it to be so much better.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Bad Fitting Pods!
review_description: It’s a shame these pods just destroy the Keurig coffeemaker because the variety of flavors is very good. I tried pressing down on the pods so the hole would puncture but sometimes the coffee just leaked out the top! What a mess! I admit I was warned by other reviewers...shoulda listened!! Sometime it worked and I enjoyed a lovely full cup of coffee. But that happened rarely. I sincerely hope they rework those pods. But at this point I advise you to avoid CRAZY CUPS!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Cups spew coffee everywhere.
review_description: Most importantly, these cups tend to explode in the keurig. The tops don’t seal well so when the machine forces water and air in the seal pops and Coffee grounds end up all over the machine, in your coffee, and on the wall. I’m halfway through the box and this has happened about 5 times. I also found the flavors to be too artificial. I appreciate that they probably make the tops easy to open so you can pull the filter out and recycle the cups. I definitely hate throwing a plastic cup away every day so kudos to them for trying, but the mess is ridiculous.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I actually really love the flavors
review_description:
I actually really love the flavors, and didn't have any problem using them on my 2.0 brewer like some reviewers have mentioned.

However, they really need to look into how they're sealing their pods. These things constantly explode in my machine, wasting a cup and creating a huge mess to clean up. I've gone through entire cartons where every pod exploded and was wasted. I RMA'd once, and the return went smoothly without questions. I appreciated that, but I continue to have problems and sadly won't go back to this brand until they change their pod design.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Underwhelming flavor and clogged my machine
review_description:
I saw this on sale with a bunch of crazy flavors that mostly sounded like ones I'd like. I'm a fan of the Cafe Escapes mocha latte and chai latte which have quite a bit of flavor along with the coffee and expected these to be similar. I've tried many flavors from many brands. These were disappointing.

Flavor:
The first I tried, based on my girlfriend's selection, was the pumpkin vanilla. Strong coffee taste. Was that a hint of pumpkin? I'm not sure, maybe. I tried another flavor, same thing. I selected the Peppermint Chocolate Mocha next figuring that'd be a good one to see if there actually is any flavor since peppermint would likely stand out. Yes, I did detect a slight hint of peppermint. I mean slight.

Compatibility:
I have a Keurig Vue V500 machine which takes Vue cups. I use a k-cup adapter. This has worked fine with every k-cup I've ever used, until now. These cups are a harder plastic than most and the rim around the top is thicker. With the adapter, sometimes cups dent rather than pierce the bottom when inserting. For this reason, I place the cup in the adapter and then slap it home. This has never been a problem. After slapping these into the k-cup adapter, they sat noticeably higher than any other cup I've used. I'm a big 6'4" guy. Trust that it's not an issue of not hitting it hard enough. Closing the machine on these was cringe-worthy, with more effort required than usual and more noise, but ultimately seemed okay. I used about four of these before my machine spit out half a cup while sounding very strained. I've heard the machine slow down before and running a few cycles with no k-cup generally clears that up by pushing out some grounds. I've now run over a dozen cycles and it's improved slightly but still sounds strained and is only producing 6 ounces instead of 8.

UPDATE: I finally consulted the user guide on cleaning. The little plastic slide-out tray it tells you to pull out and clean did indeed have some build up to be removed. This, however, clearly wasn't the problem as I could see no blockage. I sprayed it out with kitchen faucet sprayer, soaked in hot soapy water and sprayed again. Ran another cycle with no improvement. Next, I peered down inside the machine from the top to view the two needles which mount near the front facing the back. I was able to take a can of compressed air I usually use for blowing dust out of my computer and used it on the needles. I ran another cycle and the pump sounded more normal. It provided 8 ounces again and some grounds were in the cup. I ran a couple more cleaning cycles, spraying the needles with compressed air once more between them and now the machine is running normally.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: What a mess!
review_description: While the flavor is great, these pods do not work! I've had about 3 -4 that worked fine but the rest, halfway through brewing, nothing else comes out. when I open the top of my machine coffee grounds and hot water go everywhere. flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Save your money and sanity
review_description:
Do not buy these cheap ass kcups. We’ve had them in the past on the random mixed boxes Amazon sells and never had issues with them before as bad as these. We did notice you would get a random cup that just wouldn’t work or brew. Almost every single one of these cups blew water out of the top of my kuerig. Water everywhere.
For a while now my husband would tell me he was having issues with some of them again and about the one time grounds exploded everywhere. I thought he was exaggerating. Until today. Father’s Day, decided to make my
Man a cup for all the hard work he does. I pull one and pop it in. These little bastards started working if you push them in hard and pop the bottom first then close to pop the top. If you didn’t pop the bottom, hot water would spray you in the face, and spit brown water everywhere.
So anyway, pop in a Salted Carmel one and a few seconds later, water is spraying me in the back and ground coffee is coming out of the front of the Kuerig like ground brown lava. Just spewing and dripping into the cup below. Needless to say- he was right. The cups were trash! Never again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety 4 Pks 24 Cups
title: You do NOT get what you pay for!!!!!!!!!!!!
review_description: I received my box today...the selling description had a list of 20 different types of COFFEE that I was supposed to get but instead I received a box of mostly hot chocolates (9 to be exact) plus duplicates, a pumpkin one which is clearly leftover from last Fall, and chai lattes which I hate! I made a list of what was supposed to be included in the box and only FOUR (with two duplicates) were actually included. The value of coffee vs. hot chocolate is not the same...I paid for 20 K-cups of coffee not hot chocolate! I would NEVER have ordered this selection if the actual list had been provided correctly. Of course I understand a couple might be substituted but certainly not 16 out of 20! Plus I didn't even get the ones I actually wanted!!!! There was no Maple Sleigh, no Vanilla Skyline, no Hazelnut, no Chocolate Glazed Donut, no Cinnamon Roll, no Butter Toffee, no Mudslide, no Caramel Vanilla Cream, no Mocha Fudge, no Southern Pecan, no Blueberry, no Toasted Cinnamon, no Kahlua, no Crème Caramel, and no Jamaica Me Crazy! There were in fact only FOUR actually from the list included, two of which had duplicates. Don't waste your money on this "selection"!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Bad seals will ruin your coffee drinking experience and require cleaning your machine
review_description:
Save your money and yourself some frustration.

The seals on this product are defective resulting in coffee grounds in your coffee and in your coffee machine. The first ruins the coffee drinking experience, and the second requires you to disassemble the coffee machine to clean the grounds out fo the unit. When the seals done blow out you will have a mess on your hands. The coffee itself is good but the work involved in cleaning the machine is just not worth it.

Secondly, the thickness of the injection molded plastic of the K-cup is too thick for the needle inside the machine to puncture the K-cup as it is supposed to do. This causes an "over-pressure" error message and a wasted K-cup. The company should do some quality assurance testing and resolve these two issues. That being said, I do enjoy the flavor of the coffee. Now off to cleaner my Kruig

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Crazy Cups = partial cups of coffee
review_description: These k-cups do not work in my Keurig machine. The problem is that only about 1/2 to 2/3rds of the water I put in the machine comes out as coffee. This has never happened with any brand of k-cup I bought before, and it did not happen the first time I purchased Crazy Cups. I have tried about a dozen of the cups and it happens with every one. The first time I bought Crazy Cups I loved all the different flavors and I got full cups of coffee, so I placed a second order. Unlike the first order, this batch came in two Crazy Cup packages inside the Amazon box. Oddly, the k-cups were loose in the Amazon box the first time I ordered them. I also just opened the second package of k-cups and the same thing happened, partial cups of coffee. This order was an unfortunate waste of money.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety 4 Pks 24 Cups
title: Never again
review_description:
I hadn't ordered these sampler packs in some time because they tended to be full of everything except caffeinated coffee. Tea, the cups filled with powdered drinks, the 'christmas' coffees that most people find disgusting, and decaf. I'm still trying to figure out why anyone would make, let alone buy, cups filled with powdered instant coffee or cocoa. You could buy better quality instant drink powder for a lot less and just use the keurig to make hot water.

These were on sale, so I took a chance. Mmm hmm, golden french toast from christmas, a bunch of powdered instant cappuccino, and plenty of decaf.

That will pretty much do it for me for this particular brand. I'd been hoping that with the torrents of bad reviews (the christmas coffees dominating the 'summer sampler' should have been the end) that they'd get the hint and stop putting the ultra cheap and out of season coffees and so much decaf in the boxes. Doesn't appear to have made a dent.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Pod Exploded Grounds Everywhere
review_description:
I was looking forward to the chocolate coffee. However, when I put it in my iCoffee, the pod exploded and made a mess where you put the pod. Also, I only ended up with half a cup of coffee that was full of grounds. I had to clean up all the grounds all over the machine. I thought it was just a problem with the one cup, but the same thing happened when I tried it again.

When I tried another pod from a different brand, I didn't have this issue. Something about these particular cups backing up. I have used this brand in the past. On thing I noticed is the top is rounded, where the other cups are flat.

Now I need to fish these out of the basket I store them in to send them back.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I love the taste of the brand
review_description:
I love the taste of the brand, but have been Very unhappy with the performance. I have a Keurig and approximately 30% of them will work properly. For the remaining, I have to break the top and brew it in the cup I have for coffee in bags. I have even used that filter so much, I broke it last week. I have tried turning the crazy cup, to slamming the brewer down on the cup harder, but with very little luck. I have ordered several boxes and have found no pattern at this point. Those which I have bought at the grocery store do better, but I don't know why. Thank you so very much for asking about my purchase.
Sincerely,
Juli Mignone Bishop

title: Don't waste your money if you have a 2.0!!!
review_description: These do not work at all with my 2.0!! title: Out of the ordinary, mostly delicious flavored coffees
review_description:
Overall, I really enjoyed these. Most of the flavors are quite unique, which is what made me decide to buy this. I get tired of the same old, same old and enjoy novelty. Not every flavor was to my liking, but I do like most of them.

I’ll go through each flavor and quote what the box says about each, followed by my own opinion on it. I do not claim to be a coffee expert of any kind, just a coffee fan, and a fan of the Keurig system in particular.

I used the larger cup setting on my Keurig (roughly 10 oz of water) for each, since these cups each contain .45 oz of coffee, which is more than the typical .30-.35 oz k-cup. And I like a big cup of coffee. I drank each one black with one Splenda.

The package arrived containing two boxes of 24 capsules each. Each box had six different flavors; four of each.

One major plus, unlike other brands, Crazy Cups are recyclable. Just pull off the lid, dig out and discard the filter and coffee grounds, and then the lid and cup can be rinsed out and recycled.

A possible minus - my Keurig’s brewer needle got partially clogged while I was testing these. (A little bit of coffee spilled inside the machine.) I don't know if it was the fault of the Crazy Cups, but since the last time this happened was another time I used a off-brand cup, it's a good possibility. I gave my machine a thorough cleaning and de-scaling and it’s fine now.

Box 1:

Pumpkin Vanilla Créme: “Treat yourself to the flavor of vanilla-laced pumpkin pie topped with sweet créme." Pumpkin spice isn’t my favorite type of flavor, and this one does taste like what you’d expect from a pumpkin spice coffee. I can smell the vanilla but can’t taste it. I did taste sour notes which I’m not a fan of. I’ll be saving this one for guests who ARE big pumpkin spice fans.

Bananas Foster Flambé: “Vanilla ice cream and bananas smothered in dark rum, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Treat yourself to The Big Easy’s classic happy ending." I cannot smell or taste any banana at all. Which is ok, because as much as I love the actual bananas foster dessert, I hate artificial banana flavoring. This is a good coffee, but the only promised flavor I can taste is something sweet, maybe brown sugar. Not vanilla, cinnamon, nor rum. So, why call it Bananas Foster? I like this one but unless my palette is just way off, the name and description are misleading.

Caramel Truffle Sundae: “Dive into the decadence of a sweet caramel, chocolate, and nut ice cream sundae. Just remember to come up for air.” This one is pretty good, though I couldn’t taste anything beyond chocolate and caramel (and coffee of course) here.

Salted Caramel: “Treat yourself to an indulgent cup of rich coffee with the creamy, dreamy taste of salted caramel. Your tastebuds will thank you.” This one was disappointing. Though it smelled lovely, I struggled to taste any caramel. Maybe I’m mixing up salt and sour, but personally I found the predominant note to be sour.

Frosted Oatmeal Cookie: “Experience the taste of fresh-baked, vanilla-frosted oatmeal cookies, and take a flavor trip down memory lane.” This one tastes and smells about as much as its name and description as possible. The predominant flavor was cinnamon, though there is definitely a sense of warm vanilla as well. Whatever, this one is just delicious.

Cinnamon Churro: “It’s coffee with the taste of just-fried dough, rolled in cinnamon and sugar. Ay Caramba!" This one is delicious. I can definitely smell cinnamon and butter. The taste is mostly cinnamon but I do detect buttery notes as well. Yum.

Box 2:

Peppermint Chocolate Mocha: “Peppermint, chocolate, and mocha. It’s more than coffee - it’s a party in a mug.” Wonderful. The peppermint is definitely there, but it doesn’t overpower the chocolate flavor.

Chocolate Coconut Dream: “Let the taste of luscious chocolate and creamy coconut coffee transport you to your own private island. Take a sip - you’re livin' the dream.” I loved this one. It’s very similar to Coffee People’s version of this flavor. It does indeed taste how you’d expect. The chocolate is stronger than the coconut.

Italian Chocolate Cheesecake: “Luscious cheesecake meets decadent chocolate at a small caffé in Firenze. Take a sip. Join them.” This smelled amazing (and sure, that might have been a cheesecake scent) and also tasted great. But the taste was just chocolate, to me. I tried really hard to sense any other notes, but…just chocolate coffee. Which is by no means a bad thing. But it did not transport me to Florence.

Chocolate Raspberry Truffle: “A luscious combination of tangy raspberries and rich dark chocolate. Go ahead and brew yourself a cup. You’ve earned it.” Yummy. The chocolate and raspberry flavors are both present and balanced. This is a lot like the Van Houtte version.

Death By Chocolate: “It’s the coffee with a chocolate taste to die for. One sip, and you’re in chocolate nirvana.” Yup, pretty much. Chocolate coffee fans, this is it.

Chocolate Chipotle Mole: “Dark Chocolate and the Chipotle Pepper twins have a torrid affair in a coffee-filled hot tub. Es caliente y es bueno!” This one was tasty but not like the (frankly bizarre) description. I’d call it a solid chocolate flavor, very similar to other brands’ chocolate flavors. I did not sense any chipotle, but I still enjoyed it a lot.
cleaned_reviews: overall, i really enjoyed these. most of the flavors are quite unique, which is what made me decide to buy this. i get tired of the same old, same old and enjoy novelty. not every flavor was to my liking, but i do like most of them. i’ll go through each flavor and quote what the box says about each, followed by my own opinion on it. i do not claim to be a coffee expert of any kind, just a coffee fan, and a fan of the keurig system in particular. i used the larger cup setting on my keurig (roughly 10 oz of water) for each, since these cups each contain .45 oz of coffee, which is more than the typical .30-.35 oz k-cup. and i like a big cup of coffee. i drank each one black with one splenda. the package arrived containing two boxes of 24 capsules each. each box had six different flavors; four of each. one major plus, unlike other brands, crazy cups are recyclable. just pull off the lid, dig out and discard the filter and coffee grounds, and then the lid and cup can be rinsed out and recycled. a possible minus - my keurig’s brewer needle got partially clogged while i was testing these. flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Love the variety! Great flavor!
review_description: I love coffee. My daily cup is an important part of my day. And I am particular. I have one brand of coffee creamer I love....and I only want that kind. I have a favorite cup for work and one for home....and I only make coffee in those cups. See a pattern? :) I'm picky about flavors. It's my one splurge....and I like what I like. Through the last two years and all the stress, strangeness and mess, my one guaranteed blessing each day is my cup of coffee. I took a chance and tried a completely new brand....I liked the mix of flavors in the variety pack and decided I would suck it up and branch out. I also bought a box of decaf coffee pods from this same company. I was pleasantly surprised!!! I enjoyed every flavor, and will be trying more! My favs from the chocolate variety pack? Raspberry truffle and the Peanut butter chocolate one were my top two, but all were tasty!! The pods brewed perfectly in my Keurig. No problems. Yummy coffee!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Issues with Keurig
review_description:
The flavors of these k-cups are really strong and really delicious. However, my Keurig Classic shuts off when I load them. I'm not sure if it's the material of the cups or the slight rounding, but the lower needle doesn't pierce through the bottom of the cup and the machine shuts off as a safety precaution. I have to push on the cup while stabilizing the bottom of the Keurig cup holder to manually pierce the bottom of the Crazy Cup before closing the cup holder and selecting my brew size.

It took me a couple of days to figure out the issue since opening and shutting and removing the cup and replacing it, and turning the machine on and off, switching outlets, etc., would eventually result in the bottom of the cup being pierced and a successful brew. I thought something was wrong with my Keurig -- it was really frustrating. Now I just have to make sure I hear and feel the needle go through the cup before I close the holder, which is sometimes more difficult than others. It definitely adds an extra step, stress, and frustration to a process that is completely designed to be hassle-free.

As I stated before, the flavors of these cups are phenomenal. I haven't decided if I will reorder, though, since these are a big pain in the neck.
cleaned_reviews: the flavors of these k-cups are really strong and really delicious. however, my keurig classic shuts off when i load them. i'm not sure if it's the material of the cups or the slight rounding, but the lower needle doesn't pierce through the bottom of the cup and the machine shuts off as a safety precaution. i have to push on the cup while stabilizing the bottom of the keurig cup holder to manually pierce the bottom of the crazy cup before closing the cup holder and selecting my brew size. it took me a couple of days to figure out the issue since opening and shutting and removing the cup and replacing it, and turning the machine on and off, switching outlets, etc., would eventually result in the bottom of the cup being pierced and a successful brew. i thought something was wrong with my keurig -- it was really frustrating. now i just have to make sure i hear and feel the needle go through the cup before i close the holder, which is sometimes more difficult than others. it definitely adds an extra step, stress, and frustration to a process that is completely designed to be hassle-free. as i stated before, the flavors of these cups are phenomenal. i haven't decided if i will reorder, though, since these are a big pain in the neck.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Smells, good, a bit weak in flavour (but no more so than regular cups), larger cup size
review_description:
First of all, this coffee pack DOES come with 12 flavours. Reviewers that claim the package only comes with 6 may not have realized that one side of the box lists 3 flavours and the other side of the box lists 3 different flavours. 2 boxes x 3 flavours per side x 2 sides = 12 flavours. When you open the box, the flavours are stacked so that you have to dig to the bottom to get the all the different flavours.

The twelve flavours for this kit are:

Peppermint Chocolate Mocha
Chocolate Raspberry Truffle
Italian Chocolate Cheese
Chocolate Coconut Dream
Chocolate Chipotle Mole
Death by Chocolate
Pumpkin Vanilla Creme
Froasted Oatmeal Cookie
Caramel Truffle Sundae
Bananas Foster Flambe
Cinnamon Churro
Salted Caramel

All of the coffee that we did brew out of this kit smelled really nice. I think that's the best part of the kit. I found the coffee that got brewed to be a little on the weak side, but I have that same issue with all coffee brewed with a Keurig cup so it's no worse than normal. The cup size does run slightly larger than the standard Keurig cups, which isn't a problem for the Keurig coffee maker, but may mean it doesn't fit into a k-cup tray. I ordered the  DecoBros Crystal Glass Coffee Storage Drawer Holder for Keurig K-Cup Pods  and they are slightly too large for the tray and I find I have to stack them sideways instead of upright.

Overall, for the fun flavours I think it's a sampler pack worth getting, but I wish the coffees were stronger tasting and the cups more standard size.

title: Delicious!
review_description: My husband LOVES this coffee!!
cleaned_reviews: my husband loves this coffee!!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great Stuff!!
review_description:
*Note, I added two packs of Equal and a splash of skimmed milk to each cup of coffee.

Chocolate Chipotle Mole - Smooth subtle chocolate taste with a hint of chipotle for flavor, not spice or heat - 5/5

Chocolate Raspberry Truffle - You can definitely smell the raspberry, but the taste of it is very subtle. The chocolate taste is also quite mild, still not too bad overall - 3/5

Italian Chocolate Cheesecake - Subtle smooth creamy chocolate flavor, nothing fancy, and nothing that in my opinion taste like cheesecake, still good though - 4/5

Chocolate Coconut Dream - Smooth chocolate and coconut flavors that compliment each other, both distinguishable, neither overpowering - 5/5

Death by Chocolate - Really nice chocolate flavor, if you like a good mocha. I didn't find the chocolate to be overpowering as the name might suggest - 5/5

Peppermint Chocolate Mocha - Mellow mint flavor complimented by a smooth chocolate flavor, so actually tastes like the name! - 5/5

Salted Caramel - Mild caramel taste, salted caramel aftertaste - 3/5

Bananas Foster Flambé - Nice banana flavor, I've never had bananas foster flambé, but if that's what it tastes like then I should probably give it a try - 4/5

Cinnamon Churro - Distictive cinnamon flavor really came through quite nicely - 5/5

Pumpkin Vanilla Crème - Distinctive spice flavor, perhaps 'pumpkin spice', I did not sense any hint of vanilla - 2/5

Caramel Truffle Sundae - I honestly can't say I could distinguish any caramel, truffle, or sundae flavors. That being said it has a different yet good taste - 3/5

Frosted Oatmeal Cookie - Subtle cinnamon/vanilla flavor with a noticable cinnamon aftertaste - 4/5

Overall I really enjoy these flavors and at only $0.56/cup is a steal. Would buy again, highly recommended if you enjoy a good variety!
cleaned_reviews: *note, i added two packs of equal and a splash of skimmed milk to each cup of coffee. chocolate chipotle mole - smooth subtle chocolate taste with a hint of chipotle for flavor, not spice or heat - 5/5 chocolate raspberry truffle - you can definitely smell the raspberry, but the taste of it is very subtle. the chocolate taste is also quite mild, still not too bad overall - 3/5 italian chocolate cheesecake - subtle smooth creamy chocolate flavor, nothing fancy, and nothing that in my opinion taste like cheesecake, still good though - 4/5 chocolate coconut dream - smooth chocolate and coconut flavors that compliment each other, both distinguishable, neither overpowering - 5/5 death by chocolate - really nice chocolate flavor, if you like a good mocha. i didn't find the chocolate to be overpowering as the name might suggest - 5/5 peppermint chocolate mocha - mellow mint flavor complimented by a smooth chocolate flavor, so actually tastes like the name! - 5/5 salted caramel - mild caramel taste, salted caramel aftertaste - 3/5 bananas foster flambé - nice banana flavor, i've never had bananas foster flambé, but if that's what it tastes like then i should probably give it a try - 4/5 cinnamon churro - distictive cinnamon flavor really came through quite nicely - 5/5 pumpkin vanilla crème - distinctive spice flavor, perhaps 'pumpkin spice', i did not sense any hint of vanilla - 2/5 caramel truffle sundae - i honestly can't say i could distinguish any caramel, truffle, or sundae flavors. that being said it has a different yet good taste - 3/5 frosted oatmeal cookie - subtle cinnamon/vanilla flavor with a noticable cinnamon aftertaste - 4/5 overall i really enjoy these flavors and at only $0.56/cup is a steal. would buy again, highly recommended if you enjoy a good variety!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Lots of flavors to keep changing things up!
review_description: I love that there are so many flavors! I am not a fan of drinking the same thing all the time. These allow me to change it up all the time.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I like the coffee
review_description: I like the coffee. I am not one to complain about the flavors, so I did not sit down and count out to see how many flavors I got and compare to the description given as to what I was supposed to have gotten. So, I will be very happy to drink whatever is in this shipment. However, there is one thing that is in the description that I found to be inaccurate, at least for my particular brewer. The first cup out of the box did not work in my Keurig 450 2.0. However, the description states that these are compatible with both 1.0 and 2.0 brewers. I did not even try any other cups out of the box. I had also ordered another box shipment of cups with this particular order that did state they were not compatible with 2.0 brewers, so I also ordered at Solo Clip at the same time with this order (thankfully). Once I installed the Solo Clip (very easy to install....and can remain in my brewer even with Keurig cups), my 2.0 read the cup just fine, and I was able to brew a very tasty cup of coffee....just as if I was using an original Keurig cup. So, I would suggest ordering a Solo Clip with these if you have a 2.0 brewer. These might work in some 2.0 brewers just fine, but did not seem to read in mine.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Not conveniently recyclable but most of them taste great
review_description: I really like some of the flavors, but since there are 3 that don't appeal to me (raspberry, coconut and banana - really?), I can't quite say that I LOVE the product. I recently stopped adding sugar to my coffee, but I do add milk. Having gotten used to drinking coffee without sugar (but still prefering sweeter coffee flavor) I found these to be full of flavor, even though they don't taste sweet. Don't be concerned (as I was) about the appearance of the cups. The little tab as pictured in the product photos makes the cups resemble another style of K-cup that does not fit standard kcup machines. These cups are the standard cups, the tab is not plastic, it is just an extension of the thin foil top allowing you to peel off the top and empty the cup out in order to recycle it. I had good intentions of doing this, but after burning my hands a couple of times because I was too impatient to wait for the coffee grinds to cool, I lost my will to recycle and the cups now go the way all the other cups go... in the garbage.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Works in my Keurig 2.0 brewer
review_description:
I received all of the flavors as indicated, thankfully since I see that is hit or miss from other reviewers. Death by chocolate, chocolate chipotle mole, chocolate raspberry truffle, peppermint chocolate mocha, chocolate coconut dream, Italian chocolate cheesecake (spelled chessecake on the k-cup), frosted oatmeal cookie, cinnamon churro, pumpkin vanilla creme, bananas foster flambe, salted caramel, and caramel truffle sundae. The flavoring is not overpowering, just enough.

I got a 2.0 Keurig brewer around last August and these have been working fine in it. I have tried about four of the chocolate flavors and love them. I really enjoy flavored coffees. The foil tops are made to easily peel off so you can dump the grounds into the trash or compost and recycle the rest of the k-cup which is exactly what I was looking for. Oh and these are VEGAN! Yay!

I had to minus one star though because the box of chocolate flavors has an expiration date in May of this year which is only 3 months from now. The other box of flavors has an expiration of over a year from now.
cleaned_reviews: i received all of the flavors as indicated, thankfully since i see that is hit or miss from other reviewers. death by chocolate, chocolate chipotle mole, chocolate raspberry truffle, peppermint chocolate mocha, chocolate coconut dream, italian chocolate cheesecake (spelled chessecake on the k-cup), frosted oatmeal cookie, cinnamon churro, pumpkin vanilla creme, bananas foster flambe, salted caramel, and caramel truffle sundae. the flavoring is not overpowering, just enough. i got a 2.0 keurig brewer around last august and these have been working fine in it. i have tried about four of the chocolate flavors and love them. i really enjoy flavored coffees. the foil tops are made to easily peel off so you can dump the grounds into the trash or compost and recycle the rest of the k-cup which is exactly what i was looking for. oh and these are vegan! yay! i had to minus one star though because the box of chocolate flavors has an expiration date in may of this year which is only 3 months from now. the other box of flavors has an expiration of over a year from now.

title: Tastes Like I Bought from a Coffee Shop
review_description:
You can trust this review because it's coming from a coffee flavor-aholic ...

I like to have a different coffee flavor every AM, so I have bought many different mixed flavor k-cup packs from Amazon (and I've tried all the brands that come in those variety packs). I take my coffee with just cream (totally unsweetened), and the flavors stand out even without any sweetness. Highly recommend!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: I love these cups in fact I owned a Keurig coffee ...
review_description: I love these cups in fact I owned a Keurig coffee make and had problems with some of the pods and found that Keurig puts something on their pods to recognize another manufacturers pod. So I looked and found another brand of coffee maker and brought that. delighted with it however now the crazy cups pods are exploding and coffee all over the place. After three incidents I finally looked at the pods. They must have change them maybe to conform to Keurig standards and the bottom needle is not puncturing the pod. I found that I can use a skewer or something sharp and press a hole in it and it works. Now I find that Keurig owners are having the same problem so hope crazy cups rectify this. I've never had a problem with them until the last shipment. But the pods are great and love the flavors. I am going to continue to buy them. Also if you lift up your lid and the pod is not completely down over the needle it hasn't punctured.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: GREAT COFFEE, NOT GREAT CUPS
review_description:
PLEASE READ -- the plastic that makes up these cups is thicker than your standard Keurig brand cups and sometimes the needle will not puncture the bottom of the cup. The machine is trying to make your coffee but the water doesn't have anywhere to go other than back out the top hole through the foil - hence the "pressure" problems and grounds getting everywhere.
SOLUTION -- I have gotten into the habit of pressing the cup down into the holder against the bottom needle until it "pops" then you can close the lid and make coffee as usual without any problems.
ALSO -- if your 2.0 brewer gives you an unsupported k-cup error message, just open and twist the cup around 90 degrees or so, I've noticed sometimes the foil is folded up to where you can see a little bit of silver on the edge which gives the machine some problems, just twist the cup to a clean solid color in the upper left hand side and you won't have any errors.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf

My favorites are the caramel flavored that adds a lot of richness. Also, as a side note, Crazy Cups coffee doesn't make my stomach rumble like some other varieties. I'll be buying this again in the future. If you want a really flavorful, interesting variety pack this is the one to buy.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Delicious, Rich Flavor - Be Aware Most Cups Do Not Work With Keurig 2.0!
review_description: These coffees are delicious! I drink mine black and can taste a hint of the intended flavor in a rich coffee. I believe I have tried all of the flavors and haven't found any I didn't enjoy. As far as I can tell, I received the appropriate number of each flavor as advertised. These cups do contain more coffee than the Keurig cups and I don't like my coffee real strong, so I can run the same cup through 3 times and still have deliciously flavored coffee. My only complaint is that it is advertised as working with the Keurig 2.0 machine. While some cups do, for some reason - even though they all look identical - the majority do not actually work in this machine. I often end up using a reusable pod. I use a carafe size as the cup size does not hold all of the coffee. It works perfectly and I have a piping hot cup of flavorful, rich coffee within seconds. I will definitely be buying this again and again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: The Trouble is Worth the Taste!!! (with Keurig Vue)
review_description: The Trouble is Worth the Taste!!! Some other reviews on here talked about the problems they encountered with these cups when using the Keurig Vue machine...and, yes, troubles happened for me as well...the problem is frequently a message on the Vue machine saying "Oops! this pod not made for the Keurig Vue!" , and then my Keurig would not allow the machine to process the brewing...!) I found that if I place the k cup EXACTLY in the center and place it in gently, but firmly, about 95% of the time it brews perfectly and 2) the times it doesn't work, I simply use a knife to cut open the top of the k-cup, and pour the contents into one of my reusable k-cups, it works perfectly also!! These are so delicious I don't care if occasionally I have to pour the contents into my reusable k-cup, and I have even ceased to enjoy my "starbucks" flavors as much!! CAN'T RECOMMEND THESE ENOUGH!!!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great decaf
review_description:
This tastes great for decaf...lots of flavors to choose from(6 different ones in a 24 count box)

These work perfectly in my krurig kexpress...for those that are having problems with this brand "blowing up" in their machine...don't just slap a pod in a nd c lose the lid..place your pod in the holder and press down firmly with your palm or 3 fingers until you hear a "pop" to ensure the bottom needle pierces the bottom.Then you can close the lid and brew as normal. I've never had any problems with these when doing this.If you are still worried then take a small pin and Pierce a hole in the top of the pod before closing the lid.This will ensure pressure inside pod will not be too high when brewing. Therfore I recommend this brand .btw get in a habit of placing your kpods in your machine this way on ALL brands of kpods and you'll never have any issues!
cleaned_reviews: this tastes great for decaf...lots of flavors to choose from(6 different ones in a 24 count box) these work perfectly in my krurig kexpress...for those that are having problems with this brand "blowing up" in their machine...don't just slap a pod in a nd c lose the lid..place your pod in the holder and press down firmly with your palm or 3 fingers until you hear a "pop" to ensure the bottom needle pierces the bottom.then you can close the lid and brew as normal. i've never had any problems with these when doing this.if you are still worried then take a small pin and pierce a hole in the top of the pod before closing the lid.this will ensure pressure inside pod will not be too high when brewing. therfore i recommend this brand .btw get in a habit of placing your kpods in your machine this way on all brands of kpods and you'll never have any issues!

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great flavors but pods explode
review_description: What a huge disappointment! Just like other reviewers have said, these pods explode in my Keurig. So frustrating when all you want to do is enjoy a cup of flavored coffee. The flavors are great, but what’s the point when - a) you get hardly any coffee out because the machine shut down halfway through, b) you’re trying to enjoy whatever little you got but are too busy spitting out coffee grounds and c) you now have to clean out your entire machine every time you use these pods. I have pods from the Maud’s brand and tested them to see if it was a pod issue or machine issue and those work perfectly fine. What a shame because all 6 of these Crazy Cups flavors were good. I’m not even halfway through my box. I want my money back.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: It Broke my Kuerig Machine
review_description:
At first I thought it was coincidence... the pod had issues and my Kuerig broke... I thought the machine caused the problem with the overflowing pod.
But it seems the overflowing pod caused the problem with the Kuerig.
I used another of these pods the other day... one I had left from a few week ago, before the original Kuerig broke.
The new Kuerig broke!!!!
Once is a coindicence.
Twice is a cause!!!

Too bad too because I really like the flavors, but No coffee pod is worth replacing a $129 Kuerig everytime you use it.
Sorry!!

title: Great variety, excellent taste!
review_description: I've seen some reviews that complained that the assortment was not as promised. I didn't compare what I received to the description so I can't speak to that. What I can say is that I have thoroughly enjoyed every flavor that I received. The pumpkin & oatmeal cookie ended up surprising me as I hadn't expected to like them so much. The mint was not one of my favorites but it was still tasty. In my book you can never go wrong with chocolate & none of the chocolate flavors disappointed. All in all, if you like variety in your morning coffee, this is a great selection. I would highly recommend it.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: These have no differing flavors
review_description:
I don't drink coffee, at all, I'm a tea or hot chocolate person. My husband does drink it. He got another brand of coffee in a flavor that smelled amazing and tasted great to me. That brand doesn't have decaf (I also don't drink caffeine) in that flavor, so I found the flavor in this variety pack and figured we should try it. I was excited to get the pack here and immediately tried the Caramel Vanilla decaf. I used sweet n low, and about a tsp of milk. Not one hint of vanilla or caramel. So he tried Death By Chocolate, we were both expecting to smell and taste chocolate...nada. It tased like sweet (because we used sweetener) coffee. We have since tried 8 flavors, making the joke that "maybe this one will smell or taste like the name of it." Nope. I'm drinking White Chocolate Strawberry right now because I bought them so I'm going to drink them...guess what it tastes like...coffee. Plain, normal, coffee.

We won't be buying this brand again.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Great Way to Try Flavors
review_description: Had this brand recommended to me in an online group. I bought this variety pack that had 1 of each flavor in it. It's really a great way to try all the flavors to see which you like, and it didn't cost an arm and a leg. I deducted one star because I didn't get some of the flavors shown and got duplicates of others (only a couple though, not a significant amount). I haven't had one I absolutely hated yet - definitely ones with minimal flavor in them and some that are better than others. It's hit or miss. But I like that if I find a flavor I like, I can buy an entire box of it and am not required to keep purchasing the variety box. (I prefer caffeine in my coffee, but I need to cut back on some of my intake due to headaches, and decaf flavors are impossible to find. Glad these exist.)

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: There are 2 types of pods and 1 does not work with Keurigs
review_description:
I've had to come back and change my review because I realized that sometimes when I order these, I get some pods with an indentation in the bottom and these do not work with Keurigs. I actually thought it was my old Keurig, got a brand new model for Christmas, and everything was fine until my last pod delivery. I haven't gotten the pods with the dent in the bottom in a while but as soon as I tried one, it shut my Keurig down, after filling with water and leaving a mess. I thought it had to be a fluke, but no, it is only the pods with the dent in them that causes the problem. It's a shame because I actually really liked most of the flavors. I may switch to another brand now because I don't want to risk ruining my new Keurig and I am not getting my money's worth if I just throw out the bad pods.

I love the variety! The stores only ever sell hazelnut and French vanilla in decaf. I've ordered these several times now, but may stop because they sometimes send pods that are shaped differently and don't work with Keurig machines.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Good Selection of Flavors for the Decaf Coffee Drinker
review_description:
Update 8/4/18: I have changed my rating of this product from 3 to 5 stars. Since my last review I had to replace my Keurig coffee maker because it finally died on me. My new coffee maker does not have the issues with the K-cups not draining properly and having coffee grounds left in cup. This is now my preferred brand of decaf flavored coffee.

It's almost impossible to find flavored decaf coffee K-cups in the store other than French Vanilla and Hazelnut. I've never understood this as there is a huge market out there for people who like flavored coffee, but can only drink decaf. So I was excited to come across this brand on Amazon. So many interesting flavors! At the time of this writing, I have had 8 selections and for the most part they are pretty good. Although Chocolate Italian Cheesecake is a bit of a stretch. :) My only issue has been with the K-cups themselves. 6 of the 8 I have had so far start off strong when brewing but then at about 15 seconds in, the water starts to slowly drip taking about 3 minutes for it to finish brewing. In the end I get only 2/3 of a typical cup size. When I take K-cup out of the machine, it is very heavy with water indicating that it is not draining completely. So far I have not had the experience that others are reporting of coffee grounds ending up in my cup, but this other issue needs to be looked at by this manufacturer if they want to keep customers beyond the initial trial.
cleaned_reviews: update 8/4/18: i have changed my rating of this product from 3 to 5 stars. since my last review i had to replace my keurig coffee maker because it finally died on me. my new coffee maker does not have the issues with the k-cups not draining properly and having coffee grounds left in cup. this is now my preferred brand of decaf flavored coffee. it's almost impossible to find flavored decaf coffee k-cups in the store other than french vanilla and hazelnut. i've never understood this as there is a huge market out there for people who like flavored coffee, but can only drink decaf. so i was excited to come across this brand on amazon. so many interesting flavors! at the time of this writing, i have had 8 selections and for the most part they are pretty good. although chocolate italian cheesecake is a bit of a stretch. :) my only issue has been with the k-cups themselves. 6 of the 8 i have had so far start off strong when brewing but then at about 15 seconds in, the water starts to slowly drip taking about 3 minutes for it to finish brewing. in the end i get only 2/3 of a typical cup size. when i take k-cup out of the machine, it is very heavy with water indicating that it is not draining completely. so far i have not had the experience that others are reporting of coffee grounds ending up in my cup, but this other issue needs to be looked at by this manufacturer if they want to keep customers beyond the initial trial.

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: More Aroma than Taste ‼️🫤
review_description:
Disappointed- was very anxious to try the variety available- HOWEVER - I have tried several diff “flavor pods” of coffee & so far it seems like the AROMA that each choice of coffee far surpasses the actual flavor of each one- the AROMA that comes up from the cup of hot coffee is so inviting & pleasant-
BUT the actual taste of the coffee itself is very weak ❗️ I drink my coffee black so I was quite surprised & very disappointed- 🤔😖
It’s actually like drinking a cup of hot water that smells good ‼️ Unfortunately I bought 2 boxes- my loss I guess but not to be repeated !

01/31/2023- so I wanted to add something to my review: to remedy the lack of actual coffee flavor & not waste the 2 boxes of pods I ordered I found if I use a half of teaspoon of instant coffee “crystals” it’s a delightful boost to having actual coffee flavor (as opposed to no flavor) & quite drinkable then- TX
cleaned_reviews: disappointed- was very anxious to try the variety available- however - i have tried several diff “flavor pods” of coffee & so far it seems like the aroma that each choice of coffee far surpasses the actual flavor of each one- the aroma that comes up from the cup of hot coffee is so inviting & pleasant- but the actual taste of the coffee itself is very weak ❗️ i drink my coffee black so i was quite surprised & very disappointed- 🤔😖 it’s actually like drinking a cup of hot water that smells good ‼️ unfortunately i bought 2 boxes- my loss i guess but not to be repeated ! 01/31/2023- so i wanted to add something to my review: to remedy the lack of actual coffee flavor & not waste the 2 boxes of pods i ordered i found if i use a half of teaspoon of instant coffee “crystals” it’s a delightful boost to having actual coffee flavor (as opposed to no flavor) & quite drinkable then- tx

flavour: Crazy Cups Flavored Variety Pack Decaf
title: Perfect for the adventurous coffee drinker who gets bored but doesn't want sweet coffees!
review_description: Such an awesome variety pack! This is exactly what is advertised at an awesome price. These are not lattes, they are not sweet in any way shape or form, which I can find hard to, well, find. But since I don't have a sweet tooth, and to be honest I don't need the extra calories that come with a sweet coffee, this is peeeeeerfect for me! Plus they don't shove any of that blasphemous decaffeinated coffee in there either. Every time I offer coffee to a guest now they get excited to pick out their flavor, and for an adventurous girl like me I get excited blind picking a flavor every morning and trying to guess what it is (yeah, I know, I need more excitement in my life...) Haven't had a flavor I disliked, and have had several flavors I have loved so much I've considered just buying those exclusively.
